description:
First of all, this place only opens from 4-11 pm. There's only one lady that works there all the time (believe she's the owner). We really enjoyed everything we ordered. The almond cream is a great decaffeinated drink. Milk tea is good but not warm enough! 
They also offers lot of H.K bake rice so that you can have dinner and dessert all in one place! Have not try the baked rice yet but the portion looks decent. 
The reason why I give a 4 stars is because the service here is extremely slow! So don't come here if you are hungry or on the clock!
author: Jaylene L.

description:
I love this place. This is my go to place after a long day at work.

I know the service is slow, so I always bring a book to read here.

Food is amazing, definitely prepared with caring and love. I have a few must-orders, but I try different things from time to time, and was never let down.

Fruits in desserts are always super fresh.
author: Jing W.

description:
When I first walked by this place, I couldn't believe a restaurant could fit into this space. This small, homey restaurant feels just like being in someone's living room, with eclectic decorations and mix-and-match furniture. The someone, though, is someone who makes super fresh and super delicious Asian food.

Please be kind to the owner, Eugenie. It's a wonder how one can play all the roles of a restaurant without getting frazzled. Yes, the wait will be horrendously long, but can you imagine having to handle multiple stove burners, ovens, blenders, and whatnot all by yourself? Think about it this way; if one person at the table orders baked spaghetti, another orders fried rice, another orders soup, and the other orders clay pot, how many simultaneous pots/pans will she be having to deal with at the same time? Then imagine that times 5(?) for the number of tables in the restaurant. 

The wait is super worth it though. If you come ~5pm you may be one of the first groups there and will have less of a wait. The food was tasty, well-portioned, and fresh. I saw all the photos of the entrees topped with melted cheese and I knew I had to be there. It definitely did not disappoint! This isn't some food that is quickly slapped together; most of these dishes do require intensive preparation!

Definitely enjoyed coming here and recommend it, but eat a small snack beforehand if you're starving! And order dessert at the same time you order your entrees.
author: Brittany L.

description:
Really, truly delicious food prepared with love and care. If you look through the negative reviews, you'll see that most of them are taking issue with something totally unrelated to the food quality (like not having free open internet...I know this is SF, but c'mon, it's a restaurant not a WiFi router).

Portions aren't huge, but I think Americans just need to get used to the idea of having a smaller amount of really high quality food.

My friends and I ordered the ramen with brisket and beef tomato broth (divinely deep, umami flavors) the pork belly clay pot (juicy, flavorful pork with greens and tofu and an egg) and the papardelle with brandy cream sauce (so, so much lighter, more restrained, and more scrumptious than I was expecting). 

For dessert, we had the cha cha bowl (hot coconut milk with black sticky rice, adzuki beans and an outstanding, but solitary, piece of black sesame-filled mochi) and an ice cream pillow (ice cream wrapped up with a crepe--too much whip cream, but the ice cream and crepe combo was perfect).

Such lovely ambiance. Such good, carefully prepared food. Ignore the haters!
author: Adin V.

description: Prices were raised. Dinner sets did not include dessert anymore. Portion sizes are so small. I went to eat there for the dinner special and had to eat again at home. Was so shocked and disappointed I forgot to even took pictures of this meal. Very very disappointing.
author: Wesley K.

description:
Came here with a few people after Bay to Breakers right after they opened. Upon entering, barely a hello followed by a "Cash Only" disclaimer. Yes, we saw that sign in the door, but acknowledged it. We were seated and waiting for two friends who wanted a horchata across the street.

While waiting, I was beginning to have doubts. The woman (maybe the owner) want warm at all - like we were bothering her. Looking at he menu, every entree was above $12 and I only had $25 for the two of us along with my credit card. Cash only. That's BS. Then, I'm realizing she's the only one in the restaurant. How long is it going to take and at what quality when it's just her?

Friends arrive. We're looking at the menu and that's when the woman comes up and just says "no outside drinks." Friend says "ok, we'll just leave it here." She leaves and it's back to the menu when I lost my appetite - eff this place. So, I make the decision to leave and as we're exiting, she never reappeared from the kitchen.

You don't want customers and it shows. When this business closes, I won't care.
author: Bor C.

description:
Ok, actually I don't want to leave any common before.... but this time, I guess most people will have the same feeling or same situation with me. The lady who works there, is totally not polite and bad attitude to her customer.

The first time, we are asking if water services. She said didn't you guys read the water sign there, it's self services! Everyone serve their own! 

The second time, we were asking if WiFi available, she said there is no free WiFi offered! Then I told my frd, they might had paid WiFi. She was angry and said I had same WiFi as your cell phone, the WiFi I had it just I share a hot spot to you, how can I share hot spot to everyone!

I definitely won't go again!
author: Lara G.

description:
This place looks so cute on the outside and there were a couple people waiting so I thought to myself it must be pretty good. But don't be deceived! 

Walked in and half the tables were not being used/not cleaned up. I think there was one person working the entire restaurant (cooking, cleaning, serving) so service was really slow. 

Finally got seated after 15-20 minutes. The food was really good, I must say. We got the sesame dumplings in ginger syrup, sesame dumplings in almond milk and the pillow dessert. The pillow dessert was literally like a mini crepe, cute but nothing special. I really liked my sesame dumplings in almond milk. 

What warrants the two stars is that, instead of cleaning up/bussing the dirty and used plates into the kitchen, the lady working stacked all of them on one table. Unfortunately, we got seated next to the table and it was so gross and unappetizing.
author: Susan P.

description: Came here since I live at SF. I love the food here but wait time is so long. You have to wait 30 mins for a hot plate. And you have to accept the attitude from the lady. LOL
author: Mandy L.

description: Fix your god damn sign on the entrance and open hours on Yelp! Do you open at 3:30pm or 5pm or all day on Sunday? If you don't want to deal with any customer/ human beings, just close the restaurant already!
author: Hei S.

description:
This time is all about the baked rice dishes.  The best is the 13.95 portugese baked rice.  Mine was the tongue in curry sauce.  I like all tje vegetable with my rice.  All in one meal.  Good flavor. We had the durian ice cream with whipped cream pillow.  Good flavor of durian.  
  We had the small restaurant to ourselves.  The restroom requires a key which you get from the front.  There is a sign that you have to order food first or else pay 5.00 to use the toilet.  Water was free.  Tea would cost.  This reminds me of a mom and pop shop.  Everything extra will cost money, bag .10, container cost .50.  Great place for dessert.   Food was yummy.
author: Helen L.

description:
this is my favorite dessert house. i love it with all my heart i hope they stay open forever. it's such a romantic tiny cute little place i always take my friends and people visiting out of town here.

pillows - 10/10
   - this is made from like a really thin crepe wrapped into a pillow shape usually filled with your choice of fruit, cream and optional ice cream.
    - durian with taro ice cream is my go-to it's really good. mango or strawberry with or without ice cream is also good

cha cha- 10/10
   - red bean hot dessert with black sticky rice, coconut milk and sesame dumpling
    - excellent. a bit rich though i would share it

black sesame soy milk - 10/10 
   - soooooooo good omg please get this

kimchi fried rice - 8/10

beef brisket noodle soup - 9/10 
   - i've only ordered their savory foods maybe 2 or 3 times. it takes a while and it seems like they only ever have one employee ( god bless her )
this is definitely a place you should mainly go for to eat dessert. then the service time is pretty reasonable

calamansi honey with coconut jelly/ grass jelly - 6/10
   - really good but way too sweet for me. if you are into that i think you would like it

milk tea - 9/10

sesame dumplings - 10/10
   - standard. good with almond or sesame paste. 

tofu fa - 10/10 fire!!!!

white sticky rice - 10/10
   - i usually get both mango and taro or just taro. really good. huge portion
author: Christine G.

description:
Worst service ever! That's the only common I have. 
Truly recommend for those who want to have a rude experience. Keep up the worst work!
author: Simon T.

description: Kimchee fried rice is both overpriced and extremely mediocre. There was no more than an ounce of beef throughout. Skip
author: Alex S.

description: Once in a while, I come in for desert, the owner - the lesbian short hair Asian lady - is extremely rude. I like their dessert, so I have to ignore her. I like the durian ice cream and tofu fa, durian ice cream roll. The place is small, little disorganized, not very clean, but acceptable. The food is way too expensive.
author: Tiffany J.

description: This is private restaurant and food. Such amazing food and drink. I know this place for 3 years . The taste and quality never change. It hard to find the restaurant like that.
author: Mindy Y.

description: My friend recommended Mango Medley as a fun, quirky, late evening cafe option and a place to have a really cool dessert.  She was right, and I ended up having the most delicious and refreshing dish ever:  mango & pomelo over a sago pudding covered with mango sauce.   The owner was very nice and accommodating, despite the fact that she works alone and that every table was full.  I'll be back!
author: Robyn T.

description:
Since ABC Bakery closed down, I went on a search for a good Hong Kong style cafe that was near my house and open late. Yelp paved the way to this cafe on Judah and 45th. Parking can be difficult in this area, but my boyfriend and I got lucky and snatched a spot right away. 

Now on to the food. It was pretty much a standard cafe offering the typical baked dishes and fruit desserts. Prices were decent at roughly $12 for a baked dish and $6 for dessert. 

Overall, a great late night meal for 2. It's a small nice and cozy restaurant, so I wouldn't come here with more than 4 people. 

Tip:
If you order a baked dish, expect to wait 15 minutes.
author: Briana H.

description:
I was so excited to try this restaurant because my friend swore on its authenticity to Hong Kong food and it was her absolute favorite place.

 was weary of the place at first because of all the negative reviews of the server but she was nice to us! On a Monday night at 7pm, the place was initially packed but everyone seemed to leave at once and it was very quiet. The prices were on the higher side. 

I was surprised to be eating spaghetti, LOL. We ordered the spaghetti bolognese, a vegetable curry with rice, and the clam cream sauce with rice. For dessert, we had mango pillows and a sesame paste + tofu bowl. The spaghetti was pretty good and I finished mine quickly. The rice dishes seemed
enormous. I want to go back to try the spaghetti with the meat leg everyone's posting about. The pillows were good as well. It was my first time trying the sesame paste and I liked it! I guess I expected something more Asian but my friend said the influences Hong Kong had experienced had led to this. 

There was only one server working and things got a bit slow. The bathroom broke after one person used it. Something negative is that a friend of ours wanted the Portuguese dish, and they ran out, so she took more time to look at the menu. They didn't come back to take the order until 25 minutes later, and had said they also ran out of spaghetti (the rest of us were already eating by this time). My friend had to settle for rice and ended up eating when we all had finished. :/ When they brought the plate out, they had the nerve to say "You ordered late, expect it late." ??? imig

We ended up paying like $20 per person and honestly, I can get better food for $20 but it was nice to hang out with my friends. We stayed another 20 minutes after finishing to wait for a bus and they didn't kick us out of anything.

Maybe I'll come again if I'm in the area but this place was not 4 or 5-star material.
author: Michelle V.

description: She  very  rude told us she need to save water and the green curry chicken very salty didn't finish dinner she drop bill not going back shity place don't go she Rude
author: Angela S.

description:
Honestly the owner changed

The first time I had my dinner here I felt sick with the owner attitude. The food was good but if you asked a wrong question the owner said something to you.

After all these year she has changed a lot
And I also understand this business too.

The owner only work by herself. If you are in rush or you are very hungry. I will say ya it is still not the first option for you :)

The place is a place you sit down and enjoy with your love or best friends. Also owners has become more friendly (I did not challenge her, I don't want to ... Still remember the old days lol) I believe seeing our smiles will make her feel better too sometime. Cox she is the only person who prepare food, cook, serve and clean up... When other restaurants have at least 2-3 ppl to do different things, so be patient to her. 

Food are satisfied

We order the coconut soup with vegetable 
Sugar pork something with vegetable (appetizer no 7??)
And baked rice with egg and beef
author: Kevin C.

description:
I ordered dinner combo 
Sea Food Bake over rice plus soup 

Soup was awesome almost as perfect to me.

Bake sea food over rice a little on the salty side 
Everything else was good.

Service, only 1 person working, super slow 
Almost no customer service.

For a restaurant service is very important!! 

I gave 3 stars for room to improve.
author: Mack A.

description: If you enjoy eating in a small, peace place, I will recommend here. Also, the food are delicious !
author: Winnie H.

description:
After eating here, I realized the bad reviews are all for the service. The food is one of the best in the area. Everything we ordered were on point. The pork shoulders appetizer, the kimchi fried rice, the seafood coconut curry and the dessert. I do understand why people think the server is rude. I feel like this is just how she is and she didn't mean to be rude. Next time you come here, don't ask her rhetorical questions just do your research and straight up tell her the orders. 

Will def come back for the food!
author: Siian X.

description:
Came here the other night. There was no one in here but old dishes on tables when we entered. The waitress then comes out and seats us. They do have a lot to offered food wise but the service here is pretty poor. When my friends ordered off the fried rice page, the waitress would shout at them to pick a protein. It isn't that obvious on the menu so instead of nicely explaining she just kept telling us to find it on the menu. My friend didn't want egg in his fried rice and told her. She gives him a fried rice with egg. When he told her, she sighed loudly when she picked up the dish to have it remade. 

The service is pretty bad but the food was decent. I enjoyed my strawberry bliss but the panna cotta tasted a bit funky. 

Not sure if I will come back here. 

Street parking.
author: Sarah C.

description: It was my first time here because my friend said the food was good which I totally agree with but the service is terrible. I believe there's only one person working there who is the owner of the restaurant. I wanted a curry fried rice and I showed her a picture on yelp of what I wanted. It was a picture of the curry fried rice with eggplant and tofu but that choice wasn't even on the menu. It only showed what meats were available with the rice and a vegetarian choice but was not clear of what vegetables were available upon choosing. Immediately after I showed her the picture, she said no and demanded me to choose my choice of meat and other toppings for my fried rice off the menu. First of all the menu is so packed and the lettering is small. It's hard enough to read so I just ordered the most simple dish. A kimchi fried rice. The portions of the food here is pretty worth and is honestly very tasty and delicious but I hated the attitude from the worker. My friends were even scared to ask her for change. If she didn't give as much attitude I think this cafe/restaurant would've been worth it and great.
author: Patricia S.

description:
Best Hong Kong milk tea in the city. Even better than the ones I have had in Hong Kong. The milk tea is so creamy and rich in flavors. It's so addictive.

All the bad reviews about the rude waitress is absolutely true. But I'll put up with all her eye rollings for the best Hong Kong milk tea in the city.
author: J.J. P.

description:
This is such a cute little shop. Doesn't feel like all those other Asian dessert places with the K-pop music videos in the back. Too bad there was only one lady working the entire place. I'd say this place seats 25-30 and it was a full house when I came. I see this little lady running around taking orders, bringing out food, bringing the checks and waters, she was obviously overwhelmed. I felt bad for her! But I also wanted my desserts.. In a timely matter.

My mango pillow was good. Whipped cream and one slice of mango wrapped with a crepe. Wish there was more mango though. We also had the mango tofu and the mango with sticky rice. Do you sense a theme here? We ARE dining at Mango Medley, not Kiwi Kitchen. Both were pretty tasty, mangos were sweet and tasted fresh. I have no complaints. I did notice the other tables had mussels and some sort of pasta which looked pretty good-so that'll be something I need to try another day. 

Overall, if you have time, this place is great for you and your friend to catch up. Otherwise if you're just hoping to grab a quick bite to eat? I'd suggest going somewhere else until you notice another waitstaff working.
author: Athena L.

description:
Mango Tango.

Ordered:
- Panna Cotta with Taro and Azuki $5.25
- Strawberry Bliss $6.95
- Fresh Mango Pillows (4) $6.50 
- Durian/Banana Pillows (4) $7.15

Tina's Tricks and Ticks
- Total Amount $28.11 without tip
- Parking on the street isn't easy to find 
- Unisex restroom and limited seating space 
- Lady was super impatient though. Haha, really wanted us to order quickly. On the other hand, we were indecisive. 
- Most orders came with either 2-4 servings for sharing.
- These pillows were soft and crepe-like wrapped fruits. It was alright depending on the flavor. 
- I could've done without the strawberry bliss, super sweet for my taste. 
- Panna cotta wasn't anything special, but the taro and azuki made us curious to order it. 
- I wasn't too impressed, would I be back? Maybe not.
author: Tina N.

description: Literally the worst service. I requested a special veggie fried rice for my 7 yo son and they would not accommodate. Literally said they didn't want to cook anything special. Now I theory I understand, but the way they treated us was so bad, we simply got up and left. Would not recommend this nor will I ever return.
author: Lisa K.

description: It used to be like 4-5 stars. Now it's barely 3.  The service is winding down and food quality isn't keeping up from few years ago after my last visit.  Seems like chef have changed and also the owner is struggling to maintain this small little restaurant.  I wish it will improved.  Their mango 掦枝甘露。was used to be so good. And I had a bad one last Saturday.  Also the pillow was also bad.  Durian was from frozen and still Icey inside.
author: Candy S.

description:
The last time I came here, I remember it being a lot bigger...

Anyways, I come here for the Jasmine Milk Tea Frappe. If you're a fan of Jasmine, I highly recommend you try this drink because you can really taste the jasmine :)

The mango desserts are pretty good and they're especially good when mangos are in season! 
However, service is very slow... you'd need to walk up to pay or wave down the waiter. 

*They require everyone who sits to spend a min of $4.50
author: Leilani Y.

description: Went here for the first time and was so impressed with their very very good durian bliss (ice bowl) and durian pillow (crepes). I love durian and mango medley has a lot of durian desserts. However, the second time I came to this place I was disappointed with their service ... please see my other review.
author: Euodia A.

description: I would say please never go to this restaurant. The waitress's attitude was super bad to us. she doesn't know how to respect people and the service was very slow. The store was cash-only without any sign reminding the customers. We didn't realize it was cash only until we wanted to check. And we asked how to fix it cause we only had cards with us. We thought she might had some recommendations on where the nearest ATM was or recommended a nearby grocery store that provided cash back service, then we can get some cash and pay for it. But she was super unfriendly and replied," I don't know, you have to figure it yourself, or I have to call 911." We were really scared. If you like a place where you spend money and receive uncomfortable service in the meantime, I would say it's a good place.
author: Winnie Z.

description: Absolutely delicious. The baked dishes are superb. The milk tea was so strong that my hands started to shake afterwards. It was my fault for ignoring the warning on the menu. The almond soymilk was good as well and not to mention they used organic beans. Some reviewers said the owner was rude. I'd say her personality is just straightforward. You'll be fine if you don't stir up trouble by asking too many special requests. Just stick with the menu. It's a family owned restaurant so don't expect the food to be ready in 10min. I wish they would offer more organic dishes.
author: Alex S.

description:
I don't know why this place has such low reviews, but I enjoyed my time here.
I came around 9:30pm on a Sunday night for dessert.

I got the Mango Bliss with panna cotta which I really liked. Mangoes were sweet and you sure do get a lot of mango flavor (mango heaven!). Panna cotta had good texture and was not too sweet.

The bf didn't eat dinner yet and got their kimchi fried rice which was pretty good.

I saw there's lots of complaints about the smell. They do serve durian which could be the cause. But a plus if you love durian.

This place is real tiny. Seats only about a handful of people. And it's a mom and pop kind of shop so there's only one server when I was there. So service can be a bit slow, but they try their best. I didn't think it was that bad. Food still came out at a decent time and they refilled our tea and waters.

I will definitely come back for dessert or even late night snacks/meals.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Dear Mango Medley,

You can definitely meddle with me ANYTIME you want. WAHAHAHA. 

Most Sincerely,
Starstruck Fan 

JK. haha I have no idea what I just said... ANYWAYS.... Came here for some late night dessert with a friend after studying for endless hours at my new home, aka the School Library. Cannot vouch for their food, but their dessert is definitely a MMMM MMMM fricken MMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM. Or maybe I was just in desperate need of some sugar. 

~.::Atmosphere::.~
The place is really small. Luckily on a late school night it was pretty empty. The place was Asian-ed out with little wooden benches, plants everywhere, pictures hung randomly here and there, and just cutesy stuff all around. 

~.::Service::.~
Did not expect much.... Asian places usually dont have good service. Yes, I am being harsh on my own kind. Our waitress was just whatever on service and did not sound enthusiastic at all, but I'm giving her a break since she's probably closing. 

~.::Dessert::.~
So like I said, cant really vouch for their food food, but dessert is pretty good! 

Mango Bliss $6.50: 4.5 stars. Mangos surrounded by mango juice, lifted by buttermilk panna cotta, enhanced by the mango ice cream. Everything meshed so so well with each other. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mango-medley-san-francisco?select=2aVOb7YxUqEiBrNcjkukjg#2aVOb7YxUqEiBrNcjkukjg

Strawberry Pillow: 3.5 stars. Basically a crepe folded like a "pillow case" It was filled with strawberries and whipped cream. Nothing popped out to me. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mango-medley-san-francisco?select=2aVOb7YxUqEiBrNcjkukjg#DT5eFJbT09JH8Ead91rf3A
author: Chena N.

description:
It's been a while since I've entered the strangely mystifying realm of Mango Medley and decided to embark with the boyfriend into its magical, perplexing kingdom. To my surprise, this visit (probably my 4th or 5th on ever) was the best out of any of them.

Some changes had been made since I last visited Mango Medley. For one, the dining room is the only place you can enter into now. Before there was another room that overlooked the kitchen, past a counter, with a huge menu over it, that made it confusing as to where to stand and wait for a table. That area is now blocked off, making the walk-in process much more straightforward, though now I'm not sure where you'd stand if all the tables are full. Probably outside.

Secondly, rather than have any sort of server, the owner and chef was the one to seat us and take our order. We came in at 9:30 on a Thursday and there were only a few tables besides us. Even still, service had a bit to be desired. I was very happy that this was the first time I actually felt taken care of, though, service-wise.

Thirdly, the menus for Dinner and Dessert have been updated. My go-to Salmon Pineapple Bacon fried rice is now "Pineapple bacon fried rice with choice of meat" (no salmon option, *sadface* ). And no more avocado or taro shake, (also *sadface*). The menus are so extensive, though, that it's easy to try a new thing every time you come in. And with their track record for good food, it wouldn't be a mistake.

THE FOOD (!!!) as always, and maybe even better than what I remember, was so so good. Mango Medley always has a homemade quality with personal touches to it, everything I've ever ordered from here has been delicious. This particular evening we had:

Beef Brisket Soup
Seafood Curry w/ Rice
Soy Ginger Drink, LG

I couldn't decide between the Oxtail and Beef Brisket soup, but ended up going with the brisket as it came with noodles. Added egg for $1.50 extra. The flavor of the broth was out-of-this-world rich and gratifying. The meat was tender and flavorful and just like the most succulent pot roast out of a slow cooker. The addition of Asian greens and mushrooms added complexity and good texture. Yum.

Seafood Curry came with some shrimp, mussels, and pieces of fish in a yellow curry sauce. Rice was extra, $1.50 or $2 I think, but you gotta have it with your curry! This dish was also delicious and we both were able to get one mussel and a couple shrimp each when sharing it.

The hot Ginger Soy drink we ordered to go after paying, and it was delicious. Very spicy, warm, and sweet without being overpowering. The perfect way to end a nice night out walking into the cool evening. 

Although the service is still left to be desired, this has got to be my smoothest experience at this strange but delicious little restaurant. Much more likely to come back sooner than later based on this most recent visit.
author: Megan D.

description:
My last visit to Mango Medley was years ago.  I was craving some dessert and convinced the hubby to come here.

As I recall, the place is tiny.  Therefore, if you're coming with a large group, seating is limited.  Also, if you're claustrophobic, this may not be the place for you.  

We ordered:

Mango Delight - Slices of mango with grapefruit that wasn't very good. Both "A" and I  had it before here in the past and enjoyed it but this time something was definitely off.

Creme Brulee - It was cold and not hot like another Yelper mentioned.  However, it was creamy and smooth.  It had a good sweetness level too.

Almond Cream - Nice almond flavor and good option for non-caffeine drinkers.  Only downside is it was too sweet when it got to the end.
author: Candice H.

description: The business hour written is 5-midnight, but it wasn't open without stating anything that they wouldn't open today although they posted a part staying it would open at 6:30 pm. I felt the owner was irresponsible because they didn't even pick up  the phone to response customers.
author: Dora L.

description: Small dungeon like atmosphere. Had their dessert "cha cha" and "mango medley". Portion is small. Its alright in taste. Service non-existent. Overall not the best place around the neighborhood.
author: Adam L.

description: I had the tom kha soup, parpadelle w/mushrooms and glutinous rice dumplings with sesame paste. Everything was delicious, especially the dessert which was mochi in a hot sesame custard, and reasonably priced. I will definitely be back to check out more of the extensive menu.
author: anna w.

description: Best mango dessert I have ever had, some people said the owner was rude but thinking about she is the only one who does the job I would forgive her if she was being rush.
author: Anson N.

description:
*CASH ONLY*

It's not that I didn't like this place, it's that the whole atmosphere and service was completely off-putting. The dessert was decent but the server and their shop policy is a little ridiculous for a dessert house. I get that there is limited seating and it's not a large place, but holy crap, I almost left had I not circled around for parking for a while.

1) Mango Medley was good. Not too sweet and not too decadent.
2) Mango Tofu-Fa was also good. Overpriced but tasty.

My friend and I stopped in on a super slow Wednesday evening. There were a total of 3 other tables aside from us. We couldn't sit wherever we wanted, which I understand but the lady hastily told us to sit in a certain spot. I get that there's not too many people working, but she could have been nicer about.

Our table DID NOT have their shop policy (See Photo). It was my first time here and I did not realize they had such policies. My friend and I were going to share the Mango Medley and then she grabs the policy from another table and shows us that there is a $5 minimum per person. Okay, so much for sharing. I ended up ordering the Mango Tofu-Fa to-go. Silly me, I should have just ordered the dessert to-go instead.

She ended up bringing us out some water and I was hesitant because I didn't want to get charged for something that I didn't order. I mean, look at their policy regarding tea. -_____- 

We finished our Mango Medley and took our to-go order and left. I would not come back unless someone I loved really wanted to come try it out and even then, I would consider other options first. The lady is down right rude.
author: Rebecca T.

description:
I walk past this place often and it always looks so cute and romantic from the outside. I was really excited to finally try it out but both times I've been here the service left a bitter taste in my mouth.

The first time I came with a date our server was very short with us. However, it was a busy night and it seemed she was the only worker so I let it slide. A month later I came again with a group of friends bc it was the only boba place opened late around the area. We were the only ones in the restaurant and our server made it such a terrible experience. When my friend asked for Thai tea with boba she was very rude and said they don't have boba. My friend then said she didn't want the Thai tea anymore but the server said she had to order something bc its $5 minimum per person. Ugh, we wanted to leave right there but just sucked it up and ordered an appetizer. 

The food is good however. I love their jasmine green milk tea! It's warm, creamy, the perfect amount of sweetness and very affordable! I also would highly reccomend their pork belly with bok choy appetizer! My friend also had a mango dessert with grass jelly and jello that was delicious. The organic red bean drink was bitter and not tasty at all.

Overall I wouldn't come back here again unless I'm really craving a few choice items.
author: Pauline N.

description: The best Thanksgiving meal I've ever had!! I got the baked chicken spaghetti and it was delicious. I drank the chocolate chai and had the cream pillows for dessert and everything was fantastic. The atmosphere is homey and quirky and the person who served us was super nice. I will definitely be coming back!!
author: sara w.

description:
My sister suggested this place.  I was craving dessert.
We had 2 orders of mango delight, almond jelly with mixed fruit and mango sauce, crème brulee and green tea ice cream

This place is very quaint, there is only one worker.  So, if you have time and have patience, then you won't mind the slow service.  She was very nice though.

The crème brulee was good, but of course, how can u mess up crème brulee?!

Luckily, this place was walking distance from my brother and sister-in-law's house.

CASH ONLY
author: Remie M.

description:
My boyfriend has been trying to eat here with me for a while now and tonight I finally gave it a chance. It's Sunday night and we came in with a friend of ours at 10:45. Got seated pretty quickly since there were only 2 other parties in the restaurant. Mind you, with that being said it was a full house in there. Super small dining area, about 4-5 tables that accommodate parties of 6 or less. I read the reviews so I knew what I was getting into. To be honest if your patient enough it's really not a terrible time. To some the policies may be outrageous, but to me they were hilarious lol. You can't expect much coming into a local dessert spot like this. 

Kimchi fried rice- good but kind of on the sweet side 
Mushroom cream clam spaghetti thing- not much flavor
Baked mussels- yum! 
Mango/strawberry pillows- yum! 

Key notes:
-cash only
-they charge you for tea (per person at your table regardless if someone doesn't drink it) 
-you will get bad service (laugh it off or take it offensively)
-you will wait a while to get your food
author: Kimmy N.

description:
If there is a zero, I will definitely give. The worst service that I have seen.
Food is only ok and pretty expansive relative to the quality.
Will never come again.
author: M C.

description: The food is good but it's not worth it for the horrible service you get from the owner. She is one of the rudest person I ever met.
author: Judy L.

description:
UPDATE:
If you're feeling particularly hungry, try their entree options!  I love their baked spaghetti dishes and my husband loves their curry.

Also wanted to add a note regarding excellent customer service - remembers my drink order AND will chase me down the street to give me my forgotten cup of always delicious milk tea.  Thank you!
author: Sheila C.

description: I'd give this less than one star because their service is absolutely horrible and rude. Beware, this is cash only as well.
author: Tiffany R.

description:
Terrible place. Place is dirty, service is rude. Avoid at all costs. 

We came in about an hour before closing, they told us kitchen is closing soon and not to order anything hot. Service was slow and dessert was bland. Will not return. 

Hope SF gets a decent dessert place soon!
author: Eusden S.

description:
The food is decent, but the service was the worst I ever had in any restaurant I ever been to. There was only one waitress running the entire place, and she is not shy to show everyone how badly she hates her job. I had been here twice. The first time, I thought she was just having a really rough day. The second time, I think her job is slowly killing her on the inside.

She would give out a sigh if you were to ask about something on their menu, and she would grow irritated if you asked for a bigger to go box to pack your left over food to go. If I had to make a list of rude people I have encountered in my life, she would top that list (The mugger who demanded my phone and my wallet would be a close second, though I think I might prefer him to be the server instead).
author: Stephen W.

description:
We came here once on a Saturday afternoon for a meal. Not a snack, not a dessert, but a meal. We were so hungry and we already knew that the cook time is lengthy, but we took a chance anyway because Mango Medley offered a lot of delicious-looking food. When we put in our orders, it took over 30 minutes for the small kitchen make our food. And the place wasn't very busy to begin with.

We shared a Jasmine green milk tea frappe, mango and prawns fried rice, and kimchi fried rice. The frappe was very thick, mildly sweet, and refreshing. The mango and prawns fried rice was delicious, with a variety of ingredients. The shrimp tasted fresh, the bacon added extra flavor, and I loved how they used fresh mangoes (as opposed to canned ones).  But unfortunately, the kimchi fried rice wasn't as great, as there wasn't enough flavor and lacked any spiciness.

The wait time for hot food is horrendous because of the small kitchen and slow service. You're better off ordering desserts if you're in a hurry. But still, I'd advise against eating here if you can't allot at least 90 minutes.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
Came on a Friday night and this place gets pretty busy, but that's only because there's only a few tables available so beware if you come with a big party!

Whenever a place has panna cotta, I always have to order it and this place have disappointed me greatly with the panna cotta. It tasted really weird and almost powdery with a hint of sour milk. I ordered my panna cotta with fresh fruits and the fruits were the best part. They have a good variety of fruits like pear, kiwi, strawberry, mango, and they all tasted really fresh and sweet!

I also tried the ice cream and mango cream pillows - it's like mini crepes. These were pretty good and you can't really go wrong with crepes! :)

Someone else from our party also ordered the mango frappe and I heard that one was really good!
author: Heidi V.

description:
I have come here in multiple occasions as my girlfriend is a fan of the mango dessert in this place.  Let's just say the mango here seems to be always sweet and tasty!  We always come by for late dinner or dessert around 10pm, so we never experience much of a wait in line.  We would always order the Mango Bliss with tofu base (highly recommended!).  Due to cost of the mango flavor ice cream cost they had switched to use mango sorbet, which we found a little sour for the whole dessert and we didn't enjoy it.  Rest assure that you can still ask for the mango flavor ice cream for a small addition charge (~$1)  

I tried their baked white sauce seafood spaghetti and it was quite delicious too!

Note that this place is operated by two people, one server and one chef.  So if you are someone who expects good service and quick response time, then you may not enjoy this place.  However if you are a pure foodie like me and care less in the other minor details, then you would definitely enjoy their food here!
author: Johnston C.

description: This tiny getaway in the outer sunset has the most incredible food, fruit, milk tea, ginger tea, etc. I'm a little disappointed in the service and the laws that they strictly enforce, which are overwhelming to say the least. You can't share plates, there's a $5 minimum per person in groups of 6 or more, bathroom use before ordering will result in a $5 charge, to go containers are $0.50, 15% gratuity required for groups larger than 6, outside food items will result in a $2 disposal fee, etc. This dictatorship has wonderful desserts and entrees, but strict dish and bathroom laws, fees, and fines. To sum it up, the food is wonderful but the service is lacking.
author: Stephen G.

description:
Came into the place with a dead atmosphere. It didn't feel very welcoming at all.

Ordered the Mango Medley Delight and I just felt like I was drinking sugar more than eating mangoes. 

Go somewhere else for dessert if you're having a sweet tooth.
author: Steven C.

description:
I was taken to Mango Medley by a local when I came out here to meet up with my friend from New York and I left a happy happy lady!  

The restaurant itself is really cozy and cutely decorated.  While there's definitely not enough wait staff given how busy dinner is here at this place, it doesn't deter from a nice hot meal.  I started off with a lemon honey & grass jelly drink and then the three of us shared a baked eggplant & tofu dish, coconut lime spaghetti, and some kind of crab fried rice.  For dessert we got creme brulee.  My favorite dish was probably the egg plant & tofu dish.  I've tried to recreate it many times at home with my own twist and I haven't been  able to beat it.  It has mozerella cheese and tomato on it with an assortment of vegetables.  It's almost like a pizza and rice fusion!  The coconut lime spaghetti is also quite delicious.  The ground meat on top is super flavorful.  The biggest let down was the crab fried rice.  I think it had chopped up broccoli stems with some bacon.  You can't even find crab meat in it.  While creme brulee is -always- a delicious option, I wish we got a mango dessert instead since it seems to be their specialty.  Oh well!

Remember to bring cash, folks.  Cash only!
author: Joyce W.

description:
My friends and I have been coming here for several years for the Mango Bliss desert which is Mango ice cream, mangos, coconut sauce, mango sauce, and you can pick a base like panna cotta or jelly unfortunately our last visit will be the last. The service was always spotty, food took an incredible amount of time, and pricing would fluctuate. For example, when ordering the "shrimp salad" we would be told, "shortage on shrimp so $2 extra charge". Okay, slap on the extra charge. This was all tolerated because of the Mango Bliss. 

Our recent visit we all ordered the Mango Bliss. After we placed our order she comes back and says, ".75 extra for mango ice cream". The menu describes the Mango Bliss with mango ice cream priced at 6.95, but now you're verbally charging extra for mango ice cream. Okay, slap on the extra charge. Our mango bliss come out unusually fast. Mangos are sour and acidic. Rotten mangos. We have been solid, flexible and accommodating customers for years and this business could care less.
author: Marley Q.

description:
First time I stormed out of a restaurant was in beautiful and friendly San Francisco. I guess there's hell in every heaven.

The one and only waitress was as rude as a bear (or is it a "sow"). How did I know? Well, I was ordering the mango medley, and asked if they could make it a warm dessert. Crazy lady thundered "Since when do you have hot ice?" I was flabbergasted! But then I composed myself 'coz wanna give my family a nice experience (heard this place had the best HK dessert in town thus traveled some ways to this no man's land).

Later we decided to go with two desserts for the three of us. But the Mad Lady (Madly hereinafter) told us there's $5 per person minimum spending and told us to walk away even though the place is half empty! This was more than enough. I stormed out of the place without ordering anything.

One thing off my bucket list!
author: Yun G.

description:
OH MY GOD, THE SERVICE HERE WAS TERRRRRRIBLE. /cruisecontrolforcool

First off, my experience here wasn't bad actually (which is why it doesnt have 1 star), but the service was whatever the polar opposite of on-point is. We came with a party of 7 people and the small venue was filled up (I would say that have about 7 tables). They really really really seemed understaffed though as there was only one waitress for the whole place. Half the time I thought I would have to go shout "fuwuyuan" like you have to do in china, but I figured that would be impolite.

We ordered a variety of things and ended up with: doufu fa, mango doufu fa, mango bliss, 6 mango ice cream pillows, and 2 azuki (red bean) mango ice cream pillows.

It was about 10 minutes or more before our first item came: The mango medley with no utensils. We spent a good 5 mintues waiting to see if the waitress would come by so we could ask her for a spoon to no avail, so we ended up just taking one from a cup of spoons on another table. We thought it was weird that only one thing came out and not all of them at the same time, but we figured they were kinda busy, and the others would be out shortly

About 10-20 minutes later the next two dishes came. the doufu fa and mango tofu fa. By this time, all the surrounding tables we found were OUT OF SPOONS. We managed to scavenge one up, but one of my friends had to eat his doufu fa with chopsticks. Yes, chopsticks. You can all imagine how well that worked out for him xD. I tried some of my friend's mango doufu fa, and I thought it was a bit weird mixing the mango with the ginger, but she liked it.

Last but not least came the cream pillows. They were alright, but like i mentioned in my picture, they were just crepes with some more folds in them. Now, that's not a bad thing, i love me some crepes, but I wish this was explained a bit more.

The waitress herself was nice and she joked with me a bit when she was taking our orders. However, she only came to our table to drop off food. When we asked for anything else, she said okay, give her a minute, and never came back. *poof*

Another gripe: They charge $0.50 for hot water. Really? They don't even charge for hot water in China...

The decor and ambiance here were decent. They let you sit for however long you want (the waitress never brought us our bill. we had to go up and get it when we wanted to leave.

All in all, this is a good place to hang out and talk with friends if you need to catch up (good thing that was us), but if you're trying to get in  and out and get your food, this is DEFINITELY not the place for you.

tl;dr
It's chill for a place to hang, but don't expect the service to be anything but slow.
author: Courtney Q.

description:
I love this tiny hole in the wall, with just enough character and ambience to feel super comfy. They are always open late with exceptional customer service. The lady handles the entire place by herself.

My SO come back again and again for their #4 Taro azukar with tofu. We've also tried their other desserts, from mango to strawberry bliss that comes with coconut milk and vanilla icecream. Tofu is always smooth and silky. They always deliver.
author: Lacy L.

description:
**DO NOT expect good customer service AT ALL. If that's what brings you to a restaurant, then stay FAR away. Since the very beginning, the owner has made it VERY clear that you pay for good food, not the customer service.

It's a rather small restaurant. There will be a long wait. The service will suck. But the food will be delicious, especially anything with mangoes in it!!!!!

The desserts are awesome as well. And cash only, last I checked.
author: Athena C.

description: I am here to eat this evening. I think the food is delicious and the environment is very good. However, this service is very bad, the waiter is very rude, very rude. When I ordered, she was very impatient, and even tried to get rid of me. Bad evaluation!
author: Lu L.

description: The owner's attitude has improved so much, and she finally controls her anger. The new set menu option is pretty good and valued. Worth to come again.
author: Kent W.

description:
I've never been SO conflicted over what to rate a restaurant before. 
The conflicting aspect is that the good choices on the menu here are 5 stars
The ambience is 4 stars
Service is 1-2 stars depending on when you come
Random fees and charges is 1 star, the owner is clearly ridiculously cheap
But I'm someone who fundamentally believes you go to a restaurant, particularly a Chinese run restaurant, for the food. And I usually only take points off for ridiculous rudeness or hairs in food. 
So the weighted average might be 3.5 stars? Or pick and choose your own weighting system. 

First of all, try to come here before 8. I came here last night with my Macaunese friends who knew better, and we arrived at 7:30 and were the very first group there. Our entire group ordered separate meals, but I took bites of others minus the meat parts as I don't eat meat:
Drinks:
Mango frappe (***, not flavorful)
Sesame Soymilk (****, flavor is delicious, but cup was tinyyy for $3, minus one star for that)
Ginger soymilk (*****, truly delicious)
Chocolate Chai latte (****, it was tasty but for some reason, when they brought out everyone else's drinks in the beginning, they brought this drink out at the very end, with the desserts!)
Meals: 
Beef brisket pasta (didn't try)
Bacon fried rice (didn't try, heard it was ** stars)
kimchi fried rice (*****, the thing is, this dish is delicious where ever you go, I wouldn't go here for this)
Portuguese baked vegetarian rice (***** my meal, Conclusion: come to this place for the Baked rice dishes, that's where it's at!) 
Desserts:
Black sticky rice with adzuki bean (*****)
Mango with cold tofu fa (*****)
Mango wrapped in thin pancake (****, tasty but really cheap on the Mango and heavy on whipped cream)

conclusion: come here for the baked rice, desserts, and drinks. Watch out for ridiculous random fees like for hot water, take out containers, etc. Proceed with caution because if you come after 8:30 like most people, expect to wait until your emaciated.
author: Crystal Y.

description: Well this is one of the first place I would love to give negative stars. The atmosphere inside is quite stifling. I felt it was quieter then a library. Who whispers during dessert time?! Then their service...There's Asian service (which I am quite accustomed to) and there is just plain rude. The only lady was just rude. There were was another group next to us that walked out. I don't know what transpired because they spoke in Chinese. When we tried to place order she was like $5 minimum per person. So we went f* this and left. We just wanted a sweet bite to end the night but the lady sure put a sour taste in our mouth.
author: Maily T.

description:
I can't believe the low reviews and the complaints of service here....

This was recommended from a friend so we headed there straight after work...took us a 40 minute ride but well worth it

We made it in time to get a table for 5...mind you this place is hella small...

We ordered the flat bread that comes with sauce...it was ok

Baked mussels....very good

Clams n bacon with angel hair....very good 

Salmon baked over rice...tons of veggies. ...another very good

Kimchi fried rice with shrimp.....definitely good

Durian ice cream dessert.....sesame dessert...tofu dessert....

This place is run by 2 people.....the lady in front is actually very funny with a great sense of humor....thanks Eugenie....it sure does take some time for the food to come...when we tried to order more for takeout...they said the vents were already off...must be the noise as it is in a residential area.....but they will offer other dishes that can be prepared without the hassle.....

They don't rush you even though the place is so quaint....decor is absolute comfortable by all means...

I guess you can tell that we all had a very good time......
author: Leslie Y.

description: I have been coming here since High School and I have always loved it. I always get the Mango Medley Delight and Cream Pillows!!! The mango is always sweet here no matter what season it is. All the savory foods that I have tried have been really good! They just take a long time, so it might not be a good idea if you're really hungry. Sad to see that this place has such low stars, but I can understand why. If I have to rate the food only... I would give it 5 stars, but the service can be slow and not very pleasant at times. The wait for food can take a long time as well because I believe there's only one chef that does everything.
author: Brittany L.

description:
I haven't visited this place in forever, but I remember I used to like this place a lot. 

Anyway, this place needs to get their customer service checked. 

Friend and I walked in thinking we'd get dessert, but I guess she saw my nearly empty starbucks cups and quickly rushed us to get out. I barely heard what she said but "outside" was definitely in there. Rude much? Your store was empty, lady. Guess you just lost business if you thought I wasn't going to order anything. 

I won't be coming back.
author: Harriet W.

description: To the owner: if you don't like doing business then DON'T!  You know your atrocious attitude wouldn't survive anywhere else in the bay.  The only reason your ramshackle remains open till this day is because of the neighborhood goers.  So do us a favor and show some respect!
author: Frank H.

description:
I would expect good customer service since this dessert place is like out of no where. Even if the dessert is good I wouldn't go there. When we got there my first thought was, Japanese. Its a Asian dessert place but looks like those Japanese restaurant. I never been to a dessert place that don't offer you tea. They actually charge you for tea. Its hard to eat sweets without drinking hot water or tea. Second the waitress never came and check up on us, is like she don't care. We had to look for her actually. I feel like if someone left without paying she would not know. 

They do have unique food choices. My main purpose here was to try some yummy desserts. 
Mango & Ice Cream Pillows 4/5
Black Sticky Rice with Mango and Coconut Milk 5/5
Sweet Tofu with Mango 5/5
Kumquat Drink with Grass Jelly 1/5
Jasmine Tea that we had to order at the end 1/5

We notice they have many rules and charging tea by how many head count is stupid. What if one person want Jasmine tea and other person want another tea?I didn't like how they put the tab when were still eating our dessert and she never bother to take our order until we had to go looking for her. This dessert place has good desserts but I wouldn't come back again. If someone doesn't care for your business , I shall take it else where. It's funny how this place charges things from to go box to plastic bags to reusable bags but why not provide better customer service so you can get more tips.
author: Miri L.

description: My friend and I wanted dessert at night and she found Mango Medley on Yelp. We decide to try it out and it's quite impressive. Super duper small place. I love their almond milk even though it's from a powder packet. The ice cream pillows are simple but also good. Baked seafood rice was pretty amazing. Only downside is the place is teeny weeny but the food and drinks are yum!
author: Amanda W.

description:
Summary: one person running the whole joint so service is not too bad, but the food is worth it. Parking is a nightmare but the usual for SF. Not good for a first date, but definitely good for a date place.

Food: We got the typical mango pillows, delicious not sweet. The mango bliss was so delicious, the mangos here are perfect. well worth the wait

Service: one person being cashier and waiter so it's understand that the service isn't the best but she's really nice!

Place: the place is small only a couple of tables and parking is bad. But if you come during an off hour I don't think it'd take too long to get seated.
author: Ben N.

description:
Located in a block near the infamous breakfast joint, Outerlands on Judah Street sits Mango Medley. The first thing that comes to mind when people hear Mango Medley would be anything related to mangoes and henceforth people would easily believe that this joint serves only desserts with mangoes. However, Mango Medley specializes in desserts specifically mango ones but caters to everybody's needs and serves entrees and non-mango items as well.

MANGO FRAPPE ($4.25): Very thick in consistency almost like that of a milkshake as mentioned by the name; Very strong and deep mango flavor; A bit sweeter than I'd like - extra sweetness tasted more like it came from syrup than naturally from the mangoes themselves

MANGO BLISS ($6.95): Presentation was nice - bowl supported by a stand almost like a tall wine glass; Contained mango chunks, mango puree/juice, coconut sauce, and mango ice cream; Didn't have this but bro seemed to enjoy it immensely - thought combination of mango components meshed well with coconut sauce

HK-STYLE MILK TEA ($4.25): Seemed decent but folk had nothing to rave about; Nice how they took our request of taking out grass jelly and red bean into consideration; Not sweet; Probably wouldn't come here for a non-mango item

ORGANIC MANGO HOUSE MADE TOFU-FA ($5.50): Great rendition with a nice addition of mangoes; Not sweet in the least bit 

SERVICE: Service was a bit slow considering how many people were waiting for our table though only one lady was working though the place is quite small with approximately 6 tables 

DECOR: Pretty unique and quirky place; Very quaint and cozy; Felt like it had previously been a Japanese restaurant

Mango Medley exceeded my expectations since every dessert we ordered was strong. This place really knows how to do their mango items well so if you stick to that you'll have a great first experience here. They use as many organic ingredients as possible so they really distinguish themselves from other Asian dessert places.
author: Jacquie H.

description:
The last time we came to mango medley was was hilarious.  My boyfriend and I were really hungry so we wanted to order food first and everything we tried to order the waitress said they were out of it. Out of their massive food menu we finally decided on some meat and rice dish and then five minutes later our waitress came back and said sorry we're actually out of that too -__-  

The first time we came we had a much better experience. We ordered a kimchi fried rice that was really good and also their mango medley dessert which was mango ice cream, fruit pieces, mango slush, and I decided to go with almond jello at the base.  I think I've had this three times now and am still in love with it.  

Mango medley isn't my go-to place for dessert but I'd definitely consider it if I happen to be in the area or have friends that want to go.
author: Linz C.

description: I love this place! Best mango sticky rice hands down. And kimchi fried rice is great too!!
author: Michelle C.

description: Slow but worth all my cravings! Dessert is a must. Got baked rice. Would def get it again!
author: Grace Y.

description:
HAVE NOT BEEN SEATED FOR HALF AN HOUR. Told the lady and she gave us this half assed answer about free table soon?? -.-


We left after waiting for 40 minutes. Lady hardly acknowledged us. Place is cute but cramped. The closed off kitchen area is visible and looks cluttered and dirty. No thanks.
author: Natalie Y.

description:
I ordered two pillow puffs with fresh mango. The picture looked better than the outcome because my pillows came out looking inflated. with a sloppy scoop of cream and slice of mango. 

Interior is small and wait can be long if it's crowded. only one middle aged woman taking orders, serving the dishes, taking payment (cash only) and cleaning up. 

I would only return if somebody was craving pillow puffs but nothing stood out to me. Price friendly dessert house (with some savory dishes) and proxmity may be the only good reasons to return.
author: Winnie L.

description:
Came here a few times. Good Food. However, service was pretty bad.

 First time I went there, I asked the waitress (short hair Chinese lady)  for water; she told me to " get it yourself" which she pointed out the self serve water area.

I had visited the place recently, I got up to get my own water, the same waitress stood in front of me and blocked me,  asked me" what I want?" I told her I want to get water. She instructed me to sit and she will bring it over. The strangest part is that after we paid our bill and left, she chased me down to hand over two empty water bottles that we left behind and stated " don't leave your garbage here."  I was like wtf? Isn't my tip for you to clean up the table?   I was so embarrassed as my friends were not Chinese and were shocked by the lady's strange behavior.

If it wasn't for the good food, I wouldn't visit this place ever again. Or better yet, if you see the short hair Chinese lady there, just don't eat there. lol.
author: Kevin K.

description:
4 stars for the durian sticky rice!
Everything durain!! 

Its a little pricy but you get what you pay for! 
If you looking what to eat for dinner, get the pork chop. It was pretty good! 

The desserts are just so good! 
You will always want more!
author: Sandy W.

description: Food is very good. They have a unique twist on HK style baked plates. Came here with my family last night and was pleasantly surprised! Baked rice with beef brisket and vegetables was on point! Will be coming back
author: Legendary W.

description: Decent dessert stop after dinner. We got mango bliss and taro sauce with tofu. Both were good, especially the natural tasting taro bits in the taro sauce. The downsides are the strange service, nickel and diming on everything - e.g. $2 disposal fee for every item brought in to be thrown away (although not sure if they really enforce it), $5min/person, cash only.
author: Will C.

description: I never wrote a review because I do feel bad for the lady. I remember my first time here was in high school and I loved it. The pillow desserts were my go to. This place has changed from the interior design to the horrible costumer service. The last time I came was with my boyfriend. The place wasn't overly crowded, but we didn't mind waiting. However, we sat there for maybe 10 minutes and she didn't even acknowledge that we were there. She simply walked by us like we werent visable. It felt a little awkward since we just stood in this small area unsure of what we should do and people would just stare as they are waiting to get their orders taken. Later, we kind of just sat ourselves while some people left because her communication with us was horrible. We decided on what we should get a couple minutes later. I think we spent a total of one hour in there. In the end, we just got up and left because it was that bad. This was the first time I've actually left a place after being seated. If you can handle, go for it. Not coming back for sure!
author: Maggie W.

description:
The food is very good, the service is atrocious.  Welcome to Mango Medley, where the waiter wakes up on the wrong side of the bed EVERY morning - walks away when you ask her a question, has the grimmest expression on her face at all times, and treats you like you just peed all over her toilet seat and rubbed snot on your hands. 
  The very welcoming sign on the bathroom threatening you with fees for peeing before you order is also not a good indicator of anything.  Sometimes nature calls before a meal, is that really so bad?  

I would easily give 4 stars to this place if they got a nice waiter.  The food is decent, though a little on the pricey side and I like the option to upgrade to fancier organic brown rice with my order.  Location is great, right on the J line although parking can be tricky around here.
author: Thomas T.

description:
Honestly, I've debated on whether or not to write this review because just THINKING about my last experience here makes my blood boil. I've noticed that many people say not to expect any type of good service here, but the reality is, the service isn't just bad, it's straight up RUDE!! 

I had my uncle and cousins coming in from out of town and I decided they should try their ice cream pillows. Well, everyone ended up ordering different items and when the food came, my uncle asked the waitress why there weren't mangoes in his dessert. The waitress/owner (a Chinese lady in her 40-50's, I'm assuming she's the owner since she's always the only person there running the whole restaurant) replied in the NASTIEST tone ever "that's what you ordered." My uncle then said, "I thought mangoes were included because that's what the menu said." Then, we get an even nastier response "How do you not know the name of the restaurant of the place you're eating in?" (This entire conversation was in Chinese.) ---OK PAUSE. I told everyone we were going to a place called Mango Medley, it's good to note that I never mentioned to anyone the restaurant's name in Chinese because I don't know what it is, it was also late at night-- pitch black to be exact, and because we had a party of 8, everyone just chatted and followed my lead into the restaurant. 

1. If someone is a tourist, they might not know all the different names of streets and places they are visiting or eating at because the locals are their tour guide.

 2. JUST because I'm Chinese, or Asian for that matter, doesn't mean they know the ^%*king CHINESE name of every Chinese restaurant in the Bay Area. 

3. If I'm hungry, am I not allowed to go into the first restaurant I see so that I can order something to eat? I think if I'm starving, heck, I'll stumble into the first place I see for a small appetizer, snack, and whatnot, I wouldn't probably give a cow's dung on what that restaurant was called until after I'm not starving...

Anyway, bottom line, the waitress/owner could have just explained that the restaurant named a vast majority of their items "mango whatever" and not necessarily have mangoes in the dish. There's no need to be a beezy about things. 

The dessert was actually not that good either, the quality for the ice cream or just plain cream pillows-- it's just like sweet crepes but wrapped into a pillow shape instead of the typically cone shape or spread out on a plate...NOT A BIG DEAL. I think the crepes in Japantown taste better and the people there appreciate the business they get. 

The aftermath is that I am never coming back to this place, I don't need someone to ruin my mood over some mediocre desserts that's like $5-8 bucks.
author: Denise L.

description:
The food and desserts here are my treasures of outer sunset.  Everything I've tried is really really good! I try to keep this place under wraps because it's a small place and service is definitely slow - I think they have only one chef and one server - so of course it's a long wait to get food and service. Because of those reasons, I believe it's an ideal place to go with a friend if you really need time to catch up and chat. :)

They have afternoon tea-time specials. I especially like the "pillows" with ice cream or the black sticky rice. I don't know how they do it but their mango is always perfectly fresh without any hairs. The only other place I've had such perfect mango was on a farm in Taiwan during mango season lol.
author: Bonnie S.

description: Pretty good dessert especially if you are a fan of hk dessert and mango. They also opens late, for me it's a substitute with creation. It's cash only so remember to bring cash. It also seems like a one person  managed restaurant.
author: Teresa C.

description: The food is absolutely amazing. AMAZING! If you love Asian food / dessert, you will definitely love this place. I get it that the service is not as good, but if you talk to her nicely and be nice to her, she will be nice to you. The Durian desserts are to die for!
author: Luki S.

description:
If you go to Mango Medley, be VERY patient and have LOTS of time. I went around 11 PM for dessert. Only one person was working and the service was terrible. I don't blame the worker, I blame the manager for hiring one person to work shop at a time. 
The favorited dessert wasn't even that amazing. It was basically ice cream with fruits and syrup. And they charge for tea.
I wouldn't go back, ever.
author: Lauren Y.

description:
Mango Medley is one of the few Asian dessert places opened in the Sunset. Every time I come here, the setting changes and the prices increases more and more. It's pretty ridiculous because they used to give unlimited self served tea (free-of-charge). Then, they served tea in individual cups and now, they charge for tea. That was one thing that made them different from all the other Asian dessert spots.

In terms of desserts, they have good mango cream pillow and mango delight. The strawberry cream pillows (in my opinion) does not taste as good as the mango ones and they stuff the strawberry pillows with extra whipped cream. I also ordered the Roti as an appetizer and it was okay. The peanut sauce as the curry tasted a bit weird. Maybe it's because I usually order the Roti at Banana Island so it couldn't compare. 

The service is extremely slow since they usually have only one server and sometimes two workers. In the past, I waited an average of 40 minutes to get the mango pillow dessert so I would come here to have long chats to catch up with people. Luckily now, I only have to wait 15-20 minutes for my desserts. If it wasn't due to convenience, I would recommend going elsewhere for Asian desserts unless you really crave for their cream pillows.
author: Monica C.

description:
Here we go.

Memorable Mango music: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zyNbo7bbyc8

Memorable Mango food: 

- Homemade cold tofu covered with mango sauce
- Small crêpes filled with cream and sliced banana
- Baked medley of fish, mussels, shrimp and veggies in a house tomato sauce

Whether for dessert or a proper meal (or both) you'll likely find endearing the friendly staff, small confines and quite good food.

Those who live close might just go. And go again.
author: Jason B.

description: OMG!  I died and went to mango heaven!  The food is delicious!  We had the salty fish with chicken fried rice, the kimchee fried rice with shrimp and an egg, the baked scallop rice with creamy sauce, the beef brisket in a curry broth, and a pork shoulder with white rice and vegetables.  Everything was made with care & so delicious!  The desserts were out of this world!  Words can't describe the desserts.  We had 4 mango puffs with ice cream, 2 taro puffs, a mango medley, a strawberry bliss with panacotta, and a mango bliss with panacotta and ice cream (my favorite).  The service was excellent and we were very pleased with everything.
author: Tricia K.

description: The worst customer service ever! There's one worker that never greets me. The last time I went, it wasn't super busy. There was a empty table so I stood there waited to be seated. 15 mins later I asked her nicely if we can sit. She bluntly said " you can sit if you want, here's no difference I won't be any faster " and that's with an attitude. She then rolled her eyes. Never again will I come back . They need to hire at least 1 more worker !
author: Maddeline D.

description: I used to love this place when I was living around here. This month, I back to here because I miss the kimchi fried rice and desserts here. Food still good, but I started to hate this place because of the waitress. Last time, we came here around 11:00pm. We know it was late and we kind of bother them to close. So we really understand her being rude to us. But tonight, we came here around 9:00pm. Me and my friend carried the empty can because we don't see trash can after we get off the car. The waitress asked us to cross the street to trash it otherwise she would charge us $2 about trashing it for us. And we said we will take it away when we leave, and we did that. She sat us in a big table( table for 4). When we order, she asked us to move to a small table because there were party of three are waiting. Fine! We understand that! But, please say something like "please" or "thank you". I was trying to understand you all the time okay?! So, sorry~ it's my first time to leave tips with a lot of Pennies... but, it was 15% after tax. If you are the owner of this place, why are you opening? If you are the worker, hope your boss will see it.. Best wishes!
author: Janice W.

description: The Mango bliss with tofu is my favorite dessert in the whole city. Fresh home made tofu that compliments the ice cream perfectly. Also, the Thai sticky rice is a must try!
author: Ariel S.

description: The food was alright, but the service was terrible... I only like the mango dessert and that's the reason I kept coming to this place. If they can improve their service, I think it will be all good.
author: Ace Z.

description:
Not impressed. Thoroughly disappointed actually. As a fan of mango, this place was a major letdown. How do you have mango in your name and manage to mess it up?

We ended up ordering the mango pillows and mango panna cotta. The mango pillows consisted of whip cream, A slice of mango wrapped in a thin (funky flavored) crepe. We could of probably made this at home in minutes with more mango, a crepe that doesn't taste like it was made with soy sauce and ice cream WITH whip cream for less than $4. Redonkulous. 

The panna cotta was mediocre at best. Came out in a small bowl, very small portions. Barely any panna cotta, topped with sour fruit and tea way jellys. Uhh...? 

The only positive was service was relatively quick, not the slow service that we initially feared after reading the many yelp reviews that complained about it.

~B
author: Brilissa T.

description: It's been 5 years~ I go to Mango Medley so often ~ whatever I order it taste awesome . Love it love it. Whenever I have friends who come from other states or cities, I will bring them to try my favorite restaurant - mango medley . I became a super fans hahaha . Highly recommended!
author: becky c.

description: This place was yummy. My friend and I weren't looking for a heavy meal just something light for dinner and that place was perfect. I'm pretty sure it's only one lady doing the cooking, but damn does she do a great job. I got the vegetarian noodle soup which was super filling and delicious. It has tofu in it with assorted veggies. My friend got the beef friend rice and she loved it. It was a large serving of it too so she ended up taking some of it home. This is definitely a place I will visit again. It's a small place and wasn't crowded for a Tuesday night. Definitely seems like a good week night spot. A lot of people were ordering to go but I would suggest going there to eat. She doesn't rush you out, just allows you to sit there and chat.  Would recommend if you are in the area.
author: Rebecca M.

description:
Place: It's like a deconstructed garage/house turned into a mini restaurant. 
Interior: "Chopsuey" literally mean assorted pieces, doesn't have a theme. t's very crowded they could have chosen appropriate furniture to enhance the store, ergonometric wise:

Service: She took 20 min to give us glass of water, it's a bit understandable, it seems like it's a one-man army service. I felt bad for the asian lady she pretty much does everything

Food: It's okay. Not very exceptional. Based one the price, it's not bad after all. It's a typical asian dessert place, don't expect anything fancy. 

We had the:
Mango Pillows- it's very interesting, i like the texture and choice of mango( i like my mangoes, manila mangoes). I would prefer the whipped cream fresh.

Mixed fruit panna cotta and mango bliss were good.

They also serve savory stuff that looks delish! I would give it a try one more time.
author: Merril V.

description:
Absolutely terrible service. Twice I came in thinking I'd give this place another chance.  None of these instances did I even stay to try the food. I don't care how good your food may be, you are not getting my business from me when you are so unwelcoming to customers. 

This is one unhappy lady and I feel sad for her to living life this way.

One time I came in, looked at the menu and the signs says Cash Only. I told her sorry I don't have cash, we'll come back another time. She was not forgiving. Abruptly took the menu out of my hands, turned around and walked away. 

Second time, I'm really craving dessert and this is the closest walkable distance from my place so I gave it another try. Walked in, with cash, to a completely filled restaurant! I saw her, she gave me a dirty look and didn't say anything. I said for two please. She snaps at me, across the room, to write my name down. 

I'm terribly sorry that you hate your job. You will never need to serve me ever.
author: Linda L.

description: It takes about 15-20 minutes for the food to be done, but I still love going to this place! I know that there's only one person working at the restaurant, so i think it's reasonable for the wait, plus the food is great! I also love getting the mango tofu for desert, it just cant get better!
author: Joyce H.

description:
My husband and I  just went to this place thinking of getting desserts.  My husband ordered Cha Cha  first. She told my husband that it would take them a long time to prepare.   I needed a few minutes to order,  the server (who we eventually thought is the owner or partial owner) told my husband in Cantonese that we have been looking at the menu for a long time. I asked her what Pillow desserts are, she pointed to the table away from us without a word. I asked what are they made of, she reluctantly said "crepe ..."  After I ordered Taro and Banana Pillow she rudely took the menu away saying again that we had looked at the menu for a long time. My husband then asked for water,  she told my husband that we have only ordered 8.50 and that they have a minimum of $5 per person.  She then suggested that we could order tea and that would be enough.  My husband almost walk out. We have never been to any place that have a minimum spending limit.  The desserts eventually came.  Because of her attitude we didn't feel like asking for extra plates / bowl.  We had to ask for two spoons because the only spoon on our table was dirty.   There were signs every where -- particularly the .50 charge for hot water unless it is for baby formula.

The desserts were not too sweet and good. But we would think twice about coming back.  We would have given them less tips if we have smaller change.  It is really a pity, the location is good and they have a lot to offer. But it is a small minded restaurant with very bad attitude and service.  Oh even their regular customers are weird, a couple who are regulars (they didn't look at the menu and knew what to order) kept staring at our table, probably because we took their favorite comfy seats ...
author: Lucy J.

description:
Terrible service , 
I once went there and was holding a drink from Tpump 
and the women who works there literally stare at me and said to me in a very harsh tone " throw it outside , if you are going to thro it here , you have to give me $2 "

I am totally speechless , so I start arguing with her . Totally unacceptable service , I don't care how great their food are but service is the main thing they should improve.
author: Priscilla F.

description:
