We had dinner and dessert at Mango Medley.  The food was delicious  but took forever (45 mins after the order was placed).  The restaurant was half empty so I am not sure why it took so long.  

The desserts only took 10 minutes from the time we ordered after dinner.  I must admit the desserts were one of the best HK desserts in SF.  

I would recommend this place for dessert.  Just be aware of the shop "rules", the minimal service and have patience waiting for the food.
author: c v.

description: I want to stress on how fresh and delicious their desserts are!  They use real mango instead of can.  Really recommend durian pillow if you are okay with the smell!
author: Brandy C.

description: No MSG, delicious food & desserts, I'm a fan! Service can be slow since they don't have many staff on hand but it's a great place to curl up and spend quality time with friends.
author: Vivian W.

description:
I've been craving Asian desserts for a while, but my go-to spots were closed tonight. We tried out this place on a friend's recommendation, and the food was surprisingly good and fairly cheap. We had the creme brulee (not bad) and durian and ice cream cream pillows (yuuumm). Lucky us that durian is in season! :D

I will say though that we visited on a slow and chilly Thursday night and the service was already a little slow. I think it would be more annoying if we'd been more hungry or if it had been a busier night. Still, they were friendly, and the food was good. I'll probably be visiting again soon.
author: Grace T.

description:
Although my brothers weren't very impressed, I thought the food was good.

The wait is VERY slow.

The fried rice was delicious, but something my family would make (chicken, bacon, pineapples, etc).

Mango desserts were ok.  I was so hungry by the time we got our food though... It was close to an hour - no joke.  We ordered everything at once, including the desserts, and everything was slow to arrive.

The cream pillows were smallish crepes with whipped cream.  I ordered the mango ones.  I'll pass next time.

The mango sticky rice was good! But you can order that in any Thai restaurant for much less time.
author: Kristeen O.

description:
was not impressed at all.... 

The dessert was ok, but customer service was far from good. There seems to only be one person working both the kitchen and tables. If there was at least one waitress the experience might have been a bit better. 

Came in once as a group of 4 and were forced to sit at a 2 person table to ensure that there was one table left open... 

there was no one else waiting for a seat and we sat there crammed and uncomfortable.... not ok
author: Larisa V.

description:
Not sure why the reviews are so low, but I really enjoyed my food. We had durian crepe/pannacotta, mango ice bowl, durian ice bowl, and some noodles. Though the cafe was a little cramped and service was slow slow slow, I thoroughly enjoyed the desserts and new experience with my friends. 

Would I go out of my way to come here...? No. But, if I'm in the sunset area and craving a late night dessert, this is definitely going to be one of my options in the future.
author: Farrah N.

description:
Yes, the service could be improved, but I kind of look at it like -it is what it is -you get what you pay for.  The prices are extremely low.  I don't go for the service, I go for the food, which is fantastic.  It's not fancy, it's quirky.  There may be only one, possibly two people working at MM, which explains why the kitchen can get backed up in this tiny Outer Sunset restaurant.  

II have two favorite dishes and I order them frequently for takeaway when I need comfort food.  I love the asian greens with pork belly and I also love the kimchi fried rice with pork or chicken.  These two dishes, enough to serve two people come to $18.  Bargain!  The pork belly is always so tender and delicious, I never wish to share.

good things to know:  
--If you live in the area, call ahead and order takeaway.  It's quick!
--No alcohol :(  (another reason to take away)
--If you want to eat in, go early when it's slower
--Don't sit by the door.  It doesn't close all the way so you can get chilly -and the door chime is kinda loud too.
--Eugenie is not mean like many of the reviews say.  She's grown on me the year I've lived in the Sunset.  It seems like she works hard and it focused on what's going on behind the scenes.  I get it, and I am not offended.
author: Kristin R.

description:
Mangoes: sweet, juicy, and healthy. Use it in desserts and you have a recipe for success.

The desserts here are yummy. Because their specialties are mango desserts, I highly recommend the mango bliss or panna cotta bowl with mangoes. (Both around $6) The panna cotta is smooth and creamy, and the mangoes on top with a little bit of mango juice is just the perfect pairing.

I don't know why so many people complain of slow service because I've received quick service for the two times that I was here. (Both visits were made during the same week too.) The workers here are really friendly so try to be understanding since there is usually only one waitress taking orders and one person in the kitchen putting the desserts and foods together.

And oh, did I mention their kimchi fried rice is to die for? If only they serve it with hot sauce on the side, the dish would be flawless.
author: Annie S.

description: Mango Medley is like a hidden gem that you might miss on a foggy SF night.  There's usually nothing else around there so parking is usually easy. The place seems smaller than before, but ti's still a nice place to chill with your friends.  This place is self served, so after you order from your table you will have to go get your own utensils and water.   I usually get the pillow desserts here and it's pretty good.  I love Durian and that's what i love to order.  The pillow is like a crepe that rolled up like a square.   You can get it with ice cream or just plain whip cream.   I've tried the one with purple yams and red bean too and that was good as well. They put a lot of red beans in there, which was to my surprise. The service here can be slow but i usually never mind waiting.   Oh and it's Cash only here, to make sure you have that ready,
author: Belinda C.

description:
Did I really just wait 30 minutes for a bowl of tofu fa with sesame? Waited for so long without  being served water? 

 This place has gotten the worst customer service ever! Not only did I waste my time waiting for a small bowl of dessert, I was unsatisfied with how bland my tofu da tasted. That said, after four bites of it I was literally done, DONE! There are also not many choices for great dessert. If customer service is a major key for you, I suggest you to go elsewhere for better quality and faster service.
author: Karen C.

description:
I've been here previously for dessert and I remember the service being SUPER SLOW but I thought it would've improved after several years. NOPE! I think there's only 1 lady working, she does the cleaning, the ordering, the serving and I swear the food making also because the service took forever. You never see her unless she comes back out to serve food. I ordered the Mango Black Sticky Rice and the portion was so TINY for $5. My friend orders the Cha Cha which comes awhile later at the same time the lady gives us our check which we never even asked for. Talk about rude. Water is free but tea cost $. They really need to hire more people for this place.
Giving it 2 stars because the food is decent enough.
author: Maxine C.

description:
Wow, these FOB reviews are so harsh...

I feel like there is a trend with heavy foods these days; Super Duper, Mission Chinese Food, Gourmet Mac 'n Cheese (Homeroom), Bacon, 510 burger (and those f@#$in' truffled tots!) etc.  Doing rich foods in an all natural way in combinations is like the best idea ever: Truffled fried pancake battered bacon avocado creme brulee potato pesto pastrami remoulade over a bed of organic kale rocket raspberry radicchio, etc.  While I love these places and their opulent menus, sometimes it's not all about decadence & R. Kelley.

This place is so underrated.  It is excellent.  The food feels lovingly home-cooked with subtle flavors. All of the desserts are exquisite, especially the mango pillows (every slice of mango is perfectly ripe - how the f#$% can they keep this up?), but the food is f#$%ing stellar too!  This is an authentically transplanted Hong Kong cafe; anyone who's familiar will get taken right back and newcomers will learn what to look forward to.   Although the new layout (post city inspection) isn't quite as charming as it used to be, the essence is still there.  Prices are very reasonable.  The one lady (who seems to be the owner because she is always cooking and sometimes serving) has great energy and obviously really cares about the quality of the service.  I guess people complain about that but i haven't had any problems - I love this place and recommend it to everyone!

Try the pork belly and the vegetable soup with mushrooms and noodles.  

The highly successful Mission Chinese food is great but the food is rich, fried, super spicy... it hits you over the head with flavor.  Mango Medley is the opposite, it's light, subtle, soft, home-made, can be eaten again and again.  We go back often.  I can't eat MCF too often, it's too much Ignition.  

Be sure to check out Back Room on 14th and Taraval too!  Same subtle flavors, not open quite as late tho
author: Jason D.

description:
I never wrote any reviews on yelp but I have to tell you all some ridiculous thing that happened in the store yesterday. 

So we were eating and this shelf fell onto my friends head. Good thing that I stopped the shelf before it all landed on her. The ridiculous thing is that they forced customers on the other table who sat behind us to leave because they thought it was their fault. 

Then we had no interest in staying and they chased after us with the bill saying we need to pay for what we eat and they didn't see what happen. Of course we didn't wanna pay because its the stores responsibility for customers' safety. Besides, we didnt even have time to eat because the shelf fell. A customer who saw the incident then came out and told the manager it is absolutely ridiculous that they are asking us to pay because we could sue them. It's their fault that the shelfs weren't properly installed. The shelfs are tied with a cable which is not even safe to be placed in the store behind customers' head. 

Okay beside that, the more ridiculous thing is that they chased after the other group and tell them to pay for us. Of course they refused to pay because it wasnt their fault either. We were about to call the police to solve the issue and they got scared and said: the bill is on us, thank you for your time! Really? That's it? Do not go to this place! Because if you get killed by the shelf they may run out and chase after your friends instead for the bill!
author: Jessica H.

description:
OK, this place is awesome.  Not sure where all the negatives come from, but they mostly sound like folks from high-falutin neighborhoods expecting to be doted on by a staff of minions.  This is a local place with a vibe that should be appreciated by SFiscans with the capacity to appreciate the out-of-town-but-next-door beauty of the Outer Sunset.  I'd just as soon keep it to myself, but I love this place and respect the cooking and the owner, and I want folks to appreciate it.

It's run by one person who is the chef, wait staff and  concierge (I think she has help off-hours, but not while open).  I've always experienced great service and personal attention from the time of my first visit, and the owner has a great, sassy attitude that is really endearing when you meet her there.  

The menu is unique and special, and a rare vision of the cliche 'Asian fusion' variety.  There is a rotating base of seafood, rich mixed beef cuts, and wild mushrooms in a selection of bases ranging from curry to soup to awesome, comforting and unique noodle and rice bakes with or without cheese on top.  There is also a great menu of what I understand as classic Asian desserts that I've seen many come in to enjoy for their own sake, though I've never tried them.  I often stop by while walking my dog to put in an order, and when I get back from the beach the food is hot and ready to enjoy.

I've taken many people there, and every time I have someone new there they comment on the uniqueness and depth of the food.  When we eat in, it's always an intimate experience in a homey place.  

The prices are very reasonable. It's not the cheap, curry-in-a bin type place, but the portions are generous, and when I order take-out I have food for lunch the next day, and it's just as good the second time around.
author: David S.

description:
This place not even deserved 1star, I would rate it zero or 1/2  if I could. NEVER COME BACK TO PLACE !!!

I don't know what is wrong with the server here lately ( it's only 1 server here btw) She is really weird, creepy and very impolite. she treated her customers like her enemy or something. She never look at you or smile when she talks. She even tell her customers to leave if they can't wait 30 minutes for her to clean up a table, and another 45mins for the food to be ready. She also said that she will never rush to serve and there is no service in her restaurant. What kind of server is that? If you didn't want anyone to come then just close down your freaking restaurant. People come here to eat and pay for it. We are not begging for your food. Despite how good their food tastes, the awful service ruin it all.  
The server here should come back to Elementary school and learn how to be Nice and Respectful to others especially to your customers.
author: Michiko V.

description: First of all, I get it. It's late, your shift is over and you're probably tired as hell. BUT DOES THAT GIVE YOU THE RIGHT TO TREAT THE CUSTOMER LIKE TRASH?? Hella bad service, like come on. I went with a large group of people but we werent being like loud or anything.  The desserts weren't that great, in my opinion ordered black tofu dessert, mediocre. The mango dessert at best could compare to the one at Creations but I'll have to admit it was a bit less watery.  I did hear that the panacotta was good but I don't want to come back again because of the service, so no.
author: Lena T.

description: We ordered 2 Cha Cha and 1 Mango glass jelly. Both taste good, but the portion is really tiny for that price.. will only come if desperate for Asian desert.
author: Melvon M.

description:
Their food surprises me.  It is good.  Their menu is so diverse with so many cuisines offered, but everything is delicious.  Their drink selection is quite different from other places, so it's nice to try out.
Yes, service is really slow, but I expect that already so it's not too bad waiting.  It's pretty much self service, get your own tea and utensils yourself.  They usually only have 2 people working here.  One to cook and one to serve.  Once I saw they had an extra person helping out, but service still seemed the same pace.
author: Karen L.

description:
cozy place but you could tell its pretty old..well old style kind of type of place.it wasnt very big so groups are very hard to find spot.
we ordered beef kimchi fried rice which was good..mango frappe for me it tasted like a powdered mango..strawberry bannana creme pillows which was okay..then black sticky rice with mango which was my favorite dessert.
they only have one server to do everything so you will take alot of time staying there either waiting for a table,getting your order etc lol 
and they only accept cash...can't forget about it since the signs of cash only was all over the place hahaha
author: Enah N.

description:
First time here for dessert. After reading all the reviews, I decided to write review about this restaurant. 

My friend was quite picky and changed the seat for 2 times but the waitress didn't show any unpleasant. While we were waiting for our desserts to come, few more parties came in. First group of people came in with drinks in their hands. The lady asked them to finish the drinks before they came in. Second group, two guys waited to be seated, the lady passed them two times and finally handed them the menu and told them "cash only"... These 2 guys said ok then sat down ... But within a minutes they decide to leave. Third customer , he ordered a drink but the lady told him to get something else. This customer left finally because he didn't have cash. 

It is funny that this lady was quite funny and chatting with us. But I saw her interaction with other customers ... I don't understand ? 

Anyway, I like my mango dessert and the service I got is great.
author: Lu W.

description: Wanted to try the place because I love mango. Arrived at the door, a lady sees us. No hello no nothing. Comes back and asks if we were there for dessert or food and when we told food she says that the waiting time would be anywhere from 30 mins to 45 mins cause there is only one cook. At dinner on a Wednesday night. I guess customers are not wanted.
author: Ashish N.

description: This place is very crowded with only one person working as a host, server, and cook. The service is extremely slow, so if you are hungry and looking for something quick? This may not be the best place to go to. When you are not in a rush or whatnot, it is nice to chat while you wait for the food to be prepared. Their kimchi fried rice, mixed fruit grass jelly and Creme brûlée was great! I've also ordered a jasmine green tea with milk frap, and mentioned that I would like it hot, but ended up getting a cold cup of tea. When I brought it to the server's attention she got really defensive and did not have the desire of changing her mistake, so I just left it as it is. Overall, the food and dessert is really delicious, aside from the slow service, they accept cash only!
author: Pam Ela Y.

description:
The service was HORRIBLE, food was DISGUSTING, and the employees were DISRESPECTFUL to customers. 
 
I ordered the tofu dessert with mango.  After 3 bites of the chalky tofu and artificial mango sauce, I found a long strand of BLACK HAIR in between the 2 slithers of tofu.  Since the apathetic waitress ignored us when we were trying to get her attention, my sister went up to her and showed her the hazardous item in the dessert.  The waitress merely said, "Okay," and brought the dessert back in the kitchen WITHOUT APOLOGIZING!!  (maybe this wasn't the first time that happened to them)

Since that strand of hair ruined my appetite, I just wanted to cancel the order.  BUT NO...the waitress shoved us a menu and pointed to an ant size sentence saying, "$4 per person," meaning that there is a $4 minimum charge per person.  SERIOUSLY?! They served us a hazardous dessert and demanded us to either purchase another item that can potentially make people sick or pay $4 for no reason?!?!  RIDICULOUS!! 
 
Of course, we refused to pay the minimum charge, so a lady with a MESSY and BLACK ponytail (the hair's owner?) barged out from the kitchen and THREATENED to call the police on us.  UNBELIEVEABLE.  It would be their disadvantage for violating the sanitation rules if they call the police anyways.  But since we didn't want to waste any more time on them, we paid the bill and left.
 
They may get $4 from us, but they lost many valuable customers.  This place really has major food, sanitation, and customer service issues!  I would NEVER return to this restaurant and I can understand why this place was desolated when we were there.
  
This place is not worth your time, energy, and money. People with uncaring attitudes will NEVER make delicious food nor run a successful business.
author: Amy K.

description:
Came here one night because was tired of  27 Degree food and lack of service and didn't want to head up to Irving. Just this place is just as tiny as 27 Degree. They had one spot that could sit more than 4 people. 

We just came back from eating so wanted some place just to sit and chill. We came in a minute late and lost a comfortable table and had the window seats. So we ordered our drinks and after a few minutes, the waitress says "oh it is past 9pm and the minimum is $4 a person and those drinks were less." WTF!

So I ordered the Durian Ice Cream Pillows and when I was asking my friend which ice cream we should get the waitress insisted on vanilla. When these pillows arrived, they were frozen durian cut in quarters with a scoop of ice cream wrapped in a menlo wrapper. Ice cream wasn't even frozen, the durian was colder than the ice cream.
author: M C.

description: This place is fantastic! Been coming here frequently for the past 4 years and the quality and quantity have been consistent the entire time. The service is lovely, contrary to other reviews. One of my favorite restaurants in SF.
author: G M.

description:
We came here on a Friday night at around midnight and it was empty.  I mean they close at 1 a.m., but nobody was there...WOW!!  Lucky for us, I guess...yay!

I ordered the grass jelly / coconut jelly with mixed fruit.  The service was fast (well, we were the only one there) and friendly.  The dessert was great for late night eating & healthy, right?  The had slices of kiwi and mango and tasted really fresh.

In the middle of eating our dessert, another group came in..phew!  We thought we were the only people.

I had a good experience compared to other yelpers.  Maybe the bad reviews and the bad customer service scared away people from this place.  You know, once Chinese people hate a place, it spreads like wild fire through word of mouth and now yelp.

I hope this place made the changes and hope people give this place a chance again.  I will be back and hope to enjoy their dessert here again.
author: James L.

description: The Pork belly clay pot is incredible! They are performing magic in their kitchen because pork that  tasty seems impossible. Can't wait to go back. Good things take time and I have only seen one person working at the restaurant. That being said, the wait for the clay pot is at least 25 minutes, once ordered (you can call in a to go order). I looked in the kitchen, since there is a big window on the street, and just saw that same person running the kitchen too. I guess it's just more magic.
author: Ashton M.

description: We came just for dessert and I think I still prefer Creations. The mango medley was not too bad, but the mango was not ripe enough yet (a personal pet peeve). The red bean pillow was a little weird to me. There was so much whipped cream and it had a hard texture when I was expecting something airy and soft. (I'm not really sure what the concept of this was or where it was going?). Overall, it was just a little underwhelming, so come warned.
author: Allison S.

description:
When I first entered I was fascinated by such a stylish cool place with unique and ambient decors. The menus are innovative including crepe wrapper ice cream, even in sesame flavor! It is a great casual cafe reminded much of themed individual cafes in Asia. It is a great place to catch up with my Asian and Asian-American friends. Tea and water are abundant and are self-service. Issue? We were the first table seated in that cold night, when the place got more crowded, we were rushed out, because other guests are waiting!! It interupted our conversation, and ruined the mood quite a bit. I was really going to 5-star this place for the warm and cozy feeling and innovative drinks that I had, but the service ruined it all. Service is so important, such an important element of our dining/drinking experiences, how can it be ignored?

My friends and I chatted outside in cold weather for a few minutes and quickly bid goodbye. Our reunion was cut short.
author: Dilys S.

description:
I already knew about the 45mins wait BEFORE going there. When the waiter (Hay, they finally get more the one person in the store!) seated us, he told us it takes 45mins for food and make sure we are ok. "Sure" we said.

We are well prepared and after we ordered, we took out our own magazines to read.

Drinks and food are super as usual. Home made Walnut soy milk... almond milk... we always order these 2. 

Can't wait to go there again when we have a relaxing day.
author: mona p.

description: If this is your 1st time at a Hong Kong cafe get the pillow puff with banana and vanilla ice cream
author: Mister T.

description:
Good quality dessert if you don't mind the wait... I took away one star for the wait and the somewhat bad service... 
Usually the wait for dessert is about 20 mins to half an hour. Which is a pretty long wait for dessert. But the food is delicious! 
I suggest kimchi fried rice and their durian ice cream pillow. Those are my favorite.
author: Carmen Y.

description: Mango Medley is easiest the most strange cafe I've seen in Sunset district. There is one lady working here, and it seems like she may even live in the kitchen, based on the 'do not enter' signs. Mango pomelo sago is good here. The mangos were ripe and sweet. Strangely, they added tofu fa to all of the desserts which added to the uncanny nature of the place. I felt like I was in the temple of Spirited Away.
author: Jay C.

description:
I live a couple blocks away and I always go for a late night snack or desert with my friends. Its a great little cafe that is has a Hong Kong theme to it. Its a small cozy coffee shop where you can can a great variety of snacks and deserts. Perfect for coffee,lunch,dinner and desert. The hostess may seem a little cranky because there are only 2 people working. It's good place to end a date or even just to catch up with friends. 

What I recommend:

-- Mango Frappe
-- Mango and Ice Cream Pillows (you have to try)
-- Mango Medley
-- Roti (great curry dip that comes along with it)
author: Andrew W.

description:
Was looking for cafe to have a casual meeting on a Monday night around 8:30pm. Recalled having come here and remembered how long it took for service and how the food was decent and how I enjoyed the hot soy milk here; I was excited to give it another try and glad to see it was open and have seating. 

Couldn't make up our minds with the selections, our server had to come back around the second time. Asked her of some recommendations; she was frank, but cute at the same time. 

My friend and I both enjoyed the hot walnut soy milk( out of the sesame) and fresh mango(in a crepe and whip cream-2)--ordering 4 the next time. Had the red bean soft tofu-  it's a good and convenient combination if you enjoy both. 

Saw someone come in to order an entree to go. I'll consider that next time. 

Overall better than expected. Not the long wait in service expected.  Didn't expect too much service to begin with, but our server seemed efficient and my initial need was taken care of! Appreciate the food/ dessert variety /drink quality and concept! 



Please stick around!
author: Queenie B.

description: I don't give many places 1 star. If I could, I would give this place 0 stars. I came here twice just to make sure the first time was a fluke. First of all, the lady who works here is awful. She's a rude and miserable person. She's not helpful and is always in a rush even though it was just me in the restaurant. She gives attitude too when you ask her a question like you're the dumbest person on earth. The dessert is just ok. The pillow stuff is just a rip off. It's a crepe stuffed with can whipped cream and fresh fruit. The curry chicken is mediocre. The place is cramped. The menus are falling apart. Needless to say, this will be my last visit.
author: Gary I.

description:
Came here because my sister said it was good. I only listen to her because shes a tough critic. What a joke...

Walked in and was seated immediately. 1 minute to look at the menu before we were asked if we were ready to order. No, sorry. When we were finally finished, I had to wave down one of the girls to take our order, but she had to call out the actual waitress.

I ordered the kimchi fried rice, and teammate had the mango fried rice. Both were alright. Teammate also ordered the "dessert pillows". The dessert pillows were good. But service and non-dessert items are subpar. I'll come for take out or something if there is a next time.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
Passed by this place many times, but finally decided to step in and try it out on a Friday evening for dessert after musing through the menus. We walked in, didn't expect a crowd, but BOY, were we surprised! There was a waiting list and we were on the top of it, but we waited for frickin half and hour. HALF AND HOUR. 

Anyways, we finally got seated and had to flag the waitress down to order. We ordered the Strawberry/Berry Bliss, Grass Jelly+Almond Jelly with mango sauce and fruit, grass jelly with mango sauce and fruit, and mango green tea ice cream pillows.

The food is a WHOLE different story from the service. The grass jelly/almond jelly desserts had big chunks of the jelly with fresh mango puree and really sweet fresh fruit. The strawberry/berry bliss (with the almond jelly as the base) had lots of strawberries, ice cream and almond jelly and the portion seemed bigger than the other jelly desserts. Lastly, there were the cream pillows. Consisted of a thin crepe skin with ice cream and fresh mango inside, with whipped cream.

All in all, the desserts were REALLY good, but service was unbearably slow. If you're thinking about trying it out, come on an off hour, and the food AND service will be great!
author: Robin Y.

description:
After a late dinner in the Sunset on a Friday night, my friends and I decided to go grab dessert.  We were deciding on either Mango Medley or Crepe Temptations since we were on Judah.  Since we were kinda full, we decided to go with the fruit based dessert place.

    The restaurant was a bit empty when we got there at around 10pm.  When we first walked in, Mango Medley looked more like a coffee shop then anything else.  It's a bit small, but it does have a cozy type of feel to it.  

    They did have a regular food menu, but we didn't really look at it since we were only there for dessert. Typical rice and noodle dishes. However, I did notice that they have daily set specials and Happy Hour specials after 9pm.

What we ordered:

Mango Medley Delight  $5.95
Grass Jelly+Almond Jelly+Mango Sauce+Fresh Fruit  $4.95
Panna Cotta Bowl w/mango $4.95

The portions were a bit small for the price, but I was quite happy with my dessert. The panna cotta was rich and creamy, and the mangoes were just the way I liked them.  Not overly ripe, but firm, sweet, and with tart undertones.  I was too full to try the desserts my friends ordered, but they claimed it was good.

The only hiccup was that my friend's Mango Medley Delight took forever to come. Literally half an hour after the other two desserts came.   This was a bit odd considering the restaurant was pretty much empty at the time.  

Pros:

Good mango desserts
Opens late ( until 1 am Fri. nights, 12am Sat. nights)
Friendly service (albeit a bit slow) 

Cons:

A bit pricey for what you get
Cash only


I would come back here to try their other desserts:)
author: Anna C.

description:
Decent small dessert/late night hang place.

Red bean pillows ($3.25 for 2)
Mini crepes with whipped cream and choice of topping. Nothing special but not terrible. Very simple to make. 2.75/5

ginger soy milk ($3)
nice and warm with a hint of ginger. Good drink for a cold day. 3.5/5

mango medley (~$5)
The mango puree was kinda plain and watery. Came with mango, coconut jelly. Wish they offered a mango sago option. 3/5

kimchee fried rice ($12)
kinda expensive and small portions. Choice of meat determines the price. Got the pork belly which kinda looked more like bbq pork. Decent but better at a korean restaurant. 3/5

Overall, a decent late night hang out place but nothing amazing. I would compare it to 37 degrees on taravel.  CASH ONLY
author: Robert Y.

description: As nice of the atmosphere as the place has, for some reason, the server was no where near as nice. I give 3 stars because I still have room for doubt but man....the waitress was rude. There is only one person tonight and she is frustrated. She was frustrated enough to give customers so much attitude saying "there's only one person today. There's people here people there ... I don't know...I don't know how long you will wait for... 45mins."  and then walked away....she is a small lady.
author: Katie P.

description:
I'm bored/procrastinating, so I'm yelping.

Today was my 5th time here? I don't know...

It's my friend's favorite restaurant, she's ALWAYS craving for MM's kimchi rice and creme brulee. I remember our first time here, it was on her birthday. I guess this place is special in that sense, but I doubt she remembers.

Today, we came in around 12pm, only 2 others were here. I had curry fried rice with beef, eggplant & tofu. Since it was happy hour, it comes with another item on top of the menu, I chose panna cotta. Both of the items I got were yummy, but I think I prefer kimchi fried rice. Out of all the items that you could choose from the top part of the menu, I've had most...I would say the panna cotta is the BEST. 

Does it not look yummy???? 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Ad-tBph_1318oUocDbrrTQ?select=LLNr2WPVTvboaWVLfkBttA
AHHHHHHHHH SOOOOOO GOOOOOD!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This time, the wait wasn't so long, so I'm going to give 3 stars.
author: Kylie L.

description: I really dislike how this place is always closed, even when they say midnight. Please change your hours to the proper working hours.
author: Luis L.

description:
I've been going to this place almost every Friday since my boyfriend first introduced me to it.  I am not a great fan on their dinners since I am not a spicy food person nor a very salty meal person. I ordered the baked pork chops. It was way too salty for me. Maybe it was just that day, but I never ordered dinner there again. Maybe I'll give it another try this Friday. 

As a mango fan, I love this place. I always order the Mango Tofu. I think it is number 18. It id delicious!
author: Jess W.

description:
Yes there is a long wait for food, and service is not that great.  They are often understaffed and have very slow service.

All of this is out ruled by how delicious their food is.  I have not been able to find anything comparable in the abundance of similar dessert shops around the city, or perhaps around the world in places I have traveled.

Their Durian dessert with durian and coconut ice cream makes me so happy.  

All of the savory dishes that I have  tasted have been very well cooked.  Though the downside, said by the ownerlady herself is there is a long wait, one chef (who may be pretty slow) but that's just the way it is and that's how they choose to run their business.  Take it or leave it, at least they tell you.  

Last time I was here a few weeks ago the revamped the whole thing, closed off the little section in the front and now actually bring you water/tea/beverages instead of having you go get it yourself.  Everything was more streamline and self explanatory.  

I am always happy to come here when I have time to spare, that is the point of a dessert place, to chat with good company.
author: Leslie L.

description:
03.17.10

After going back and forth about where to fill up before we start a long night of drinking festivities, we finally decided on Mango Medley.

We had the pork chop with spaghetti [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Ad-tBph_1318oUocDbrrTQ?select=fztsRUkWuyt011lh8z40sQ] and the crab fried rice.  Too filling for two, but to go boxes were $0.50 extra, so we stuffed ourselves silly and went our merry way.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Kimchi Fried Rice! = A TOTAL 5 STAR!! 

But service and attitude... needs an upgrade! It took forever for them to get our orders in, and the food to come.

If you're not patient then this definitely not the place to go but if you're willing to sit forever and catch up with friends, then this is it! because you can catch up with them without having to relocate as soon you're done with a meal / dessert!
author: Lianne D.

description:
(See pics)

This is a great spot that is not too far away from Ocean Beach, perfect corner to grab a bite or meal. I love coming here in a lazy weekend afternoon, an afternoon where it's not busy and I can just kick back and chill, an afternoon to prep for a overfull workload week.

This time after an afternoon of soaking in very salty and windy sunny beach I had the sweet ginger soymilk and Azuki sesame red bean banana cream pillows (wrapped crepes.) It's quite a lot of work and I am surprised how great they turned out. They were delicious and very sugary sweet.

They also serve roti and other Asian dishes if you want something savory.
author: T L.

description: This place is chronic! The desserts are especially delicious. Service isn't fast but I mean only one lady mans the front of the restaurant. I've seen multiple comments on customer service being poor but to me it seemed pretty regular.
author: Sam S.

description:
I hate this place.

The service was horrible. I sat down with my bestie and waited 20 mins for someone to notice us. No one ever did so i walked up to the waitress and ordered the mango pillows. It took OVER AN HOUR for it to get on our table. Bitch probably forgot us!

The food was so disappointing. The mango pillows was a slice of mango and whip cream wrapped in a thin mix of egg, milk, and flour battered crepe. I mean yea it was good but it's just whip cream and mango.... for 6 bucks.... i couldve made a whole shit loads at home and jazz it up with some chocolate sauce at home!!!

I will never go back there again, waste of my money, gas, and most of all, time.
author: Josie L.

description:
My experiences here have never been good enough to make me think about the food. There was a time when I wanted to get their kimchi fried rice, but they told me it'd be an hour wait for it. SERIOUSLY? 

I've been to restaurants that say there's a minimum amount per person, but they never actually enforced it. They had a $4 minimum/person here, but my friend and I had ordered two desserts which you think would be sufficient. NOPE! The waitress actually came up to us to say that we were only at $7.70, but we had to spend $8. She asked if we wanted to order anything else, but we didn't, so she asked if it was okay to just charge us an extra 30 cents. What else could we say if we didn't want to order anything else? 

The restaurant was not crowded at all, but it still took awhile for us to receive our desserts. It didn't make sense to me to have 2 people taking our orders from each side of the table; I felt smothered. One was writing it on a piece of paper, and the other was using an iPad. What's the point? 

When the bill came, I gave the exact amount including the tip and normally the servers at restaurants ask if change is needed, but they just took my money and never brought anything back. What if I had really needed change? 

Needless to say, I've given this place enough chances and I will never go back. I suggest that you shouldn't waste your time here either.
author: Kathy L.

description:
How does this place stay open?!! 
Me & bf came to try this place out for dinner and dessert finally and let me begin with WTF?!!

Came at 7:30PM and the whole place was empty so we got seated right away, ordered our food and took them 20 + minutes to give us our food; 
Kimchi fried rice with beef: small ass portion and tasted like tomato fried rice with no kimchi taste or spice to it at all!!! Just plain nasty as my bf described it!

Baked pork chop rice: the pork chop is so oily and nasty it left a taste in my mouth for hours! The rice tasted like overnight rice, I'm a rice person so I know how fresh rice should taste like! Oily and nasty is how I would describe the food here. 

The dinner menu only have 8 items and everything else is dessert.. So we didn't have any choice of ordering "safe" food. Usually I will order something safe when I try new places just so I won't leave disappointed. But trust me, I was angry when I left this place! I will never come here again! Even if someone pays for me! 

Bad bad bad !!!!
author: Precious K.

description:
I love their jasmine green milk tea frappe. One of the best drinks I've ever had.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
2 stars for the sucky service. From the other yelp reviews, this lack of service is pretty consistent. First off, I don't expect much from a Chinese place but the service here was pretty much non-existent. All I ask is that I get to order my food and it comes at a decent time. But they fail at these simple requirements. 

1. Takes forever to get your order. There weren't that many patrons or tables so no sympathy here. 
2. Two of our dishes came out on time but one dish arrived so late that the two dishes were already consumed and we were ready to cancel our order and leave. If the waitress could at least acknowledge that it took so long, I might be a little less critical but she didn't say a word.
3. They charge each person $0.50 for tea. WTF. That's ridiculous for this place. 
4. Why does the waitress use a ipad for taking orders when they don't take credit cards and it doesn't help with efficiency? 
5. This place looks like a dump with the random household junk lying around. 

What's sad is that the desserts that we ordered were actually pretty good. But unfortunately because of the service, I probably would not come back.
author: Donna W.

description:
Best mango desserts I've ever had!
I loved number 29 and their mango ice cream.  Sooooo good!!!
Service is very slow, so if you are in a rush, this place is not for you!
But if you have hours to hang out with friends and enjoy the mangos, then definitely check this place when you are in town. :)  I can'
author: Stacey C.

description: Good desert but EXTREMELY bad customer service. I came here a couple times but bad attitude every single time (both from the young and old waitress). For example there's still half an hour until they close and they seems like they don't want to accept any more customers
author: M L.

description:
Mango Medley has a strange atmosphere. Almost like you've entered a quiet half-asleep slow motion time warp where you sit and wait for your food and when you're done you discovered you've just wasted over 2 hours of your life. 

Table turnaround is slow since nobody can order or eat their food, so it takes about a year to get seated because this place only has about 7 tables. It takes another year for the server to come take your order because she's so busy doing who knows what. Then it takes a decade for your dessert and/or food to arrive. 

Maybe there is really one worker there TOTAL running this whole operation. Or at least that's what it feels like. 

It's a shame because the desserts and food were actually not half bad. You know what they say, you snooze you lose.
author: Vivian D.

description: I think Mango Medley deserves more than 3 stars. It irks me that people whine about the service here. First off, food here is inexpensive. What kind of service do you expect when you come to place like this? We're not talking about fancy, smancy wine and dine here. Second, if the food is bad here then yes, I understand why you would complain. But, the food here is so good it's worth the wait. Let's not forget it's ONE person cooking. I must say for one person cooking all the orders, it's damn good food. If you want 5 star service then I suggest going elsewhere; less of a wait time for me. Seriously people, you can't have your cake and eat it too.
author: selina n.

description:
4.5 stars!

+ Colorful Menu
+ Decent Prices
+ Happy Hour
+ Good Food

- Extremely slow service 
- HORRIBLE for groups

I've been to Mango Medley for over 10 times now and needless to say, the service here is terribly slow. However, the food is worth the wait. 

I enjoy coming to Mango Medley during happy hour with my buddy Kylie L. for their Creme Brulee ($2.95) and Kimchee Fried Rice ($6.25).  For $6.25, you get the Kimchee Fried Rice and an option of Iced Coffee, Iced Lemon Tea, Buttermilk Panna Cotta or Tofu Fa. I usually go for the Iced Coffee. 

They have a colorful menu detailed with photos so you know exactly how your plate will look like. I try to order something new every time but end up sticking with the same dishes over and over again. @_@ Here are some of my personal favorites:

Kimchee Fried Rice
Green Curry with side of Roti
Roti w/ Curry Sauce
Basil and Prawns Speghetti
Crème Brulee
Mango Sticky Rice

This place is ALWAYS packed whenever I come; it's a mystery how they can survive with only one waitress.
author: Mona C.

description: Dessert here is good if you like mangos but place is kinda small and cramped. Love their baked pork chop rice and their mango medley dessert. Sometimes the waiters can be mean and and give a lot of attitude. Actually...most times. They should work on better customer service! Had the servers been a little more professional and give less attitude, Id give it 4 out of 5 stars. 1 star off for cramped place and for being kind of slow serving up the food.
author: Kaman C.

description: From the diapers stacked in the corner to the hours-long wait to the food that tastes like #2 to the inevitable food poisoning, this is the worst restaurant I've ever eaten at.:(
author: Cooper V.

description: no Star for this place , when i get into this place. The waitress pass in front of me , but she didnt say hi or sth out ,  and we just wait but she still not ask me anything , and we just find the seat close to te window , when we just seat she come to said  how many are u guys ? we dont have any available table right now ? what a BS , so what we seat on now ,and she said its okay for you guys to seat on the table close to the window , I said we are okay , 2nd when  were order for a hour and  the desert still not come and ppl who was later than us to order , they are food come very fast , that's fine but the Waitress tell me  they don't have that after a half hour , WTH ok we change ,after the other half hour , and she come tell me the other one they don't have too WTF , I won't go back to Mango Medley Until they change there service , what a bad and bad service I never have , t
author: Fei H.

description: This is a very cozy place. The food here is not the typical Chinese kind but strangely tastes like home. The portion is petit but about right for me. I have tried the Kimichi Fried Rice, baked cheese pasta, and all of the deserts on the menu (the Durian Tofu is very good and not too sweet).
author: Minqi L.

description: Small hole-in-the-wall place with very limited seating, but the big pro is that they work very late! A nice place to come for a midnight snack. We tried the kimchi fried rice, which tasted like something I could make myself at home. I did really like the mango delight, which is their most famous dish. A nice scoop of mango ice cream, pana cotta on the bottom, chunks of mango, and sauce all over. I will surely come back again, mostly since it's so close to my house!
author: Nikita K.

description:
Came here on a Friday night with my roommate.  We read the Yelp reviewers before going in and therefore did not expect much for their service. 

However, when we first walked in, we immediately understood why it's got such low ratings on the service part.  I'm a bit sympathetic towards the lady because she seemed like she was the only one serving for the whole restaurant.  And she just looks SO LOST. 

We ordered the Mango over sticky black rice (they made a comment about how it's different from Thai mango sticky rice, but I didn't see how it was much different.  I liked the fact that they used black rice so it felt like it was healthier.. They were also very generous with the coconut milk.  The mango was not the super ripe type but it went well with the rest. 

We also got the durian and ice cream pillows.  I REALLY liked it.  It was almost like a wrapped crepe (vs like a cone shape one).  But, the skin was much softer than the one on a crepe.  For the pillows we ordered, it had a thin layer of durian, a layer of whipped cream, and the rest is ice cream. I liked it, but i think it'll be even better if it has more durian, no whipped cream.  It felt like we were not getting our $$ worth. 

Because they do offer a large menu of desserts, I would definitely come back and just make sure to order different things next time. 

On a last note, they no longer have the happy hour menu that I read about on Yelp.
author: Emily W.

description:
This place is by far, the most confused restaurant I have ever been into.  I doesn't know whether it wants to be a cafe, a restaurant, dessert house, or a storage room and office space.  

Upon walking in, you notice a cafe-like counter serving teas, coffee, and Asian drinks.  I asked if we order at the counter or take a seat, they told us to just sit wherever.  Walking down the stairs into the dining room, you find a cute little loft setting for a dining area with picture of San Francisco, and some art piece on the walls.  

Then I noticed the oddities.  There was a wooden screen semi-blocking a computer, desk, chair, boxes and a bike.  Hence, my curiocity of it being a storage area.  But oh well.  Haha.  

Furthermore, Mango Medley is confused between being Chinese, Japanese, Thai, Korean, Vietnamese, and Indian.

The appetizer section had options ranging from Japanese Gyoza, to Vietnamese Spring Rolls, to Indian Roti...you get the picture.  For entree's it ranges from Hong Kong Baked rice and spaghetti items, Pineapple Fried Rice, Katsu...and a section of vegetarian options. 

While Mango Medley is diverse, and has a picture menu of options, it was a bit difficult to decide on what to order.  

However, my little sister and I had came here after dinner with our folks at Dragon River, so we were only in the mood for dessert.   

We decided on the Mango Medley as of course the name of the place implies, as well as the Mango Ice Cream "Pillows."  

Both were disappointments.  Not only were the not visually appealing for dessert, but they both really lacked any other flavor and creativity.  The Mango Medley was blended mangos, with Jello pieces of Aloe, cut up apple pieces and mango on top.  Eh...thats all I can say.  Nothing special at all.  

The Mango Ice Cream Pillows, if you are wondering what these are, is pretty much a Crepe pancake wrapper with a scoop of mango ice cream, wipe cream, and a piece of mango inside.  It was just alright, I would've preferred it to have been a little pan-fried on the top drizzled caramel and more powderd suger.  =X I'm so bad.

I would definitely prefer to come back here for dinner or lunch sometimes as their regular menu seems to be pretty interesting with all of the diverse options to chose from.

Service here stinks!  Slow as hell, and definitely put me to sleep.  Our waitress walked around in her flip flops and oversized jeans that dragged on the floor, and literally walked as if she just woke up.  We waited 45 minutes for our dessert.  There was only one person cooking, as we noticed while walking out.  

We asked for tea to drink to our surprise, it is literally like a little "self serve" place, somewhat.  You get your own tea, water, forks, spoons, napkins, hot sauce, soy sauce, etc, at a little station.  Interesting.  

Overall, desserts are really mediocre here.  I will skip next time.  Hopefully this place will "Wow" me with their huge menu of Asian dishes...hopefully.
author: Cass J.

description:
What a ridicules place. 
Honestly, this is a really good chill location. Why? Not because the place is awesome. Instead you have tones of time to chill but not eating. What a shame. 

Once we step in the door, we noticed that there were 3 table seated. 
1st table - table for 2, finished the desert. 
2nd table - table for 4, having desert. 
3rd table - table for 4, waiting for food with palms on chin.  

The waitress told us that there were numbers of people "just came in" and therefore waiting time should be long. (hum.... Are u kidding me? 10 customer in house where 6 of them had empty plated.......just came in??)
My wife insist to give a try on it and we sit down. 

The nightmare started from now. 
After we looked into the menu, we were react to order food within 5 mins. We ask the waitress to take our orders......... 1st time, be right back, 2nd be right back, 3rd time be right back.......finally 20mins later, the OtHER auntie came to us and take our orders...... WTF??????
The "auntie" was so mean. She said that there were a table ahead of us (the table for 4) and it takes approximately 5mins to cook 1 person food. She "informed" us to wait at least 30mins (20mins for other table and 10mins for ours) for our food. SHUT UP!!!!!! are you kidding me?

Anyway....... After the long wait (60mins after we sit), we finally got our food on the table. The quality......... Not as bad as I thought, barely acceptable, but definitely not worth to wait for an hours for a fast food like dinner. 

Let me give a comment to the owner.....
Don't pretend you are making high end French food....... You are making HK style food plate and desert ONLY. Speed up and get the food out the table in timely manner and peoples will give you at least 3 star!!!!!!
P.s - don't ever tell your customer to wait 40mins for food JUST BECAUSE you have (so call) too many people in house. 

Suggestion to diner......
Do not head to this one if you are fxxxing hungry and have no time to waste. This is one of the billion restaurant that I would give less than 10% gratuity coz not worth it.
author: P H.

description:
Warning, dont come here if you hare a time limit. Their service is quite slowwwwwww. And if you get there and its full, I suggest you try a different place. With the slow service and limited seating, you'll be waiting for a LONG TIME. 

KK, on to the food/drinks.

Food, I tried only a few dishes from here and they're average. I like their eggplant dish though. 

Drinks, I like their mango smoothie. and their matcha latte. very good. its a bit pricey for a drink though.

Dessert, their pillows are very yummy. they're very light so if you just have one you wont feel too guilty. all flavors are probably good. I like the mango pillows and the green tea ice cream red bean one too. 

Its a very cozy place if you go in at an hour and day where there would be less people. They have magazines and i think they have free wifi?
author: Erica L.

description:
I grew up in this area and never knew this place existed. It's a small store and like other reviews say, the wait can be long for your food. Luckily, I came on a Tuesday night and our food came within a reasonable time. 

The highlights were the sticky rice with mango (minus the sesame seeds) and the bacon mango fried rice. The fried rice was really good, but I guess bacon with anything is a win. The only downside of that dish was the mango pieces they used were hard and clearly the leftover mango pieces. The sticky rice with mango was delicious and drizzled with coconut sauce. We also had the curry fish balls, but they were nothing special.

My tummy gives Mango Medley...4 Stars!
author: Allan L.

description:
Solid three stars. 

The food, is really, REALLY good. Everything tastes so fresh, & my favorites are the hot sesame milk, mango whipped pillows, & the curry. They also have other yummy HK style desserts & dishes.

ON THE OTHER HAND....
SERVICE HERE SUCKS. So you enter the door, end up waiting in a huge line because of all the big groups & families that eat here, then when you finally get a table, you notice how small it is & how crowded this place is! Then, you decide you are thirsty, so you have to get up on your own to pour yourself a cup of tea/water. This really sucks, because not only is this place already crowded, there are a bunch of people walking around to get tea. This makes it EVEN MORE crowded..... Oh & by the way, the servers here are unexperienced & ruuuuuude.

Overall, I would still come here for the food, but the service just needs to improve.
author: Connie Y.

description:
First off, the order took forever. WTF. It takes you like 20 minutes before you get our order, then another 30 to make some desserts? Are you seriously like picking the mango as we were waiting. 

The dessert itself was okay. The panna cotta that we got with the mango bliss was just okay. I didn't love it. I've had better panna cotta. Trader Joes FTW. 

Overall, just didn't have a great experience.
author: Nina Y.

description:
I kind of understand why this place only gets an overall 3-star rating. After waiting for 45 minutes before the appetizer comes and 1 hour before the main entries comes, I almost made up my mind to give this place a 1-star rating. 

I mean, it is not that the customer service was bad or anything, but they just keep you waiting forever to the point you want to leave. Here is how this works. You walk in there and find an available table if you are lucky enough. After 15 minutes of endless wait, the waitress comes over to take your order. It takes another 45 minutes to 1 hour for your order to come in. As a matter of fact, my wife made multiple suggestions to leave during the waiting process, and I am glad I was able to resist the constant temptation to do the same. However, couple other people left within the first 20 minutes, from our observation. 

Anyway, after 1 hour of waiting and transformation from hungry, to very hungry, and finally to not hungry at all, our main order came. Boy, the food was soooo good that I have to say it was well worth the wait. Only if the wait can be cut in half that I am willing to come to this place more often. Trust me, if you can wait for that long, the food won't dissapoint. Not sure if long wait if part of the restaurant's strategy to differentiate itself from competitors, but it is definitely not a very good strategy for turnover and profitability. 

All in all, if you are not the type that can wait, this is not the place for you. Otherwise, bring a book or magazine to read with you and make sure you are not too hungry going in. Good luck!
author: Jun W.

description:
I came to this dessert place with my girlfriend after watching a movie. This place may be hard to find since it's on a pretty dead street. I ordered the Mango Bliss with grass Jelly and my girlfriend ordered the Taro Bliss with tofu-fa. The portions were HUGE for the price however the dessert was only OKAY. It's a bit too sweet for my taste.

Service was kind of SLOW because we literally have to snipe down the waitress to order. The dessert took a little over 15 minutes to get here when there were only 2-3 other tables in here. Overally, I probably wouldn't come back because I'm not a big fan of Asian dessert places.

Parking on the street only. Shouldn't be too hard to find parking at night. Daytime may be a different story.

CASH ONLY!
author: Johnny G.

description:
Mmmm came here for dessert of a Friday night. Not crowded at all. You walk in and just see boxes of mangoes stacked by the cash register - always a good sign. 

We ordered a Mango Bliss with Almond Jelly, a Mango Bliss with Panna Cotta, a Mango Panna Cotta Bowl, and 2 Mango and Ice Cream Pillows. 

Mango Bliss has TONS of fresh mango, ice cream, this coconut syrup thing, mango puree, and your choice of base. Almond jelly was really good as a base cause the almond taste balances the sweetness of the ice cream. The panna cotta tasted like cream cheese and was really filling (but I love cream cheese so it was okay). 

The Mango Panna Cotta is basically the Mango Bliss without the ice cream and topped with this jelly stuff. It's pretty good but again the panna cotta tastes like cream cheese.

The cream pillows are really rich and you cannot eat a lot of them. Basically a really thin crepe stuffed with mango, ice cream, and whip cream. If you don't like whip cream, you won't like this dessert. 

Definitely come and order the Mango Bliss!!!
author: Jenny A.

description: More of a dessert place than dinner. Customer service was alright. The waitress was not friendly, never a smile working, and the place is small. Nothing on the menu appeared appealing and ended up getting kimchi fried rice, which was mediocre. i would say it was 3/5 stars but any of the mango desserts is a must try!
author: Lily C.

description:
THIS IS WORTH THE READ.

I use to come here ALL the time, almost every week for a time period. I recommended it to everyone. I haven't set foot in here in almost a year. All because of that "policy". This is worth the read, for anyone wanting to know if its good to eat here.

I use to come here a lot and would only order the SAME THING: Mango Bliss. Was recommended by a friend, loved it, never ordered another thing. Came in all the time, the owner sort of remembered me, so I felt at a point that she knew my usual.

I knew of the policy. The policy is that you have to know what you order, because there is no re-dos. I UNDERSTAND. It's a hassle. It can be a long wait if there's a lot of people. I haven't had a huge problem yet. I've waited over an hour for food once. I never had a problem because I UNDERSTOOD HOW THIS PLACE WAS MANAGED. So I respected it ... Until.

One night I ordered a Mango Bliss, my usual. The owner didn't ask what Base I wanted, which is Panna Cotta. I assumed she remembered since that's all I ever get. My food comes, and I had NO IDEA what came. I asked the owner if she gave me the wrong dessert. She said no, and that I ordered a MANGO MEDLEY and there were no re-do. 

I know, for a fact, 100%, I swear on my dead Gameboy's grave that I DID NOT ORDER A MANGO MEDLEY. I DIDN'T EVEN KNOW THAT DESSERT EXISTED. 

I just ate it. It wasn't bad though, but I still ate in frustration. I understand the policy. But that's only valid if I KNEW WHAT I ORDERED, not WHAT THE SERVER PUT DOWN ON THE IPAD THEY USE. Fortunately, the Mango MEDLEY was slightly cheaper. I still paid for it.

I haven't come back there ever since. I love the desserts! But that one incident messed up my whole experience. I'm sadly never coming back again.
author: Iris L.

description:
consistently good but a consitently long wait.  understandable because they make everything fresh

Mango Bliss and Mango Medley:
- pannacotta is creamy and tart, mangoes are so refreshing and the ice cream pulls everything together with it's sweetness

Cream Pillows 
- a crepe wrapped around whip cream, fresh mangoes and an green tea ice cream.  the green tea had a nice strong flavor and the mangoes were juicy and sweet.

Creme Brulee
- fresh out of the oven, hot and creamy, but a little on the plain side

The past 2 times I have been here was in a group of 3.  I would certainly not bring any party larger than 3 because there is not much space and only 1 server to handle the orders.  

Maybe one day we'll come back for the savory food, but I know we will definitly come back for the desserts
author: Tina A.

description: Man, if I had a dollar for every sign in this place (cash only! No sending back your order! Place order before using bathroom!)  And they were out of two things I'd ordered. Oops. And the flavors were painfully bland. Not so positive. The quality of ingredients were pretty good - fresh, organic - but with so many stellar places in the neighborhood, I'll likely go to one of them, instead.
author: Catherine C.

description:
been here once few years ago when the place first opened. service is super slow, food was mediocre.. staffed by a girl who looked like she'd rather die than work there.

stopped by again recently because my friend likes the joint for some reason. The decor is different. Looks like it's literally ran by 1 person the entire night. Gotta maximize the profits somehow i guess right? 

This place is not friendly at all. There are all these rules, it's almost ridiculous. If you want water or tea, you have to pay...under the guise of conserving water for California's drought problem. 

The next rule is, 4$ minimum for each person in your party...ok.. too bad everything is either way above 4$ like 12$ or slightly below the 4$ mark like 3.75$ which forces the costumer to order multiple things just for 1 person. oh and cash only by the way. Nothing screams cheapskate like a bunch of conditions to just visit the establishment. 


....food still mediocre too..
author: Terry S.

description:
It is as true as other fellow yelpers claim it to be. Slow service, slow service, slow service. Yelpers were not wrong when they said it took about an hour to get food to your table, let alone getting service to begin with. Perhaps, they just need more help? Oh wait, they do. There was a for help sign right outside their window. 

By the time we got service it was about 25 mins. since we went in. It took about another 40 mins for both of our orders to finally reach our table. We ordered a mango mixed fruit and a fluffy pillow with mango ice cream. The mango mixed fruit was standard mango syrup with fruit. But you wouldn't expect the fluffy pillow to be a crepe? That was odd. But yes, it was an ice cream crepe with whipped cream inside. Eh, nothing really special about this place. Especially because of the long wait, I don't think I'll come here again.
author: Amy C.

description:
this review is mainly on their service. I have gone here several times for dessert and do recognize the slow service (only 1-2 staff). But today's experience was possibly the worst I have EVER experienced. If it wasnt for the "service charge of 15% for 6+ parties", waitress, you would NOT have received your tip.

 Here were the 3 strikes:
1. While we were ordering, we were asking her questions about the menu, once she heard the ding, she left our table to deliver food to another table! WHILE IN THE MIDDLE OF TAKING OUR ORDER! It was extremely rude for her to leave our party while we were ordering, arent waiters suppose to give their customers undivided attention? 
2. She served our table another table's order. 
3. My order (grass jelly+almond jello+mixed fruit) was not served. When we inquired about the order, she said "i served it already". Obviously not if you look at our table! So I asked her to cancel the order, but then it came out 5 mins later and her response was "they already made it"... But didnt I cancel it?!?!

On top if it all, she did NOT apologize for anything!

Obviously this waitress has difficulty listening to customers and filling orders. She should go back to preschool and learn how to follow directions. 

I am NOT coming here ever again, they just lost some customers. Owners, you should train your employees, it's sad that your staff is the ONLY reason that you are losing customers.
author: mel n.

description: 5 stars for food. It's not the best service kind of place. It's a quaint, women run kitchen and the chef always blows me away with exceptional dishes at a very good price. I will be back for sure. Only thing to remover when going here is to be patient with service as the server is often helping in the back. Once you eat the food, you won't care.
author: Sarah S N.

description:
came here couple times before for ginger soy latte togo, but last night was horrible.  service is super duper slow.  party of 6 was there from 9-11 and our desserts didnt come out until over an hr after ordering! they werent even busy.

friend ordered white choc latte and the bottom of the cup had unmelted choc that wasnt mixed into the drink.
the ice cream pillows were just crepe wrapped ice cream and fruit but i guess they made the ice cream from scratch upon ordering because we waited an hour for it.

ginger soy latte lacked ginger taste and a little ginger goes a long way since ginger has a strong flavor.....hmmm
author: Linda T.

description: Poor service! I would give this place ZERO stars if I could. I walked in and requested NICELY for a table for eight people. The place was empty, only one other table finishing up. The server stood there for 5 seconds starring at me, LITERALLY starring at me straight in the eye until I felt uncomfortable enough to look away. And she responded in Chinese, "So what table for eight? Looking at me doesn't change anything", and walked away. She had no intentions to sit my party. Straight rudeness, never been disrespected like that before, so I walked out.
author: Rosina G.

description:
Only came here for dessert so can only review that.

It is a very very tiny dessert place with just a few tables.  When it fills up, you'll have to put your name down and wait.  What is interesting is all the posters around the restaurant, it is decoration but a series of rules and fine print charges.  If you buy food and hang out in the side walk they charge you $2, if you want additional boxes they charge you, if you need to use the restroom before you order they charge you, if you need additional utensil more than what you order they charge you- WTF?!?!  I thought it was a joke at first but am pretty sure it is not.  The servers are a little rough too, I came in with a party of 3 and there are 3 seats on the counter while other tables are full.  We asked to sit at the counter and the waitress said no we cant sit there.  Then this other waitress came and said, here sit at the counter, we told her that someone else said no and her response is, I'm the boss here, I said you can sit here. Ok.....sit here we will.  When ordering food, I asked for a couple accommodations or subs and they said no to everything.  When asked to clarify something on the menu, she looked at me like I was from another planet. The environment itself there is just very strange.

As far as desserts go, I love durian and love that they have a ton of different durian desserts- it isn't that common to find generally.  So does it taste good?  Yea, but not because their concoction is amazing, it is because the durian (previously frozen and then thawed half way only) is delicious.  Basically they put a scoop of ice cream with ice or condense milk and throw in a large chunk of frozen durian and charge you $7 for it.  There is nothing inventive or innovative about their menu. I guess you can say their pillows are creative but it is a crepe folded differently with ice cream and again, chunks of frozen durian. Durian tofu-fa, same thing, it is good but yea I could have gotten my own tofu-fa and got durian and thrown it together at home to get the same thing. 

If I'm craving for a durian dessert, I would come here, simply because they have it.  Though I wouldnt go out of my way.
author: Krystal C.

description:
Mango Medley...you disappoint me. 

1 young server..inexperienced and slow.

3 eager dessert lovers waited for table that never came.

Server told us to go orders will take about 45 minutes so we should wait instead. I looked up at their 3 receipt orders  they have stuck up for all to see...not sure why it would take so long to clear them. Why would it take 45 minutes to make 3 mango puddings? I do not know. I am even more confused about why eating there would be faster when we had to wait just as long to order and get our food. They need more waitresses. I saw alot of impatient people there waiting to get their orders in and served. 

Definitely not worth waiting an hour for!
author: Kelly C.

description: I've only had their desserts here and I must say they are pretty delicious. The place is cute and tiny..... I would repeatedly come here! =)
author: Anji W.

description: Kimchi fired rice is the best Kimchi I've eat. And dessert is good too.
author: Dalu L.

description: I never been here for dinner however I did come her a few times for dessert. I find this place to be very average. It tasted good but I feel like it could of been purchased else where. It is a quiet dessert place, which sets it apart from the other dessert places in sunset (only 3 tables when I went). I feel like its good for small hang outs or dates. Some seat have a mini wall providing some privacy so It nice to have small talks here.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
I signed up for Yelp so I could write a review for this place. I wish I could give this place 0 stars. I have been here before in the past and it seems like they have changed owners. Went with 4 adults and 2 children ages 3 and 16 months. The food took over 30 min and we only ordered dessert that was mostly ice cream and other items that could be poured from a can.

Then I got the bill and noticed they charged us .50 per person for tea INCLUDING the 2 kids who did not even touch the tea!! Fine, thats only $1 so i paid the bill, total was about $33 for 4 desserts. Mind you it is cash only. I gave them a $40 and when they returned, I only had $1 in change back. I looked at the receipt and they added AUTO GRATUITY because we were a party of "6"! this did not appear on the 1st bill I got because it was $33, this new bill AFTER they collected my money said it was $38. Not only did they consider a 3 year old and a 16 month old an adult and charge auto gratuity, they did it in such a sneaky manner. 

NEVER WILL I COME BACK AND I HOPE NO ONE ELSE WILL EITHER!
author: SF J.

description:
I can never get tired eating at Mango Medley, even though it usually takes a couple of hours to complete the whole meal including dessert there because there are only one person prepares the food and one server. 

If you are in a hurry to eat and go, this is not the place for you.  It is a great place to meet up with friends for some good long conversation.

every dish is extremely tasty.  all the mango dishes are recommended including the drinks.  if you know about mango, you will know this is the place to eat them. 

you gotta pick some dessert before leaving the place, they are all yummy. 

I usually demand for a good quality service when i dine out, and tend to have problems with the poor, but I can hardly feel this way with the place.  by it means, it is the place for people who want to be left alone so that they can have a great time dinning and talking with the friends. just to let you know that the server there is not to please you but to serve you with the great cooking food they are passionate about.

This is the best place where I can get the most flavorful Asian food with reasonable price.
author: Bei K.

description: Almond jelly with mixed fruit and mango sauce. Okay.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Expect slow to poor service. That said, if you're not in a hurry, the baked foods and mango desserts are pretty good. It's just too bad they barely care about good customer service.
author: norm m.

description:
Came to Mango Medley after eating at Shanghai Dumpling King.  Needless to say, very stuffed!  Somehow we always end up getting Asian desserts when we're in the area.  I'm not going to complain!

A friend of mine (who still hasn't made it over to Mango Medley) heard good things about this place.  The dessert menu seem slightly limited compared to places like Creations.  For example, I couldn't find the standard mango sago or glutinous rice balls!  Whaaa?  

I decided to go with the Mango Bliss and chose dofu fa as the base.  Interesting concept to be able to choose the base.  The dessert was quite good and refreshing.  The mango was excellent.  A little confused what happened with the dofu fa.  It was pulverized at the bottom.  Also the price point ($6.50) seemed a bit steep.  The waitress was attentive and friendly.

Probably wouldn't make a special trip back, but if I were in the area it would be a good dessert option.
author: Christopher W.

description:
Terrible. It took 25 minutes to get my dessert, and by the time I got it, I forgot what I ordered. 

Why I tipped 25%? Dear god, it is still beyond me.
author: Erica A.

description: Got the Tomato fried rice with chicken to go.  Good sized portion, could have used a little more chicken.  Flavor was delicious.  Marked as a spicy dish, but was well seasoned rather than burn your mouth hot.  Hints of fresh thai basil in there as well.  Delicious.  Would definitely get this again.
author: T. E.

description:
After a LONG day running around to places, I met up my friend Annie to come here and grab some dessert. It was pretty packed at 1030 on a Wednesday! I wanted to sit on those comfy looking seats but it was all taken so the only seat left was near the door, which I always hate sitting near the door! 

It took seriously forever for service. Actually, I had to go grab menus for myself, then I had to go grab a waitress so we can order, then one dessert came out and 10-15 minutes later, the next came out so the first one was just sitting there.

We ordered the Mango Medley, fresh mangoes, grapefruit and mango juice and puree and mango sticky rice. Pretty good but not as sweet as I  would like it. But, while it was sitting there, I could just smell the mango aroma!!! I just couldn't keep my eyes of it. I felt bad cuz my friend was talking to me while I was just staring at the dessert wanting to eat it.. =(

We also ordered the Mixed fruit panna cotta with mixed fresh fruit on top. Panna cotta was actually really good. Good smooth texture with the perfect amount of sweetness. Loved it. Although the fruit wasn't sweet at all, the mango sauce made up for it when you eat it all together.

They not only sell desserts but also entrees like fried rice, noodles, and mango salad with prawns! Lots of MANGO stuff but it IS called Mango Medley. 

I'll probably come again to try something else..
author: Juliane N.

description:
I loved their foods and desserts, used to come here after 9pm, but services were tooooooooooo slow, it's worth if u have time limit!!! 

Self server tea or water since only one server and she has to make food as well, but nice atmosphere to sit and eat ! 

Mango pillow and creme brulee were so good!  I always order their pasta then dessert ! The sad thing is that they don't offer grill honey chicken/ shrimp pasta with olive oil, it was soooo good!
author: Lam K.

description:
I was appalled at how awful my experience at Mango Medley was. 

I've lived in the neighborhood for a couple of years and had yet to try it out... so last night I figured what the hell. NEVER AGAIN!!!!!!
 
Right off the bat the waitress chucked like 6 menus at us and then without saying a word walked away for about 10 minutes. When she finally returned we ordered an appetizer dish that was a combination of a few different appetizers. There were muscles, salmon toast, eggplant, and a small salad. The salmon toast was FISHY as can be, the muscles tasted like some weird combination of vinegar and ripe cheese, the eggplant had some chunks of sausage or bacon or something, and the salad didn't taste fresh at all. Every bite seemed worse than the last. 

I've never said "this tastes weird" so often in my life. After eating maybe 1/3 of the appetizer dish, the waitress brought out my girlfriend's salad. The prawns were ok, but the rest of the salad was just a strange mix-match of fruit and vegetables that seemed completely random, and the sauce / salad dressing didn't add anything whatsoever. Then 15 minutes later, the waitress finally brought out the stir fry terriyaki chicken that I ordered which wasn't terrible, but not nearly as tasty as the frozen trader joes stir fry that I make at home. 

My water was gone in the first 5 minutes and the waitress never offered me any more. Then once we finished "nibbling" at our "meal" no waitress didn't ask us if we wanted desert, but simply brought out the check.
