Then I tried to pay with my credit card, but was told that they didn't accept credit cards. The waitress then pointed to a non-existent sign up front and said "no credit card all over place."

Then she pointed across the street to a market where I could supposedly get cash from, but when I walked over there, they were closed. I had to walk 3 blocks down to the 7-11 to get cash to pay for the SLOP that had been piled in front of me. 

My campaign to make sure that nobody ever goes here again begins with this posting, and will not end until everyone I know here's about this dump and how horrible my experience was in it.
author: Andy B.

description:
I was so in love with this place. But the affair's over. 

Brought a couple friends here the other night and had a 3-hour dinner (yikes). We waited a long time to place our order, to get our food (20 minute wait between dishes), to get our dessert, to get the bill.... wait, wait, wait.

It was just overall unpleasant having to wait so long. 

I've had cravings for their yummy desserts and want to try some of their other items on the menu but can't seem to bring myself to go there again.
author: Jane N.

description:
This place looks like a cute, hole-in-the-wall joint located in the basement of someone's living abode (just as many other places in the Sunset are). But as cute as this little place is, the customer service can be anything but cute. It's not horrible, but it isn't anywhere close to mediocre as well. 

We came in on a Sunday night and it was definitely not crowded as the reviews say (but the place is very small and crammed). But I don't remember who my waiter was just because she was so ABSENT. We saw her a total of three short times...once when she took our orders (which took forever), another when she handed us our food, and finally another when she handed us our bill. No water, no tea. Not even a checkup. I was SAD (mainly because I was thirsty and wanted some water). 

And as I've mentioned before, the seating in there is quite small and cramped. We sat at this table for four and the table next to ours was only a few shoulder-lengths apart. I was basically listening into the other table's conversation...it was quite entertaining though. 

I ordered the Mango + Ice Cream Cream Pillow, which is basically a CREPE shaped into a square. It was good, but nothing spectacular as it is only a crepe.

So...nothing too special. It's only nice for Outer Sunset folks as it is one of the few Asian dessert places south of Sunset Blvd.
author: David W.

description:
This place is pretty solid in their food execution and presentation. Service was as good as could be expected for a busy 11pm rush. Yes most of the tables were full.  I ended up getting takeout.  Server was very nice but again, very busy.  She let me know she would get to me as soon as she could which was great.  I will be coming back here to try other dishes.  I ended up getting the seasonal tom yum stir fry.  The only thing I didn't like about this was the eggplant.  I hate eggplant and it was a featured vegetable in the dish.  I'll have to ask for no eggplant next time.  
The only other thing that was a huge issue was the smell.  It smelled like months old cat piss in there.  I'm not sure if it always smells like that or if they have had an issue recently.  It was borderline unbearable.  I got take out so I was ok.  I'll update if the smell changes.  I wouldn't take a date here with that smell but it's great that this spot is open late!
author: Koa K.

description: Their dessert is MUY BUENO. I mean you have to wait, but there's only one waitress so it's understandable. She was very nice and talked to my friend and I. Definitely is a place to try at least once.
author: Jade F.

description:
My friends and I are not really satisfied about the foods and service.
The waitress was NOT acting in a POLITE way. When my friend asked for a cup of hot tea. She was shocked and replied loudly " Tea?" And, she did't tell us that they charge for tea. Besides that, her attitude was not good. When she took order for us, her COMMUNICATION STYLE made us don't feel comfortable. She always hided. When we wanted more water, we could not find her and asked for more. And never asked if there were any things we need. But, she was totally different when serve the customer just sat near us. She was so nice to HIM. 
SO, we feel so  disappointed.
author: Amy T.

description:
0 service, I walked in during the dinner time, there were only one table sitting. they don't even bother to turn a single damn light on. Sat down for over 5 mins and I don't think the waitress realizes we exist. Go there if u enjoy self-service!

---------------------------------------
Updated: I have come here couple times again, food is very good :)
author: Ryan S.

description: I come with my mom every few weeks for lunch and we've tried a lot of things! Highly recommend: the house salad (mango and pork shoulder when available), home made soy milk, HK milk tea, green tea latte, mango frappe, durian frappe, the mushroom noodle soup, the pork chop noodle soup... Basically everything! There is one main lady here, Eugenie, and she's the cook, barista, waitress and bus-er... So you might have to wait, but I guarantee you'll love the food!
author: Elizabeth L.

description: Absolutely loved the baked salmon & baked rice!! One of the best casserole dishes that I've ever eaten, sorry mom!
author: Steven J.

description:
Tried the Mango Frapp and was pretty good...... some say its amazing but, maybe I'm just a tough reviewer.

Not amazing but, never had a fruit/mango frapp before this place....
author: Jeong K.

description:
This place needs more help. Service is SLOW. But I can't really blame her because there was only one waitress working the floor.

My friend and I came in on a Friday night after our work shift -- 10:30pm. We waited 5 minutes to be seated and around another 20 to get our order taken. 20 minutes later is when our drinks came and 15 after that our entrees. I have to wait an hour for my food? Really? I don't know how slow a kitchen could be! Please, I have better things to do than to sit and wait an hour to eat mediocre food.

I even heard the table next to us complain that they were there for 45 minutes and they had their dessert come out with their dinner.

DO NOT COME UNLESS THE PLACE IS EMPTY OR YOU HAVE A TON OF TIME TO SPARE AND ARE NOT HUNGRY.

Will not come back.
author: Stefanie S.

description:
Mango Medley, I came here because K was craving Panna Cotta and when searching on yelp, this place served Panna Cotta and mango! And you can't beat outer sunset for parking and convenience so off we went.  It sounded so promising that I thought I might have another desert spot that I can come to for Asian deserts.

When we got here, there was only 1 waitress.  The location is like two store fronts where they tore a wall down and it was very awkward.  We didn't know where to go to find the waitress or where to sit.  When finally seated, the awkward bench seating was hard and uncomfortable.  I guess there were waters in the middle of the restaurant that were self service which we had no idea about until another couple went for it but there was no mention about it from the waitress.  Kinda important don't you think?

It took at least 10 minutes for the waitress to come and take our order and another 45 MINUTES, 45 MINUTES!!!! How long does it take to put some panna cotta in a bowl and pour mango syrup over it?!?!?! The only redeeming quality that makes this place earn 2 stars is the mango desert was actually pretty damn good.  Mango chunks with mango ice cream and mango syrup.  The panna cotta was buttery and creamy, a little rich after awhile but the first couple bites were delicious.  K was equally happy with her desert but damn, that customer service.  Atrocious.

Fix the service, make a desert as quick as any other Asian desert place in the city and you would have so much more business and RETURN business but until then, terrible.
author: Brian C.

description:
Been here about 4 times. Came here last Friday with NOT so great of an experience.

First, we get to the place and got seated right away which is kind of a first for me since we usually arrive here packed. Looked over the menu and ordered mango+ice cream pillows, with my friends getting a Mango Medley delight and a frappe. We sit there and wait.

THE ORDERS TOOK FOREVER! We waited over 30 minutes for our food..and we didn't understand why since the place was almost empty. The service was horrible.

Yeah the pillows are ok, but I can find something else better at some other place with better service.
author: Kathleen A.

description:
Regular here, this place is a cool, small, and casual place to mingle if you are not in a hurry.  A MUST TRY!!!

Food: 4 stars
There is only one chef and she cooks to order!  Everything is pretty yummy; I've tried many of their dishes and have no complaints so far.  I also like the fact that there's a twist on the Asian fusion cuisine.  The chef makes everything herself and comes up with her own original creations.  Uses all natural and even some organic ingredients!

Service: 3 stars
As mentioned, this is a good place if you are not in a rush.  The chef does take her time to cook food properly.  Staff is friendly and attentive.  FYI: self service to getting your own tea and utensils. 

Ambiance: 3 stars
The place is very small but its a decent casual atmosphere.  

*Save room for dessert...
author: Foodie F.

description: I've been here a few times and it never fails....SERVICE is super slow. It takes forever to get served and again forever to get your food. The last time I was here it was a Friday night around 8:00, where all we ordered were some desserts and a Kim Chee fried rice. I have to admit the Kim Chee fried rice was decent enough as well as the desserts but the wait time for our food was horrible....especially when you have preteens with you. I was hoping it would have gotten better from the last time I was here but alas not the case.
author: Kathy Y.

description:
Came here on a Sunday with my Family and got the place for ourselves. I guess not many people go out for dessert on Sunday. 

Ordered Set B on the Specials Menu, Kimchi fried rice, hot milk tea and green tea cream pillows, pana-cotta with mango sauce, and mango medley delight.

Best Dessert Out of All (Pana-Cotta w/ Mango Sauce)
The mango sauce that accompanies the pana-cotta, similar to yogurt pudding  jello that is not to sweet makes the dessert just right. 

Green Tea Creme Pillows
A dish with two thin crepes wrapped around whip Creme and green tea ice cream, making squares like pillows. 

Mango Delight
This would be a great dessert for Mango lovers but too sweet for my taste. 

Kimchi fried rice wasn't so good.
author: Sylvia C.

description:
Soooo, after a great day, I was looking forward to spending some time with my boyfriend and a great meal. The place we wanted to go eat was filled and had a line so we checked out Mango Medley. I am embarrassed my boyfriend even paid for this humorous meal. It was so horrible all we could do was laugh. 

The waitress gave us a menus that splattered all over the table. I felt like I about to take a test on Asian Fusion. I have been sick so I ordered a ginger lemon water (hot) and that was tasty but it ended there. The starter was scary at best and was far from tasty. The waitress brought my salad (which was my entrée) and took 15 minutes to bring my boyfriend's food, which was also a little iffy. 

Thank goodness we were the first ones in the place so we could leave first. People started coming in and one man commented that he would be waiting for his food for a long time at which time I noticed no one had their food. Never again. YUCK and YUCK!

We were in for a adventure and we got one.
author: Nicole M.

description: Bad customer service, there's only one person working where she will get really really stress and start to get mad at her customers plus Not gonna leave tips.
author: Mabel M.

description:
Love their food 

 - go there when you are not in a rush
 - if plan to do a take out, call first


p.s. favorite drink -- jasmine milk tea
author: Jul L.

description:
Finding late night restaurants (ahem...by late I mean 10:30p) in the Outer Richmond/Sunset is like looking for sidewalks that don't smell like pee in San Francisco - they're rare but you just follow your nose.  

So here we were last Saturday night, excited to get our grub on - and we were throughly underwhelmed.  Service is disorganized (we had to beg them to "re-open" the kitchen at 10:30 - even though the sign said the kitchen closes at 1115) and slow (it took ~1 hour to get 2 orders of fried rice) and the entrees are very bland (thank god for sriracha rooster sauce).  Calling it Asian "fusion" is pretty big stretch for this place - it's about as fusion as IHOP is International...

All in all, one star for being open late in the Richmond and one star for serving mango sticky rice with black rice - next time you're out of late night options in the Richmond hit up Walgreens for some mint choco chip Clif Bars instead!
author: Rosers M.

description: 1.5 hour wait for 4 bake rice and 1 noodle soup. the bake seafood rice used cheaper quality alternative. food are getting more salty. service staff need training to learn how to properly interact with customer without getting customer angry simply by disrespectful conversation. i used to love the seafood bake rice but the quality reduced to a point of no longer taste good at all. the chicken/duck bake rice is way too salty and charge $18 is insane. no longer worth the wait.
author: Peaceatom ..

description:
I was having horrible pains in my stomach when I got here, so I wasn't looking for a great experience anyway.

There apparently is only one waitress.  She sat us down and specifically told us that it would be awhile.  We were set on coming to this place, so we said OK.  So we ordered our drinks, felt like it took 20 minutes to come.  Luckily there were Japanese magazines to keep my friends entertained.  As for me, I had to play with my phone since I have no interest in Japanese magazines whatsoever!  When the waitress came back again, we ordered our food, which seriously took a longgg time to come.  However, the dishes came consistently after the first place was put on our table.

Hm.. I guess I would come here again, because I shouldn't let a stomachache ruin my experience.
author: Tina L.

description:
NOTE: SHOULD BE ZERO STARS.

Honestly, they shouldn't even be in business... because they don't know how to run one.  Food takes more than 1 hour to serve, and everything is self-served -  get your own menu, your own tea/water, your own utensils, plates.  

4 of us walked in at 7:00pm. There were 2 other tables occupied.  We ordered a red bean drink, 1 appetitzer and 3 dishes.  By 8:15pm, only the appetitizer and drink came out.  We asked the waitress where is our food?  Her response, "they came here first (pointing at the 2 tables who arrived earlier than us), so after they get their meal, then you get yours."  No apologies whatsoever.  We were so damn angry at this point. This place is SO RIDICULOUS.  

We paid for the drink and appetitizer and WALKED OUT.  

I am so disappointed with any of the Yelpers here who gave this restaurant anything above 2 stars.  You guys are so sad to wait 1 hour for the food and have crappy service (or NO SERVICE).  Shame on you for writing a good review on a bad restaurant.
author: Jannie Q.

description:
I had been waiting for 20mins...just to make an order,but it seemed they need more staffs! I understand it is the crowded place that make them so disorganized,but I would be glad if they can give me at least an informal apologize.
something like 'sorry' would be fine
The worst part is ,when I told a waitress that me and my friends have been waiting for 20mins,raising our hands,the feedback was 'oh,I didn't notice you guys are there!'
And after 5mins,we finally made our order.
The quality of food is the reason for the two stars I gave.
author: Beau L.

description:
Despite the reviews here on yelp, I wanted to try this place with my own judgement. I can honestly say service is sooooooo slow here but then again, I don't blame our waitress. I blame the owners for not hiring help for her. She is the one who seats guests, take orders, bust tables, and cashier. 

Now onto the food, my boyfriend and I ordered the baked bacon & mushrooms spaghetti, kimchi fried rice, and an iced honey lemon tea. The spaghetti was super bland and dry. Eck...not good but because my boyfriend was hungry, he scarfed the food down. My kimchi fried rice was not bad. Was it the best I ever had? Eh...me think not. The Spot's kimchi fried rice is way better. Finally, the iced honey lemon tea had no lemon taste whatsoever...sad face. 

I will not return to try anything else...mainly because I had such a bad experience. Food was a disappointment.
author: Serena F.

description:
Disclosure: I'm a mango fanatic!!!  So, I'm bound to love a place named MANGO Medley where they serve mango desserts.   Yummmmz.

My friends and I were in the neighborhood for dinner, and instead of eating dessert at the expensive restaurant we were already at, we headed a few blocks down to Mango Medley instead.  What a great decision!  I had the Mango Medley Delight, which has mango, pomelo, and coconut jelly.  The pomelo was broken up into big chunks; it would be more awesome if it was broken up into its individual pomelo droplets of juicy goodness . . . that's what the nice dessert places in China do anyways.  We also had their cream pillows, which are crepes folded into a pillow-like shape.  The purple yam one was really good, and it's not often you find caramelized purple yams on the dessert menu.  

Wish I lived near this place.  I'd probably be there every day!
author: Sonia L.

description:
I absolutely love this place! I've been here multiple times (before I began yelping, hence no check-ins and previous reviews) but it's one of those places where you'll keep coming back. Very cozy and comfy setting, but can get crowded past the 11PM mark. Great late night dinner or dessert place.

If I were to pick one thing from the menu I would die for would be the... KIMVHI FRIED RICE! I've had the Kimchi fried rice from Kukje.. This place makes the best!!!!!! Must try... High recommended :)

Hope you all enjoy!
author: Kary Y.

description: Their mango ice cream fruit dessert is a must try! Their service is a bit slow but it's because they have only one person taking and bringing out the orders. Other than that the desserts are okay if you're in that part of town.
author: c h.

description:
I can't believe how long I had to wait for the food. I have to say that the food is pretty good.  Even though I totally understand that they only hv 2-3 people working in the kitchen but an hour wait is very unacceptable when the restaurant is not even 70% filled with customers. 

Don't let the number of customers in the restaurant fool you. They just don't hv enough people to serve and to cook.

I love the "pillow" dessert and fried rice.  But I'm not sure if they'd taste good if I wasn't starved for a hour before I had them.
author: D C.

description:
I wrote a previous review on this place with only 3 stars and have decided to bump up a star since I've become a regular!

Yes, their service is slow (if only they would just hire another cook back there), but the food is well worth the wait!  I love their happy hour specials because the meals come with free coffee or milk tea!  I have been satisfied with nearly all of their dishes, and the waitress pretty much knows what I want ever time I come.

A few dishes that are worth it to try:
+ Kim Chi Fried Rice
+ Spaghetti Bolognese
+ Vietnamese Braised Chicken w/ Rice
+ Vietnamese Spring Rolls

And top it off with a yummy mango ice cream dessert w/ buttermilk panna cotta! 

I'd give actually a 4.5 if I could just because the food is so addicting.
author: Milz T.

description:
I visit Mango Medley at least once every two weeks.
I love their menu selections. Not only is there a lot to choose from, there are different tastes and styles you could select.
Although there is limited seating and the meal or dessert preparations can become an hour long wait I feel it is the perfect scenario for friends, couples, or families to get together in a cozy corner and just spend time with each other while they wait for their orders to come.
My favorites are the creme brulee, tofu-fa and the mango bliss!
I've also tried their green tea frappe, and panacotta, but of course, I could only choose to eat so much when I'm there at any given time.
It's a lovely place to chill, especially if you are looking for something that's open past 10pm.
author: Becky D.

description:
My friends and I went here for dessert, and it was such a disapointment. Not only did the desserts taste bland and disgusting, but they looked pretty much like how they tasted. One of my friends wasn't planning to get anything and just asked for water, but the waitress said each customer had to pay a minimum of $3, even if all he got was self-served tap water.

This place is definitely way overrated.
author: Connie C.

description: Ain't coming back again. Maybe togo if i really need dessert. Place is dead service is horrible don't know how they stay open. I get the creeps eating there. Its so quiet and spooky. Anyways "NEXT" review. I rather eat ramen at home lol
author: Larry L.

description: Everything is great! But can't go if ur hungry! Cos it will take 20-30min per order..
author: Titus H.

description:
We went here after a huge lunch at Old Mandarin Islamic Restaurant.  We drove and found parking on Sun 6/3/07.

This place is Hella Slow.  Even though I was full, I still want to get my order taken & food in front of me before I turn another year older.

We got:
HK milk tea hot, if u want condensed milk it's an extra .30.  WTF.  Small is $2.30.  Tasted ok.

Shared a mango medley delight $5.25-which was tasty.

Peanut & sticky rice $2.5 was ok, not my favorite.  Don't like rice for dessert just weird for me.

One unisex bathroom & decent when I went.

Total was $13.40, I don't think I'll go back.
author: Ann L.

description:
I came here last weekend with my boyfriend. It was pretty empty; it was just us and another group of people, but a couple more groups came in later on. I ordered the Sunday special, which was kimchi fried rice, and you get to choose a drink and dessert, so I got milk tea and green tea cream pillows. My boyfriend got baked seafood and mango bliss.

Let me tell you, service is SUPER SLOW. I think they only have one chef working. Our plates didn't come until probably 20-25 minutes after we ordered. The kimchi fried rice was actually really good, and it's coming from someone who doesn't enjoy kimchi very much. My boyfriend enjoyed his baked seafood as well. After we were done, we waited for our desserts. It took a REALLY long time for our desserts to come out, and there were probably just 4 groups dining in this restaurant. We probably waited a good 30-40 minutes for our desserts after we were done finishing our plates. The desserts were very delicious though! The green tea cream pillows were green mochi with whip cream wrapped around the crepe skin. Mango bliss was kind of like mango puree, mango ice cream, mango bits, and panna cotta. I would have to recommend the mango bliss because it was mouthwatering! I love it so much. The panna cotta was excellent. I enjoyed the cream pillows too. I'm definitely going to come back here to try more desserts! Bring some cash because it's cash only.
author: Vivian L.

description: Slow and horrible customer service. Only one person working?! Why? Quality of the food is not bad but the price a bit higher for the amount you get. I'd rather go to a place in Richmond for something similar.
author: John Z.

description:
Service is extremely slow.  A one women show!  She takes orders, prepares the food and serves!

winner: the ginger soy milk! It's to DIE for!!!! So good!!!! I cannot stop thinking about it

food:  Alot of the food comes in a ceramic dish with baked rice and cheese veggies and some type of meat or seafood.  Great concept, but not a lot of variation.

dessert: everyone raves about the pillow puffs.  I honestly was very disappointed.  It's like a crepe wrapped
author: Joanne H.

description:
CASH ONLY

this is not a bad place to go if you want a late night snack.  came here around 10ish to try out their desserts! :]  conveniently closes late for all you late night snackers.  got the mixed fruit with grass jelly and it was pretty good.  can't say i love it but definitely something i would order again.  i saw the pillows and would love to try that next time!

the place is a bit small and can be crowded.  water or hot tea are self served.  i kinda felt bad for the waitress, she was the only one doing everything in the front that night and it was just her running around.
author: mea f.

description:
Went in today to get some kimchi fried rice for take out, as my roommate had let me have a bite of his last week and I'd loved it and had been craving it ever since. It's damn good kimchi fried rice. Not sure if I like this one better or Toyose's, but whatever. The place was kinda cute in a dingy, cramped kind of way. Service was quick for my small order, it was no frills but totally acceptable, the lady was nice.

Here's the less cool part: my other roommate went here last night and complained of a strange smell, which she attributed to funky meats or something (she's vegetarian), but she really wasn't sure what it was. I kinda shrugged it off and forgot about the comment, but it all came flooding back when I stepped into the restaurant. The place reeks. It didn't smell like funky meat, it smelled more like...ehh...poorly controlled catbox odor? It is not my business to spread that sort of rumor, cause that would surely be breaking some public health/food service laws and I'm not saying that's what it was, but the point is, it was foul. A previous review on here said they smelled the stinky fruit durian in here before, so maybe that was it. I've never actually knowingly smelled durian, so I'm not sure. But wow. It was an unfortunate aroma, and they should really do something to remove or cover it up. I'd order food from here again, but as long as it smells like that, I'd never want to dine in. The place was nearly empty when I went in, so maybe others agree.

Anyhoo, uh...kimchi fried rice. Yum?
author: Carly G.

description: Delicious home cooked style meal! Love the braised beef with tomatoes and veggies. Yum  :-)
author: Sheue L.

description:
Inexpensive
Friendly service
Tasty food

Only reason I didn't give five stars is because it's quite a small spot, parking can be a pain, and there's only like two people working so the food takes awhile to get there.

I had their mango medley, my two friends had the green tea cheesecake and some kind of soup that i forgot the name of. The mango medley and green tea cheesecake were delicious!
author: Neek W.

description:
It's seems to be common knowledge that anything you order at this place is going to take at least 15 minutes to come out. I had a good experience with the food there last time, despite the wait, but I thought, "Hey, I only live 4 blocks away! I'll just call ahead of time, order for pick-up, chill in my cozy apartment, and just grab my food when it's ready."

Simple, right?

Wrong. 
They NEVER answer the phone. One night I called FOUR TIMES and never got an answer. On Sunday night we called THREE times and they never picked up. For their total inability to answer a phone, they a) lose a star and b) lose a lot of opportunities to get my money.

So, essentially, there is absolutely nothing you can do about the wait for food. No matter what you do, you are doomed to walk/drive yourself there, and just sit and wait out the 15 minutes while you twiddle your thumbs and salivate.
author: Rachel A.

description:
Service was actually slightly faster this time around!  Not horribly long, but still expect your dishes to come out one at a time at this two women operation.

Their savory dishes are actually quite good- I had a very garlicky Portuguese baked pasta with chicken, which at $9 was plenty of food to split between two

They've some new menu items including the decadent mango bliss, which is a huge glass of mango ice cream with mango sauce, and topped with fresh mango.  It looks amazing.

Their ginger milk custard is still delicious too.
author: Joanne G.

description:
While on my panna cotta excursion, I came across this find on yelp!  The pictures looked good and it seemed like they had a huge variety of comfort foods, too.  

They do!  ALOT...fried rice, noodles, ramen, desserts, milk teas, coffees, etc etc etc!  Unfortunately, the panna cotta was not right...the fruits were dry and soggy...the flavor was heavy and nothing compared to the one I had at Roys.  :(  Disappointed.

I haven't tried anything else on the menu but am still curious to see how the food is.  Seems like a cool place to get a late night snack after a night out of drinking or to satisfy the munchies.  :)  I think I'll be back...
author: Kat C.

description: Decent desserts but rather slow and sluggish service. In spite of the restaurant name, I hear that their actual food is good but... I only came for dessert. I got the mango with panna cotta. Panna cotta was great, it's delicious and sweet and I recommend it as the one thing to get here. It's easy so you can't get it wrong - it's basically cream jello. Unfortunately, only three out of our party of four could get a panna cotta base because they ran out at like 9pm. Really? They don't even close for another few hours and they're already out? This place has to tweak a few things like service to really get this place going. The only pro would be their clean and sizable bathroom but I would like to note that I can hear the conversation of the tables located closest to the restroom which makes me wonder if they can hear me pee. Hmm...
author: Ryan L.

description:
I had no idea there were even restaurants this far out in the Sunset. I thought we had wandered into a no man's land of semi-suburbia when my friends pointed out this tiny little gem of Taiwanese desserts. 

Unlike most dessert places - i.e. Sweet Indulgences in Millbrae - this one is not rife with cutesy furniture. Instead it feels like you walked into someone's living room and they just happen to serve delicious desserts. 

We didn't waste our time on the food menu and went straight for the kill. Assessment of our choices. 

1. Sesame dumplings: It only looks like it's floating in a bed of tar! Honestly, awesome. Slightly sweet, turns your teeth black, but completely worth it. 
2. Mango tofu fa: Ordered it on a whim (mango + tofu fa?! wha?!) but it turned out surprisingly good. We received it cold but rumor has it that hot is an option. 
3. Grass jelly and almond jelly w/mango: Light, flavorful, good for sharing. 
4. Mango bliss: It came in a goblet! Mango custard with mango sauce with mango ice cream with mangos. Lives up to its name. 

If you're out here, come visit. If you're not, think about visiting. It's kind of delicious.
author: Madeline N.

description:
I really want to give this place 5 stars because their food is really great. The noodles are cooked like no other, and each of their dishes are very unique like you'll never taste.

But I take customer service very seriously so I have to knock off 2 stars just for that.... it's THAT bad.... they don't even greet you or tell you what to do when you walk in.  My first time coming here I'm just standing there thinking they will seat us but I actually have to ask what do I do!  Well, you seat yourself... but TELL US!!  Don't just look at customers expecting that they know what to do.  They are a cafe too so it's a little confusing.

And when we do choose a seat, we're wondering "Where's the menu?"  And it takes a while just for the waitress to give us menus, and there were only two other people in the restaurant... they weren't busy but they still wouldn't pay attention!

I'll still come back because the food is very good...  Just don't expect good service...
author: Marvin R.

description:
Came back a second time, and it was alright again. Had the ginger soy latte (yummy--ginger is my newfound love), and vegetarian roti, which had some strange concoction of mango, tofu, veggies, and kim chi...it was ok, but I couldn't really taste the kimchi. 

*One qualm: some of the stuff on the menu wasn't even available! A definite negative for mango medley =/
author: Diane G.

description: The food is good but the service is still bad. My friend and i ordered tofu ya for 3.95 and mango pillows for 3.50. Their minimun order posted on the menu for $3. After ordering she said they uped their minimum order to $4 per person. We thought it was unfair since they didn't post it, what to stop any restaurant from making up rules when you decide to dine. We told her we only brought so much cash and it wasn't posted. She told us either order more or she'll charge $4 for each instead. So we basically took the overcharge out of her tip. Although their service was faster than before, they really need to work on their customer service if they want customers to return.
author: Jess H.

description:
Service: 3.5/5
Food: 3.5/5
Wait: 1/5
Price: $
Presentation of food: 3.5/5
Presentation of restaurant: 3/5
Overall: 3/5

I finally decided to come here because a friend recommended it and I was near by already. Everyone wasn't kidding when they say the wait of the food is EXTREMELYYYYY SLOW. So the food isn't that good, but their dessert is worth coming for. I had their Cream of Chicken mushroom spaghetti, it was okay. As for dessert I had their Mango Bliss which consist of Mango Ice Cream, Mango Pieces and I chose their Almond Jelly with it. O-M-G is the Mango frrrresh to death! It's the most Freshest mango I had ever had in my life! I will definitely come back, but most likely come on a day when I'm in no rush. So I can sit and wait, then enjoy the BLiSS :)
author: Eva H.

description: I love the idea of this place - fresh ingredients, a fusion of American Asian cuisine and I love mangos - which is an ingredient in many of the dishes. But the service is slow and you have to wait forever after you order to get an over priced meal that frankly carries less then impressive flavors (to be fair though the hot Jasmine tea I ordered was pretty great).  Since the restaurant is walking distance from my house I REALLY want to like it, but after two visits I've decided its probably not worth going back.
author: Ashley N.

description:
Omg this is like the worse place ever... well not ever but omg.
It was late at night and my friends wanted dessert and this place was close by so we entered. They said they would seat us in 10 minutes but like 2 minutes after they called us. I'm not complaning about that since it's ok but like they took forever to even take down my friends orders they ordered 3 items a strawberry banana pillow , strawberry&banana frappe & mango frappe. Like twenty minutes later my friends strawberry&banana frappe came out i had to say it was delicious. Then five minutes later my friends mango frappe came and it was VERY VERY sweet i thought i was gonna cough to death. Then few minutes later the waiter told us no more strawberries do we want all bananas for our pillows and we said alright then a few minutes later they brought it out. it was pretty sweet too it was like a banana & whip cream wrapped in a crepe. all i tasted was sugar and a banana in my mouth. 
we paid the total of like 18 something. we got there at 10 : something and left at 12..
author: Kayla F.

description: "They simplified the menu which makes it much easier to order. Don't come here if you're in a rush cause they're slow. Food, drinks and desserts are awesome. I think they're slow because they do each dish as it's ordered."
author: Greg L.

description:
Believe it when everyone says that service is SLOW.  It's ridiculous!  I didn't think it could be THAT bad... so I gave it a chance.  Came here with 10 people tonight for some dessert, around 10pm.  The place really only holds 20 people max.  It's very small.  Luckily for us, there were 2 really nice people who offered to move tables for us so that we could all sit together.  (THANKS if you're reading this!!)  Don't come here with a lot of people.  

The menu is pretty extensive, and has no real identity... we couldn't tell what culture this restaurant was supposed to be...  We all ordered different things, but they all came out one by one... like 20 minutes after an other.  It was ridiculously slow. 

My friend tried to order vanilla ice cream by itself (he doesn't like asian desserts) and the waitress looked at him as if it was the most absurd order EVER.  After a bit of convincing, the waitress said regular vanilla ice cream was fine (for $3.25! - I mean come on! They serve red bean paste over vanilla ice cream but we still had to convince her to serve regular ice cream?!?! LOL)

We also ordered the Roti with squash curry dipping sauce (NO MANGO ROTI EXISTS!! =(  I asked ), Mango Medley, Mixed fruit panna cotta, mango tofu-fa (sweet tofu), corn pancakes, chicken and rice, purple yam and red bean pillows, thai tea latte, and creme brulee.  For Happy Hour (some daytime hours and after 9pm on weekdays, for #1-8 on the HH menu, you get additional choices of buttermilk panna cotta, tofu-fa, or coffee.  So I got the panna cotta with the Roti.  

The food was good, but again, the service was SOOOOOO incredibly slow that we wanted to cancel half our orders... and even then, we couldn't get the waitress' attention.  I think she goes and helps the person in back cook.  We felt bad for her, but seriously... hire another person!! 

 We also ordered Kimchi fried rice, but the waitress got the order wrong and brought out this tofu, eggplant fried rice.  When we told her it's wrong, she told us there was no more rice, so she couldn't re-do the order.  How pathetic!  My friend was so hungry that she took it anyway.  It tasted good, but seriously, get your act together!

Other than that mishap, the mango puree that accompanies most desserts is absolutely delicious!!!  The mangos were ripe and sweet.  The panna cotta had too much of a cream cheese flavor, I would have done without it.  The Tofu-fa flavor was strongly masked by the mango puree.  You couldn't taste the tofu-fa at all unless you ate it by itself, and even then it wasn't as sweet as you thought.  But it's still good.  The corn pancakes were different from any kind of asian pancake I've had.  You can tell it was made from scratch.  Very tasty, but SOo hot when it comes out!  The Roti came with 2 roti cakes, and the squash curry sauce.  The sauce was a little spicy, but it went well with the Roti.  It was actuallly very delicious!  I would definitely get that again if I ever go back... The Thai tea latte was hot, and tasted really good.  It also reminded me of the thai tea latte that i have in packets at home.  The pillows took the longest to come out (around 11:40pm).  There were 4 pillows--red bean and purple yam bits with whipped cream wrapped in crepe-like wrapper into the form of a pillow.  It was good, but would have been better if the stuff inside wasn't cold!! and if it had more powdered suger on top.

Overall, good food but terrible service.  It's not fancy inside, so don't expect the plates/cups/utensils to be fancy either.  Set aside a good 2hours if you want to come here.
author: Diane L.

description:
My lady and I have been here 6 times....and I have to say, the food is great and reasonably priced. I once gave this place 5 stars. 
Sad to say...this had to change.
There are two waitresses here....one is reasonably good at what she does. The other is absolutely awful. (You know who you are) She acted almost irritated that she had to serve us. As is customary here...we walked in, and seated ourselves, and then served ourselves with water and tea. After 15 minutes...I go to get a menu. She sees this and snatches the menu out of my hand and tosses it back on the counter.....and motions to where Im supposed to get a menu(as if Im supposed to do it at all) . The menus turned out to be in a pile of food waste on a table at the back. Finally she takes our order, and 35 minutes later the food comes.

As Meh as meh can get!!!
author: Clayton D.

description:
This review is for their dessert only.

Came here after dinner at Sushi Time.

FOOD: Had the Mango Delight with panna cotta... Mango puree, mango chunks, and mango ice cream, drizzled with condensed milk, all on a bed of panna cotta, served in a cocktail glass. *Drool* The mangoes are so sweet and juicy, I'd trek all the way from Oakland for some.  

Also had some of my friend's mango pillows. It was good to try, but I was imagining something more along the lines of mango mousse. 

SEATING: The place is small, in a cozy kinda way. Never had to wait for a seat. We came with 5 people last time, and 6 tonight. Overall capacity can't be over 20, probably somewhere in the teens.

NOTES: Bring good company because the wait is considerable (after: seating, ordering, food arrival, bill to come, change to come). Think of it as quality time with your fellow diners. Tea and water is self served. Cash only, but there's an ATM in the 7 eleven.
author: Stanley L.

description:
My girlfriend took me here last night. We ordered Thai Chicken Salad, a White sauce pasta with chicken and mushrooms, and a sweet red bean desert. The food here is great. Very good and homie HK/JPN style Asian fusion. Not American Asian fusion, which I don't like much.  

The place is small, but that must be why they can keep up with the good cooking. I will have to try more of their deserts next time.

Customer service is good, too. Based on my girlfriend, they hired more servers so maybe that's why I didn't feel the bad services other yelpers mentioned before. 

Will come again for sure.
author: Lance C.

description:
This place rocks. I have never had anything that was less than outstanding here. I eat here about twice a week since it is the closest restaurant to my house.They have an overwhelming selection of very reasonably priced food. The place is run by only 2 ladies and it can take a long time to get your food. However, they will tell you as you come in to go elsewhere if you are at all in a rush. The wait is well worth it. 
I usually don't understand a single word of what anyone says in there, since I don't speak any Asian language. That in an of itself makes for a very charming atmosphere. I like this hole-in-the wall type place an awful lot.
author: Greg S.

description:
This place has changed its menu a bit from what I recalled the last time I came here. I was hoping to order some noodles but now the emphasis is on HK-style western food such as pasta plates. Since I was already inside and sat down, I ordered a bacon mushroom pasta with ground beef.  It was quite good, just the right amount of pasta compared to other similar style restaurants which tend to give too much for my appetite. I think likely I will make more return visits.

I agree with others that service can be slow because they don't have a large staff. That's okay as long as the one doing the cooking does pay more attention to the food. Also here it turns out you can get your own water or tea, don't need to ask the server for refills, etc.

This place has HK-style dessert also, but not as large of a selection as places like Golden Island on Noriega or 37 Degrees on Taraval.
author: H K.

description: good kimchi fried rice..and mango pancake ..got to try
author: Stella L.

description: I love Mango Medley!! Love tofu-fa, ANY of their mango desserts and the variety of beverages they have! I love how they have savory food too so you can have a full meal instead of just desserts. The only down side is they close wayyyy too early... I'm hoping they extend their weekend hours to late night
author: Cliff T.

description:
The food here are pretty good. However, my low rating goes to it's service, price and serving speed. The food here are way too overpriced, just changing an ice cream flavor to another has a 75 cent surcharge. I used to be a frequent customer to this place, some times I would wait over an hour just for 2 simple orders. But, the service here is really bad. I understand the workers uncaring attitude, sadly even the owner doesn't know how to make things right. I always say hi to the owner and talk to the owner here and there, brought tons of friends over. The owner always has this "poker face" and beat it attitude, she doesn't know how to treat frequent customers better. She never once be like "hey ! I see you coming here a lot ! Here's a little bonus for always coming back". She's always like, " you dont like the surcharge ? You got any complains ? Beat it, I can't help you. Once my friend dirtied her floor accidentally with food,  she complained I didn't clean it up for her or informed her to clean it up. Really? It is not my responsibility to keep your restaurant in check.  I don't need this kind of attitude from an owner of a business.  You know what ? Now a cup of tea cost money!! Seriously? A cup of tea! When you are thirsty from the long wait. In this economy, I would rather spend my money else where, cheaper and I am treated way better.

Update:
This place is just beyond comical now. They have large sign on the bathroom saying, you will be paying to use it if you are not a customer LMAO ! Their water is now bitter lemon peel water ! When you ask for the key to the bathroom, the owner gives you a hell of a time. If you sat down and do not order, you are asked to leave, even though all your friends ordered. They used to be packed with customers to now only several tables at most. Haha I will have the last laugh when this place close down. One of the owner's new restaurant already closed down before it even opened for a month, talk about management and bad attitude.
author: Swifty L.

description: This place has good food, but if you're starving I wouldn't recommend you to come here to eat. They tend to take a very long time, what feels like a century to make your food or just a drink. They seem to be under-staffed in the kitchen, so they're not able to dish out food and drinks quickly. I think the kitchen only has 2 people working in there. Someone who's starving and waiting 20+ minutes for their order to come out can be very very aggravating. On top of that, the portion of the food here is pretty small considering the price they charge you. At times, the wait for seats can be very long as well. Since food takes forever to come out , then customers will take forever to leave, therefore it'll be forever till you get seats.
author: Lucy C.

description:
Being HK style food fans and after reading reviews of this place, hubby and I decided to give it a try.  We came on a Tuesday night around 8:30pm, and the place had about 3 tables.  We sat ourselves and picked up menus on the empty tables to decide what to order.  Since we had already read the reviews we kind of expected to do a lot of self-service, which was not a problem with us.

After spending a good amount of time going through their extensive menu (as we could not decide what to order, so many items!), I settled on the bacon and mushroom spaghetti with ground pork, and ordered an organic sesame soy milk.  Hubby chose the baked seafood spaghetti with a tomato-based sauce, with Mango Medley deluxe as the dessert.

The food took a long time to come.  It was very delicious, however.  The bacon and mushroom spaghetti had a light, onion-flavored cream sauce, a right size portion to eat in one sitting, with fresh mushrooms and topped with cheese.  The organic sesame soy drink was great as well; the sesame was ground very finely, and not too much sugar, which was to my liking.  Hubby's baked dish took longer to come since it was baked, but it was good as well, with right amount of seafood, light tomato sauce and al dente spaghetti, topped with cheese.

The Mango Medley deluxe dessert was also pretty good, with many slices of sweet mango.  It's served with a mango slush underneath with bits of coconut jelly.  The slush was very smooth.

Overall, we liked the food there a lot and definitely will go back.  But I agree with other yelpers - don't go there when you are super hungry - it's more like a place to go when you have some time so you can sit and chat while waiting for the food.
author: Vicky F.

description:
Service: You walk in, find a seat, serve yourself water/tea, wait for the owner to come by and take your order; the owner does everything herself. 

Environment: It was small and cozy with only about 5 tables or so, but it usually doesn't get too crowded. 

Social: I used to come here with someone special after a day of hard work. Now, it is one of the chill spots with me and my girl friends. Due to the fact that it is small, the noise level maintained pretty well because of the small amount of people. Whenever I have some friends visiting the city, I will bring them here too! 

Food: Special ingredient: Mango! So great and so neat that it blends with everything whether it is fried rice entree or sweet desserts. You should definitely try them out!!
author: Lisa R.

description: Cute joint but takes cash only. Kim chi fried rice was good and not too spicy at all (since I can't eat spicy). Also had a fruit bowl and it was good.. kinda small. Overall small but nice place for some late food.
author: Sophia K.

description:
Large extensive menus worry me. I know places like to give variety, but it's just easier on me if I knew which were the decent options. And considering the size of both Mango Medley and the staff, I think they're trying to handle more than they can. But anyway, I visited here twice.

1st time: It was around the time the place first opened, so I think that's why the staff was nice back then, I'm not sure how they are now. I ordered the honey chicken garlic spaghetti (which I think is now discontinued) which I thought was pretty good. The chicken had strong honey flavoring and the noodles were garlicky but not oily. I usually picked out the zucchini, onion, and red pepper because they came in large chunks it felt weird chewing on those at the same time. Since it was a cold night, I had their honey ginger tea which was okay, made my stomachache go away at least.

2nd time: I was nauseated and I really didn't feel like eating but the bf really felt like getting dessert so I brought him here. I just ordered tea and he ordered the red bean soup. We know red bean soup is usually reddish and purple in color, but this particular one came in a faded purple color with black colored beans. WTF? Looked and tasted like it was refrigerated. And since there was like a $3 minimum/person rule and we were 25 cents short, she suggested I order a 50 cent cookie (from the Costco pack). I should have just given her 25 cents for free.

Oh yeah, my bf really had to use the bathroom and but couldn't use the one here. Something about the stench and the dirtiness, maybe the last guy couldn't stomach the dessert either. He's gone before in Safeway and gas station bathrooms but said no way to this one.

Anyway, I think the cooked food looks alright to try, they seem to like experimenting. But pick your desserts carefully. And also, don't trust pictures.
author: Cristal G.

description:
mango medley. i am never in this neighborhood so i didn't know this was here before. my friend took me here the other night because she was craving their mango dessert. i've had lots of mango desserts before and i haven't found one as good as the Hong Kong dessert places in the bay area... until mango medley.  we ordered the mango panna cotta and mango cream pillow.  

the mango panna cotta was ok.  the mango sauce/puree was very good. it was sweet and the mango was ripe. i've had many mango desserts where the mango is still hard! those mangos are not to be served as a dessert. the panna cotta was more on the tart/sour side. not sure why but if you eat it with the mango, it tastes ok. 

the mango cream pillow was good. the pancake was light and not burnt. the cream and the mango ratio was perfect. this is as good as the dessert places in Hong Kong! 

yes, service is very slow because there's only 1 waitress and 1 cook.  the waitress helps the cook out after she takes the orders. if you do not have patients, please don't come here. in the meantime, i'll be back to try their other desserts... or maybe dishes too! 

side note: parking is usually hard around this area.
author: Kapo T.

description: I've been here a few times and each visit has been pretty pleasant. I've been fortunate enough to not have to wait long for a table or for the food. The waitresses have been nice as well. Ive only been there for dessert and highly recommend the cream pillows! I love the cream pillows with mango and mango ice cream. It's light, fluffy and my fav! By the way, they have boxes of mangos in the front so you know they'll be fresh. Ive also had their mango with sticky rice, and their Mango Bliss--also very good. I can't wait to go back and when I do, I will try their food. I've read good things about them, especially their Kimchee fried rice.
author: Tracy L.

description:
I have now been here twice with 8 other people altogether and every person has been very happy with every meal ordered so far - the food really is very good. Very large and varied selection on the menu so even the pickiest of eaters should find something(s) they like. Prices are pretty reasonable with most entrees priced in the $9-11 range. Cash only. 

You will not get your food quickly because there are only 2 employees and if you come here with a large group (5+ people) the meals seem to come out in "waves" so that some members of your party will be halfway finished with their dinner just as other members of your party are having their dinner served. 

This is not the place to go if you want a really quick meal, but if you have the time for a leisurely meal with good company I highly recommend the restaurant.
author: Jen S.

description:
I really want this place to succeed. I live in the area and am all about supporting local business', BUT, and yes there is a big BUT...The service here is bad. I mean REALLY REALLY BAD. Not just, Eh or typical Chinese restaurant bad.....this place just doesn't want your business type of bad.

I've tried to come back a few time hoping that they'll redeem themselves, but alas, this weekend was my last time. I've given up all hope. 

Their food is actually good, which is why I want to come back. But their lack of service is just something I can't deal with anymore. This weekend, I ordered 2 dishes togo. I actually called in thinking this would speed up the process and I was very hopeful. The girl who answered told me they would call me when my order was ready and it would be about 20-30 minutes. Ok, cool. Sounds like the service was pretty good. Well planned. 

1/2 hr later, no call. Ok, so I wait. 
1 hr later, no call. Hmm...getting concerened, and hungry. 
1.5 hrs later....seriously, we waited that long. I called them 3 times, no one picks up. My hubby dropped in to see what was going on. The one waitress (if you can call her that)  told him they were busy. No apologies, no time of when we would get our order, no mention of anything. She actually rushed by him as if he was in her way. This is the same waitress who is always there and never seems to have her act together.

There are plenty of businesses around that actually wants customers. It seems like this place just can't handle their business. If only they were more organized, had better staff, and planned their business well, I can see them succeeding, but for now we're likely to never come back. Their food isn't that great for me to deal with this type of service.
author: Linda L.

description:
Three words: ARE. YOU. SERIOUS?????

The reason for the -4 stars is strictly because of the SERVICE. The chick with the ugly pixie haircut that knows only how to utter phrases such as "Uh yeah", "No", "Leave it", "What is that?" has thee worst customer service EVER. Reasons for this are as followed:

#1) My friends and I walked in and the place was empty, but what do you expect it's a weekday around 11pm so I wasn't expecting anything. But  I DID expect to see a waiter or waitress or someone at the cashier --NOPE. We seat ourselves anyways even though it looked like it was closed, but we knew it was open because we had called earlier. I shout for hello a couple of times but STILL no  one is there. We get the menus ourselves and we figure out what we want, and granted that it's our first time there we aren't sure if maybe we're supposed to go up and order? So we do. Finally the short haired chick "waitress" comes out of god knows where since the place is so small, and we ask if we order here. She replies "No." Okay this chick is getting on my nerves already for the rude and blunt customer service. MINUS ONE STAR

#2) We seat ourselves yet again and she finally comes and takes our order. I order the mango medley delight. Then my friend orders #24, the "waitress" responds by saying "What is that?".. UH, how do you not know what is on the menu? And even if you did not know, don't be rude and act dumb.  Are you serious?? Rude service yet again while not knowing about your own work establishment, i.e., the MENU when youre a waiter for pete's sake, are you kidding me?! MINUS ONE STAR

#3) We get our food after about fifteen minutes or so, and my friend receives her spicy tomato fried rice first. Then comes my mango medley delight. I was really excited it came because I was getting a little hungry. I take one bite and I actually like it! Take another one, and it's pretty good! Then BAM! It's not even one strand of black hair, its like THREE OR FOUR TANGLED OR CRUMPLED TOGETHER LIKE A KNOT in the middle of my dessert! At this point, I'm pretty annoyed.  I go up to the counter because obviously if I called for service earlier and she doesn't come, why try again for the third time?! So I go up there, and there she is, in the kitchen with some other lady that I assume is the cook. I wave to her and say "hello" she just LOOKS at me and turns her head away continuing to talk to the other lady. UH HELLO?! I shout again, she doesnt even turn her head this time. But a moment later she just comes up to the counter, no response. I tell her there is a piece of hair knot in my dessert and she just goes "Uh." And walks back to the kitchen. I'm standing there like WTF. She comes back and says "Uh yeah" and I go... "Do i leave it here?" And she goes "Leave it". WOW.  MINUS TWO STARS

#4) She comes back a few minutes later, which was obvious to me that she probably just took out the hair and dumped a bunch of mangoes on top. She doesn't even say sorry or ANYTHING to me. And apparently she was snickering while giving it to me. I'm pretty annoyed at that point and I in my normal voice just vent out the horrible customer service and how she probably just gave me the old one. I know she heard me but she doesn't even care. I eat the mangoes on the bottom and don't even finish half of my dessert. I don't even bother leaving any tip because WHAT SERVICE WAS THERE?! She doesn't even come to give us the check when its been an hour and not ONCE does she come check up on us. We just walk up there and my friend tells her we want our checks separately. She mumbles something under her breath, who knows wth she is saying. I was thinking about arguing with her but I had no valid proof that she gave me the old one, just my voice against hers. 

Mango Medley has got to be the worse asian dessert customer service that I have EVER encountered. I know every other asian dessert place in SF is whatever on the customer service for the most part, but ARE YOU SERIOUS MANGO MEDLEY?! To be frank, where did that knot of TANGLED BLACK HAIR even COME FROM? It was all stringy and black while the waitress had obviously dyed her hair and the cook in the back had brown hair too, SO WHERE DID THE HAIR EVEN COME FROM? 

The food is not bad, don't get me wrong, although the hair is questionable in it's own right. My friends and I could have easily dined & dashed because this chick was seriously ABSENT, and when she was there, she was so rude and dumb. I'm never coming back here, EVER! That little turd, she's lucky that I did NOT go Korean on her ass because I was pretty damn furious. And I'm still thinking right now as I'm writing this review, why I did not fight with her. God damn you waitress from Mango Medley, ruined my night.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
I like the food and dessert from this place, and its interior design is not bad.

The only thing I do not like about this place is that the food takes too long to arrive to your table.  It's also quite difficult to catch the waitress since she is always busy.

If you are not in a hurry, this would be a good place to chill with friends.
author: A L.

description:
Fresh tasty foods, great blend of drinks, and fantastic asian deserts. So why am I giving it such a low rating?!?? The SERVICE is slow and  non existent. I never get a greeting when I come thru the door. Sometimes it takes 10 minutes for the waitress to bring me a menu. Then another 10 minutes to take my order. If you think that is long, wait till your food comes out. I ordered a strawberry jam toast one time and it took 30 minutes for it to come. REALLY? For cooked food, it can take even longer.

The environment is strange to say the least. Most of the chairs dont match - coming in different shapes, and sizes. The place color scheme is weird. There are artwork paintings and then there is also kid drawings hanging on the same wall. I just don't understand what theme the place is going for. It's like they don't have an identity.
 
So why do I keep coming back here? Well, the place is only a couple of blocks from where my parents live and they love it. They also open late. I admit, the quality and taste of the food is superb. The horrible wait time and strange décor is the real turn off.
author: Ace C.

description:
Mango Medley was great! The food was amazing, but the thing that kept it from achieving more than I can give is the waiting period for the food. It was about 20 minutes or so and I was cranky and starving! It's really small and you can fit maybe 15 people, tops! It might just be the fact that I probably went there when there was only two people in the whole restaurant and that's reasonable for the wait time, but I'm judging by my experience for this evening!

My fiancee and I came here after a long process of deciding where to go for dinner. We ordered the Kimchi Fried Rice and the Chicken Curry Noodles. I was amazed at the quality of both and the portions aren't big, but it was enough. The Kimchi Fried Rice came with a sunny side up egg and beef flank. It's not spicy at all! I definitely recommend this! The Chicken Curry Noodles is essentially Thai Green Curry with noodles. It's a different take on curry and it was surprisingly awesome too! Curry has that sense of spiciness, but it wasn't too spicy (slightly more spicy than the Kimchi Fried Rice to me). 

I would come back again, but not when I'm excruciatingly hungry. The wait is definitely not for hungry people or those with little patience. It's a small restaurant too, so everyone can practically hear you. Oh, another important note: BRING CASH!! It's cash only!

And another useful note is that tea and napkins are self-serve (so it seems). I can see that since there was only one waiting staff for the evening and one chef in the kitchen.
author: Jeremy L.

description: I would give this restaurant 0 star if its possible!!! It was a sunday night, I went there with a couple friends around 830. we ordered : 1 smoothie 1 salmon rice plate? 1 mango dessert n for me i ordered 2 pillows...ONLY 2 FREAKIN' PILLOWS!!!! and it never came n i was so pissed that i left after waiting for 2 n half hours..eff me .btw if u have all day this is the place to be :)
author: May D.

description:
Much like the outer Sunset itself, this is a surreal, oddly lifeless place to ponder one's life direction through the gauzy ennui of a low-budget indie film. Except at Mango Medley, you can do this over a generous $7 plate of grilled zucchini, spinach rice noodles and grilled fresh prawns, with a light, lovely sauce of mirin and spicy oil. From the comfort of a hideous orange/pink modern plush chair in a cafe setting that looks like Miami threw up all over itself. In a cute way. 

The menu is comprehensive, pan-asian, and possibly a little ambitious considering they have exactly two people working there and it takes over an hour to be served. But, you know, if you're not down with a slower pace of life, you need to get out of this neighborhood PDQ.
author: Megan W.

description:
hahaha thought on my old review i rated them horribly, but i guess i was more lenient before...cause i would of only gave them a 2 last time. The wait time was horrendous back then but they have changed that up and its much better now, they only have like two girls working there but they are doing a better job then i remembered. 

Baked seafood over rice with cream sauce was delicious, nice and hot and the taste kind of tasted homey...you know that taste? My lady had this dish with seafood i think..or chicken..hahah i dont remember cause all I remember is my dish! lol

we also had drinks...i had this green tea milk drink..which tasted healthy and my lady had...um jasmine tea? lol I keep thinking about the baked seafood~ I havent ate a baked seafood like this in a long while..give it a shot..
author: phillip w.

description: This place used to be one of my fav Asian restaurant, despite how fobby it was. I finally found an Asian restaurant that is local who actually cooks the food homemade, MSG free (double plus) and it is organic, which explains the price being high. However, I am very disappointed with their service, never answer their business phone nor having any people skills. How can you run a business (especially where it is located in that type of neighborhood) without any people skills and poor customer service? In the past, I always order my favorite chicken soup there to go and went back there today to see if I can have it to go. I believe the waitress is the owner, tells me they don't take food to go anymore. Given the fact I was standing inside for awhile and was never acknowledge that I was waiting. I understand she is busy with another customer taking down their order, but if you see another customer standing inside your restaurant waiting, at least acknowledge that customer and say you will be with them in a sec or even greet the customer. Every time I go in there, not once do I see her smile or seemed friendly. Finally, when she was done taking down the customer order, she already knew what I wanted and I'm sure she remembers me, since I used to always order the same dish to go. She replies to me, "we don't take anymore food to go" and rudely walks away. There was no sign posted anywhere or even outside to say that they don't take food to go anymore. If that is the case, isn't it common sense to advertise that about your business, so customers don't have to waste their time? This wasn't the 1st time something like this occurred. The 2nd time, my boyfriend drove down to this restaurant and try to have food to go, and the same lady gave him the run around and waste his time. First, she told him they only accept cash, which is true because there are signs posted saying that. He goes out of his way and walk to the 7/11 nearby to pull out cash. He comes back in to the restaurant, than that same lady tells him they are out of the food he wanted. Why couldn't she just say that to him in the first place, rather than making him go out of his way to the ATM and pull out cash? Just completely wasted his time. Not only that, there is no customer service skills and just totally unprofessional. If she want to open a restaurant like that, might as well open it in Chinatown instead. Every time I pass by that place, since my favorite organic store and other restaurants are in the same neighborhood, I barely see it get busy in there..and you wonder why?
author: Eron C.

description: Went there for supper around 10 pm. The food was okay. However, I can not stand the impoliteness of the waitress. The service was terrible. Few other customer who came in after me was also treated the same way. Very disappointed.
author: Stefan L.

description:
- Walked in, and was never greeted. Wife and I eventually sat ourselves.
- Waitress made her rounds to other tables a couple times, but never did approach us. Eventually had to stand up and initiate contact myself to get menus.
- Food took FIFTY MINUTES to come out.
- The meals did not come out at the same time. Wife's came out first, and she was almost finished by the time mine arrived.
- No one ever came to check on us after our food arrived, not even once. We would have ordered desert, but we never got the chance. The waitress never brought the check around, either.

The food itself was GREAT. Some of the best Asian Fusion I've ever had. Even our "boring" order of veggie fried rice was complex and delicious. But never, ever dine-in if you come here.

I grok that this place is mostly a take-out/delivery joint, but if they're going to treat dine-in customers so poorly, they shouldn't bother.
author: Justin D.

description:
My first impression was how cozy (read: euphemism for tiny) the place was. I think the maximum occupancy was 15. There's only one waitress and two cooks, but they're pretty efficient. My friend and I ordered salads and they were SPICY. I like hot foods, so I didn't mind, but for the more timid: be careful.

I can't remember the drinks we ordered...I think I had some kind of ginger lemonade...but they were also delicious and a refreshing contrast to the spicy entrees.

The portion sizes are also generous; my friend and I had to get take-home cartons.
author: Kym M.

description: Nay.  I knew it was all bad when the waitress with the boy haircut ignored us from the minute we stepped into this horrible establishment. It was game over when she rudely tossed the fricking menus at us and started wiping the damn windows. Oh no she didn't!  So we tossed the damn menus and got outta there.  Never again.
author: Lisa Z.

description:
So I've been here a few times now, I think the 1st time I had Roti and curry sauce, it was good not great! Then yesterday I got the mango, ice cream, and cream pillows..mmmm.....they were so good! Simple but good!
I mean it's pretty much a crepe with mango piece, mango icecream and cream in the middle, how can you go wrong right? I want to go back and try their savory dishes. They are a bit pricey for that kind of chinese food but it looked pretty good.
author: Karen T.

description:
After our dining experience at a very atypical outer Sunset restaurant, we decided to end our evening at a Hong Kong-style snack and dessert place called Mango Medley. Just the name alone got me excited. A medley of mango delights? Count me in!

The place was packed with Asian teens that all seemed to be absorbed in their anime and Asian pop magazines. I felt kind of old as I sat down and looked around me. After taking in the menu, I realized Mango Medley offers more than just snacks and desserts. The extensive menu includes vegetarian entrees, noodle dishes, rice dishes, a huge dessert menu and lots of Hong Kong-style drinks. 

The "cream pillows" on the dessert menu sounded intriguing. It turns out they are pillow-like mini crepes filled with things like mango, cream, purple yam and adzuki (red bean). True to the name, they were pillow shaped and creamy delicious. 

A lot of the items on the dessert menu needed explanation like black sesame paste with glutinous peanut dumplings, fresh mango grass jelly and almond fungus with pear. 

This is definitely a place for people who aren't afraid to try something new and out of their comfort zone.
author: Lee H.

description:
I usually love desert places (especially HK-style ones) but this one can definitely be missed.

It's location in the outer Sunset is a little too out-of-the way for me - a long 40 min ride on the N-Judah just to wait another 40 min for decidedly unspectacular food entrees (I'm not sure why some reviewers referred to the food as HK-style) and mediocre desserts?

Sorry.
author: Haywood H.

description:
I've been coming back to this place occasionally for the past year. Whenever I want to reminisce my Hong Kong trip, I come here. The place is vastly influenced by the Hong Kong cuisine. There are even Hong Kong street signs on the wall!

My faves are the baked seafood rice and baked portuguese spaghetti. The chef here must really like garlic, because you can taste it in every dish. To some it may be overpowering, but I love the garlic taste. I like the baked seafood rice in tomato sauce. They're not cheap on ingredients either. The dish is filled with shrimp, scallop, salmon, and fish. The baked portuguese spaghetti is cooked in a similar to curry-sauce. 

I always finish off the meal with the mango delight dessert, because it is the only dessert that includes mango ice cream. I always choose the panna cotta as the base. It's topped with mango puree and mango slices. 

When I first started coming here, it was a one woman show. But I believe they've hired some help now. Last time I came, I saw two waitresses helping out, but didn't seem to fully grasp the system. Hopefully, they're fully trained now and service will be a lot faster.
author: Wendy L.

description:
I came here a couple times and service was really slow.  But the last time I went with a pretty large party, I was pleasantly surprised that the service improved.  We came here after the Alice Summer Thing concert so all I could talk about was Marie Digby.  I don't know what made the wait faster for our food - me talking about Marie or Dave playing YouTube videos of NKOTB old school and new on his cool Palm Centro.  I'm sure it was Dave.  He could pretty much sing along to the newest NKOTB song if he weren't raving about Smallville at the same time. 

Anyway, the food was good.  I had a noodle soup that was just what I needed on a dreary day.  Others ate dessert that came out in a large portion.  I also ordered the black and white rice dish with mangos on top.  However, with a rice shortage, I guess they no longer service it with the black rice!  Overall, it's still a good place to eat at.
author: Stacey C.

description:
So I went here for the first time and I was disappointed.  They have bad customer service; we waited about 45 minutes for our food and all my friends and I ordered were desserts and drinks.
First off, when we ordered one of my friends wanted one of the desserts but the waitress had said they were missing ingredients for about 3 of the options.
Second, into about 40 minutes of waiting for our food, the waitress finally decides to come to our table and tell us that they were missing another ingredient that is supposed to be in TWO of my friends' orders.  And when asked if the other orders were made the waitress said they were working on it...
Finally, when my friends ordered other desserts their orders came out within 5 minutes and the other orders came like 10-15 minutes after those....
My friend and I ordered the cream pillows and there is no way those take over 45 minutes to prepare and cook.  And when we got them, my friend's Taro pillow BARELY had any taro and my pillows were not even wrapped all the way because once you picked it up all the whip cream started to drip out...

I'll admit the portions are OK but still, it isn't worth the price, wait and bad customer service.
author: Angelica Y.

description:
We were looking for a dessert place close by Judah and very unfortunately this was the only place open past 10pm. 
I don't know why I even wasted my time stepping in there again after waiting for our milk tea for 20 minutes during our last visit. 

This time the 3 of us went in, sat down by ourselves cuz nobody greeted us. After 5 whole minutes this short girl comes out of the kitchen and hands us ONE one-page menu, O_O WOW, she sure can count!
After we read about the menu 10 times front and back, there was still no sign of the girl. BTW she was the only one working, yup, cooking, taking orders, collecting money, cleaning table.. 

Finally we couldn't take it anymore, it felt like a self-service place.. so we decided to goto Golden Island cafe on Noriega and 20th Ave instead. 
When we got up to leave, we saw her chit-chatting with a customer.. 
now that's just rude.. it's okay to not have outstanding service when your restaurant is busy, but it's another thing to IGNORE your customers.. 

BTW THE FOOD SUCKS TOO.
author: Catalina C.

description:
Decided to try Mango Medley tonight with my boyfriend. This was a HUGE MISTAKE. HUGE.

First, our order wasn't taken until we'd been sitting there for 15 minutes.
Of course the waitress ( can I even call her that?) 'forgot' to mention that tea and water are on a serve yourself basis, then charged us $5 for 2 cups of tea.

Second, from the time we ordered it took 45 minutes to get our FIRST dish. The next two came ten minutes apart from each other.

Third, the Avocado Salad was disgusting. The tofu tasted like bread ( no joke, bread crust), the lettuce was the gross white/yellow insides of iceberg lettuce that you aren't supposed to use. The HALF of the avocado on the salad had brown all over the outside edges ( yes, the "Avocado Salad" only had HALF an avocado. And the dressing was bitter, brown, chunky and disgusting.

Did I mention I waited 50 minutes for this salad?!?!

Like any unsatisfied customer, I sent the salad back. Come time to pay...it's still on the bill. So I refuse to pay for a gross salad that  I didn't eat and sent back. The rude waitress threatened to call the police if I didn't pay for it and  said that they had no control over the quality of their own food. HELLO? That's what restaurants DO. Like the SFPD doesn't have more important things to do?

To avoid any conflict we paid the silent, rude waitress and left. 
In retrospect, we should have said to hell with you and walked out. 
NEVER GO HERE.

We also had to walk down to 711 to get cash to pay for this gross meal. The ONLY place that it says "cash only" is at the very very bottom of the menu in 12pt. font. That IS NOT A SIGN and it sure as hell doesn't say it in the window.

I would give this restaurant negative ten stars if I could!
author: Brooke C.

description: i have never write a review, Mango Medley piss me off. this place might changed owner. it's really bad now. worst than worst. people rate more than 2 starts, you out your mind. this place  used to be good, but not anymore. The menu has been changed, good dish were all gone, don't get me start with service, i waited for almost 40 mins till the dish throw in front of me. in winter time the door was broken, i felt like eating dinner in a refrigerator. the price was out of roof for such bad taste food. you still wanna give a try help yourself.
author: Mingle W.

description:
Slow service but I really like their Mango curry roti.
