You have to grab your own menu and seat yourself. The place is quite cozy and the bathrooms are definitely really clean. 

We ordered the chicken green spinach noodle and it was relatively good. My boyfriend didn't like the over use of sesame though. Dessert was a strawberry pillow (strawberries and whip cream wrapped in crepe) which I liked. The server was cool on the recommendations.

Didn't like how there were flies flying around though and it was bit too far out of our range. But still a good little niche for good food.

Very HK indeed =D!
author: Natalie G.

description: Went on a Saturday night. 3-stars because half the things we wanted to order was not available and the wait for our food took FOREVER. (I guess since our group spent the time socializing made it less annoying, regardless it's not an excuse.) Waitresses were sympathetic and kind, however and the food was actually pretty good. Stock your kitchens and fire-up your stoves!
author: Cinna M.

description: I was here for a total of 2 hours and only 20 of those minutes were allocated to eating. The food (especially the cream pillows) was pretty good but nothing outstanding and the portions are really small for the price. There are signs everywhere warning you that you'll be fined for this and that (such as if you bring in outside food and drink, you'll be charged $2 per outside item you bring in; if you use the bathroom before  you order you'll be charged $3, etc etc) that bring an air of Asian authenticity to the place.
author: J L.

description:
Way overrated. my spinach noodles with shrimp and basil was absolutely horrible. I couldn't figure out if its italian or chinese or thai or even a good fusion....yucks. 

1/2 star to the mango salad with prawns. I mean how hard can it be to prepare. 1/2 star to the mango crepe which was decent. 

other dishes were mediocre and a friend's exotic mushroom rice dish was disgusting. 

Way to overpriced. ($8 on average for a dish) Service was slow and i swear the server was also the cook. there was no one else around! We peaked into the kitchen!!!
author: Marcia O.

description:
i dont want to give this place a bad review but i gotta say, there's no CUSTOMER serivce here, food is just alright. i was serving my friend and myself hot tea the whole time while waiting for more than 20mins for some mango salad, then another 20 mins for pineapple fried rice and stopped counting after that for the dessert.  All together a good HOUR+ for all the food to come.  No one greets you when you walk in, NO one sits you, and after sitting there for more than 15 mins, if you don't make note to them that you're ready, No one will take your order.  

But i guess its a good place if you just wanted to sit and relax, talk to your friends and had nothing better to do and hopefully not too hungry.
author: Anna W.

description: This place is alright. Nothing special. Parking can be a huge pain.
author: Forest S.

description: Ambiance is interesting ... service was meh.  We were the only ones in there at close to 1 on a Sunday.    Who can say no to bacon on top of a mushroom cream sauced pasta?  Thai sticky rice mango was good and decent size for the amount.    Happy hour specials $6-7 include a drink until 5 on the weekdays.   Still don't know what the word is to describe how it looks inside.
author: Jonathan W.

description:
Sooo. I plan to come here again to get a better feel of this place, because the food looked good and the place was cute and all I really had here was the desserts. I had the mango pillow/mango crepe and omggg it was good! Fluffy whipped cream, sweet mango slices wrapped in a crepe-y thing. Kinda small, but whatever.

The problem?
They're helllllla slow.
We came for some dessert and waited 20 minutes for these pillow things.
We finished the damn things in like 5 minutes.
Foreal?
That ain't cool.

But I'm coming back on a summer night to try out their pork chop over baked spaghetti. (=

CASH ONLY!
author: M J.

description:
This desert place is not very well-known yet, but that doesn't mean it is bad quality.  Maybe because of its neighbourhood (next to the N cable car track, across 7-11, dark..) not much people discover this jewel on Judah.

Their menu is not extensive, but the items are quite unique compared to what elsewhere offers.  When it is mango season, do try out their mango-themed deserts.  Other Hong Kong style deserts are as good as they can get.  They have tapioca drinks as well, though I haven't tried any myself.

Mango Medley opens til late, so it is a great late night hang-out place with its light music, sofas, spotlights and magazine racks.
author: Alex T.

description:
My friends wanted to come here for a snack/dinner on a quiet Sunday late afternoon. The place was practically empty. It's a quaint, cozy place with a limited number of tables and chairs. The menu offers a variety of entrees, salads, and desserts. I ordered baked spaghetti with 2 huge slabs of pork chop and with plenty of broccoli and cauliflower.  I could only finish half my food and was full from 1 pork chop. Other people ordered ramen soup noodles that came with a ton of veggies and tofu, the Bolognese backed spaghetti had a good sauce, and the Thai noodles with veggies looked like a light entree. The food was cooked home-style and the portion size was decent. The wait wasn't too bad as we were one of 2 tables occupied. 

There was virtually no service as the waitress just took our orders and brought us our food. We had to get our own tea and set up our own utensils, which was a small amount of labor for some delicious home style cooking. I was too full to have dessert. But I was really tempted to get the special mango dessert for $6.50 that comes with mango chunks, almond jelly, and scoop of vanilla ice cream. I think there were variations as to what you wanted to be added to your mango "sundae". I had a small taste of my friend's sundae and it was good - sweet and satisfying. I will probably come back again to try some of their other dishes and for dessert.
author: Candace F.

description: A little slooow, but then again my meal tasted like it was all just cooked from scratch - delicious Lime Coconut Seafood. Recommended! (bring cash, no CC)
author: David F.

description: Great Chinese dessert and snacks in the outer sunset. Somewhat a far drive from downtown area but it's worth it every now and then. Tried the salted fish fried rice which was delicious. The panna cotta with fruits was great in texture and the black sesame and walnut paste were great. Friends ordered the mango medley (grapefruit and mango juice and puree and mango sticky rice which were both so tasty and yummy! However, service was somewhat slow despite a Thurs night with only 8 patrons in the restaurant. Cute lil place offering a huge menu with noodles, snacks, salad, sandwiches, rice plates and lots of hot and cold dessert! Suprisingly lots of parking in the area too, we parked right in front of the cafe.
author: Yan M.

description:
Feb 07 Update: Service got better and faster & she got a helper now. 

What's good: the mango crepe, ginger & milk (hot) -this is kinda a traditional chinese dessert so try at your discretion or only if you know what it is.  All food is good value and tasty.
----------
I cannot believe this place has been reviewed in Yelp already!!  You ruthless animals!  Is there a place I eat where you do not go?  Arghhh..all the secrets are out!!  All the secrets are out!!

Yes, it's true...everything that everyone else has said...it's all been said!!  arghh..

Food - very good
Service - better

Luckily, they got many chinese magazines to keep you entertained while you wait.
author: Bessie T.

description: Well dont get the name of the place deceive you. You would expect this place to be mostly mango related food. No it is not. The service is quite slow too. Went there pretty late. Food was ok. Tea was self serve, but the containers were empty! Maybe it be better next time I decide to go give them a chance to redeem themselves.
author: Albert W.

description:
UPDATE:
Came here for dinner on a Wed night, only 1 other table was dining, so the wait/service wasn't bad at all.  When eating at a mom n pop cafe place, expectation's of course not very high, but the food we got were all very delicious!

We had:
-roti: probably the worst of the bunch.  It's the type of pancake that comes from the frozen packaging in Asian supermarkets.  My family gets that alot and make it when we're lazy, so would not recommend getting it here.  Although the sauce that accompanies the roti is super yum, curry flavor with a spicy kick.  
-baked seafood rice with tomato sauce: super good, pungent on the garlic flavor, but we all thought it was yummy not overpowering.  It came with shrimp, scallop, salmon, mussel, tilapia.  
-baked Portuguese spaghetti: almost thai yellow curry style but with strong garlic flavor again, but again, not overpowering, highlights the other flavor quite well.  
-sesame spinach noodle: very thin and soft noodles, in a basic sesame oil sauce with eggplant and tofu.  Very refreshing, solid

With the 3 entrees, every time I try one, I feel like that's the best, but as I eat another, that one suddenly reigns supreme.  That must be a good sign right?  And we got their signature dessert to finish it off, it wasn't very impressive.  Surprisingly, I would say come here for dinner if you're in the neighborhood and want something simple to go, but you can get better desserts elsewhere, esp in sunset.   
--------------
They offer such a huge variety of foods, from HK style baked pasta/rice, to thai/indonesian plates like curries and fried rice, they even have Korean pancake, ramen, Vietnamese spring rolls, and roti (the thin crepe like appetizer that everyone and their mama get at Banana Island).  We seriously could not stop staring at the menu for 30 minutes, just admiring each picture, booked our next dinner date because we MUST try this place.  

The desserts were ok, I had the panna cotta with mango  and its pure.  It's actually like a soft yogurt custard, sorta weird.   The ambiance resembles the perfect cozy neighborhood spot.  One thing though, it seems like a 1 person team, the service is EXTREMELY slow.  We only ordered 4 desserts, none of which requires real cooking, but it still took her at least 30 min. to bring it out.  But for such a small place, I'll overlook that for now, and dream about the explosion of flavors in my mouth when I actually eat here.
author: Christina D.

description: Terrible waitress, long wait, expect 3-4 hours if u dine in and be ready to deal with the evil waitress, she is mean, impolite and will scold at U. dun expect full service, U have to sit, grab menu yourself, even fill yourself hot tea. Even togo oder, expect to wait no matter how long u call to placed the oder. Dont come here even u r in good mood, it will disappear when the waitress come. NEVER COME HERE AGAIN!!!
author: Melie L.

description:
Very relaxing lunch place. Like most reviews here, I have to agree, the service is slow and sometimes awkward, but if I'm eating somewhere for lunch, I'm usually in no rush. It's worth it. Just be prepared to wait 15 minutes.

I haven't tried their coffee or desserts at all. However I can testify to their awesome soy broth ramen dishes. I normally can eat a lot, but their small size is more then enough for me.

They close between lunch and dinner, so I end up running into a closed door a lot =(
author: Snaker Z.

description: If you are in a hurry and extremely hungry, DON'T GO! When they are busy, it will take them over 30mins to prepare your food. Great place for friends to chit-chat and wait. Awesome varieties of food, and I would say more fusion like. Generally great and desserts is just out of this world!
author: E C.

description: the service here sucks! i would give it no stars if i could. i got here at 9pm with my GF and the place was full but had one table open. we sat down and figured out what we wanted and waited ....and waited. 9:30 rolls around and still no waiter/waitress has come to take our order. finally after dang near tackling the waiter to get his attention he says "ill be right back to take your order". so we waited another 15min and still the waiter never came back. i know the other other yelpers said the food coming out is slow, but having to wait 45+min just to take an order is unacceptable. not to mention everything is self serve like tea, water, forks ect. so after the long wait we just got up and walked out.  i guess there is a reason this place is trending down with yelp.
author: Mike M.

description:
Ooh.  I like this place.  It's a real small place, but very cozy.

Cash only, so make sure you hit the ATM.  The menu's not expensive, but it's not a cheap hole in the wall place either.  I think there's a min charge per person, but it's only like $5 or something.

I can't really speak for their main entrees, since I went there post-dinner.  But, their voluminous menu has pictures and lots of stuff looked really good.  I had the Roti as sort of a snack while I chatted with a friend for a few hours.  It was a bit thicker than I'm used to, but good.  

Service is fine.  They're a bit slow (probably b/c of the huge menu), but friendly.  Like I said, we chatted for a long while and they never rushed us.  In fact, I asked the waitress what time they closed and she said "12:00."  I looked at my phone and it was already 12:10.  

Parking was a bit difficult since it's on the street, but we were able to find a space after about 10-15 min.

It can get a little humid in there and we left smelling like some of the food there.  So, keep that in mind if you hate smelling like the restaurant.

But, if you're looking for a late night alternative to Starbucks or if some in your party want to grab dessert while others want something to snack on, this isn't a bad option.
author: H C.

description:
Hm zero stars!!

This place is a hellhole.  

Me: table for three please.
Waitress: we are full.
Me: how long is the wait.
Waitress (looks around): they just got their food.
Me (looking confused, what is that supposed to mean?): ok we'll wait.

Me: do you guys have a restroom?
Waitress (looks around for a bathroom): it's for customers only.
Me: we WILL be customers, or do we have to order to use the bathroom.
Waitress: we are really strict about the bathroom here because a lot of people use it off of the street.
Me: do others ask for a table? (because we did, obviously we were going to stay)
Waitress: no they don't. (blank look) ok I will let it slide this one time. (hands us the keys to the bathroom).

So besides the retarded waitress the food was terrible.  It is wannabe HK cafe food.  Who puts broccoli and squash in a baked pork chop over rice?  They have pictures of the entrees they serve printed on the menu but when you get it, it looks nothing like the picture.  My friend ordered noodle soup and when it came it didn't look anything like the picture.  The picture was a bird's eye view of the bowl, but when the bowl came, it was half the height of normal noodle bowls (cheap asses).  Me and my other friend ordered two different things and when they came it looked and tasted pretty much the same.  The dessert was mediocre, mango bliss (rather go to golden island).  Overall, the meal took us maybe a hour and forty five minutes, because the service was so bad (we got one dish at a time 5 minutes apart).  I usually tip even if the service is bad, but it was so bad here I had to tip 2 cents, IT WAS THAT BAD!!        

ONLY CONS! DON'T COME HERE!
author: Amy C.

description:
Since my first visit, I have been attracted by the coziness of this little cafe and her food.

My friends and I could always enjoy a relax meal here together, then talk and laugh forever. The food is well-prepared. The menu is constantly expanding. My favorite is their grilled veggie and meat that are served with the dishes. Eugenie is a shy and determined cook. Go only if you have the time to wait for the dishes and she will put her heart into the food for you.
author: Benedict C.

description: love the food, drink and the dessert!  they have unique menu. the food tasted like homemade food.
author: C L.

description:
YES, service is slow, thats why i brought my DS lite.

The place looks like it used to be a coffee shop, now a chinese dessert/western style food restaurant?

Nothing really looked good in the pictures.  I came only for the panna cotta, but was hungry and decided to get some food as well.  It was actually good that it took the waitress so long to take our order because we didnt know what we wanted.

There were 2 other tables besides us this afternoon.  

I had the mushroom and bacon spaghetti - YUM!!!!!! it was actually REALLY good.  Portion was kinda small, but I finished it instead of boxing it to take home.  I'd say it was jussssssst right.  The sauce was sweet; it was just really good. 

Bf got curry seafood spaghetti, i didnt try it, it looked gross.  Bf said mine was better.

Mango Panna Cotta - A BOWL OF HEAVEN!!!!!! i loved it.  Not too sweet, refreshing, delish.

One of the tables had to change their minds and got their meal to-go because it took too long.

With my DS, waiting was no biggie. :P
author: kim w.

description:
The Goods: Very yummy food!  Try the dish with the egg plant and I bet you never knew that egg plants can taste that good!  Parking around that area is pretty easy too.

The Bads: the wait for the food was more than 20 minutes and there's not enough tables
author: Karina L.

description:
After reading some of the reviews here on yelp, I feel bad for Mango Medley.  I've been going there on and off since they opened.  True, it is very slow.  True, you have to get your own tea and maybe your own utensils sometimes.  But for the most part, with little help they have, they are trying.  The desserts are pretty yummi.  Right now it is not mango season, so it might taste a little sour.  Try their banana pillow.  When summer comes, it would be mango all the way. 

Always do a drive by first before going in.  If you see more than 2 tables there, then go somewhere else.
author: Muncia S.

description:
Chocolate Chai = Delicious. Desert in a cup. Really Rich, really yum.

Mango Fried Rice = Uber Yum...

We got some other chicken curry type dish also... Not terribly unique, but good none the less.

Not a ton of customer service, but it's just a really laid back slow kind of place.
I would not go far out of my way to arrive there, but, if  your in the hood, it's worth popping in.
author: Kellie P.

description:
I went here for desserts and you just remember as a patron that it is self seating and you get your own menu at the DOOR!

A lot of Ikea-esque furniture and utensils. Very large variety on the menu but my friend and I just got the: Mango/Aloe Jelly/Black Jelly and fruit mix cup for $3.95.  

There was only a one person waitress so expect slower delays in your food.
author: Jboogie L.

description:
I like the cozy setting of this place. Its a tiny place and we went here on a saturday late afternoon. It was nice because we were the only ones there. It's tiny so its not a great place for large groups though.

This place is quite aptly named: a good deal of the food and desserts have some kind of mango as an ingredient. In the fried rice, there were mangos. And thats a good thing because mangos are awesome tasting.

I like the dessert that we ordered which was a panna cotta something something. It looks like a nice piece of mango art and you can customize it however you want.

Nice little place to get dessert or light snack
author: Stanley C.

description:
Great food!
BUT it took way way to long. With just 5 people in the place (table of 3 plus my table of 2). We had to wait about 45 minutes to be served. I might be back, but I'll have to clear a good hour and a half of my day to do it.
author: Aaro N.

description:
I stopped by here for dessert with some friends after eating at Thanh Long and we all loved this place! We got an assortment of desserts and the standout was mango bliss, which is their featured dessert. The strawberry panna cotta and banana pillows were great but the made from scratch cheesecake was blah. 

The menu was hard to read with the jumbled tiny print. 

We were one of three tables there on a Tues night, but had the place to ourselves most of the time. I didn't notice slow service, but like I said we were the only customers for the most part. I would definitely come back to try some other things on their menu.
author: Quyen N.

description:
I come here at least twice a month and I love it despite the slow service. As other reviewers have stated the service here is really slow because they only have 1 SERVER. She basically has to to do everything so if you don't have at least an hour or so to spare, this place may not be for you. 

I only order the mango desserts and they are really tasty. I usually order the mango cream pillows, mango bliss, and almond jelly with mango sauce and fresh mangos. The mangos they used, at least every time I go are always ripe and sweet and have me a returning customer. ^_^
author: Jonathan L.

description:
This was my second time coming here and I will definitely not come here ever again!!!  I came with a friend and we automatically sat ourselves when we came in the restaurant.  We grabbed some menus we saw on a nearby table and started to browse through it.  

About  5 mins later we noticed a couple of tables near us who just finishing their meal and were leaving.  Shortly after this lady comes out and starts clearing the table.  (Mind you, nobody has acknowledged that we've come in.)  So as she's cleaning one of the tables I decided to go up to her and ask her  a question since I was confused about how we were to order since it's been a really long time since I've been there.  

So I got up to the lady and stand in front of her.  I know she sees my presence but she continues to clean.  After about ten seconds of just standing and doing nothing, I decided to interrupt her.  I said, "Excuse me miss...  I'm sorry to bother you..."  And her response was a huge sigh as she slowly stopped what she was doing and finally looked up at me with a nod and bulging condescending eyes as if to say "YESSSS??"   What a BIATCH!!!!  At that point I should of just said never mind and left but my friend was back visiting and she likes the restaurant.  So I asked her still politely if we were supposed to order in front or if someone will come by to serve us.  Her response was "Well I'm BUSY cleaning right now.  Once I'm done I can come and take your order."  

I've never been treated so rudely at a restaurant before!  Least to say we didn't stay.  I can understand maybe... if I was demanding or was rude or mean when I asked her my simple question of how our order was to be taken.  But I was freakin polite about it!!!  Geez lady!!  That was ridiculously RUDE!!!!

Never will I be back and neither will my friend!
author: Anna Y.

description: I never wrote any reviews at yelp, yet i really wanna say something about this place. I wish I could give a 0 star for this place!! The customer service is horrible in here!! And the food was not even so good!! First, we walked in the place, and we didn't receive any greeting service, so we just found a table to sit. After a long while for just letting us to read the menu by ourselves, the waitress helped us to order the food.  We have waited for 30 mins for the food at dinner time, though we only ordered mainly the dessert!! Ok, I mean I can forgive about the waiting. But the woman who served us really didn't have any kind of customer service manner(She never says "thank you" nor "you're welcome" at the whole night)! Another thing I am not happy with is that the space between each table is extremely small, no personal space! I  could never come back to this place because I am paying for nothing except for the horrible waiting and customer service!
author: Kristin J.

description:
I use to come here for dessert once in while but their service is wayyy slow. No one greets you when you enter nor do they hand you the menus. We have to do that ourselves, the sad part was they weren't even busy! It turns out the two owners does everything themselves so that's why they are so laggy with everything. I like their desserts I really do but they need to get some help! 

The first time i came here i remember i got the mango crepe which was really good. The mangos were sweet and the crepe was nice and thin. Their homemade cheesecake is what I order every time I go. It's just the way i like it. Not too sweet and topped with their glaze was just perfect. I also like their mango and sticky rice and i LOVED their black sticky rice. It was sooo good and not a lot of places can make it the way i like it. They sure can but they took it off their menu!!! Which def. ticked me off a lot. They actually started to cross a lot of things off their menu. Maybe it was too much to handle? I have no idea. I haven't gone in a while... maybe it's because they took off one of my favorites? No, I think it's because of the bad service. Well, i'm sure i'll be back again soon enough.
author: Flora W.

description: the food were good but the waitress was just so mean, and they charge money for a cup of hot water, not gonna go back anymore
author: Zoe Z.

description: I love mango !!!!!  The food were okay. There is only limited seating available in the restaurant and one server, so it will take some time for your meal to be served.
author: Stacy L.

description:
service was really really slow on a weeknight for what a ordered (a simple almond milk drink), which seemed to take more than 20 minutes to come and the place was not that crowded. 

friend got the special which was i think either a spare rib or a porkchop dish, it was quite delish and garlicky and cheesey.  the waitress said they put garlic in everything!

we also got the black sesame soup with sesame dumplings, really good. 

on another occasion I had the almond jello with fruit and it was quite good.

food is great. service is OK. still worth another visit. I liked that they are trying to make their desserts organic. they use TJ's sugar products.
author: Win H.

description: Upon entering, what do i smell? NOT mangoes but durian. Ah that smell makes me dizzy and nauseous. Their menu is more cafe like.  ranging from drinks, entrees to their desserts.  So I am a picky one when it comes to food... I couldn't decide what to get because nothing really stood out to me or I was not craving anything in particular.  At least nothing with mango.  Anyways, I ordered a strawberry cream pillow.. umm interesting name for a crepe wrapped with cream & strawberries.  Needless to say I was not impress with their cream pillow.  Way too much cream since I am not a cream person.  decent amount of strawberries.  Pricing was okay but could've been better if there was three cream pillows rather than just two.  The texture of the crepe was soft and it tasted really nice. The wait for the food ranges from 10-15mins depending on what you ordered. Next time, I will try something mango off their menu.
author: Ann L.

description:
If you're looking to kill some time and get something to eat on a lazy afternoon, then Mango Medley is your place!  

One slow Sunday afternoon my sister dragged me out for some fresh air at Ocean Beach, and we popped in here for some snacks beforehand.

The shop itself looks a bit like a slightly cluttered living room than an actual restaurant, and while that might be off putting to some, I found it quaint and comfy.  You get a selection of sofa chairs and regular dining room chairs, and your choice of (Chinese) magazines to read as you wait for your food.   

We started with a Korean pancakes as appetizer while we sipped on some Jasmine tea.  The pancakes were a bit on the oily side and had too much cilantro, but the tea was refreshing with just the right amount of sweetness.  We also got an order of the Mango Pillows, which has is a crepe wrapped around mango slices and whipped cream.  It was delicious, so good that we got another order to go!

The service was a bit on the slow side, but since we were bumming around it didn't pose an issue.   And it was very reasonably priced as well, our total came out to be around $20 or so, including the extra order of dessert to go.
author: Kelly C.

description: Tonight had their pork chop and it sucks, because the meat did not marinate/absorb the salt,pepper,etc,just bland----my parents can cook better than them.  Shared a mango salad with shrimp(little raw). They should simplify their menu or improve their cooking techniques.  Without quality, forget the rest of the dishes.
author: Jer W.

description:
I came here on a friend's suggestion.  She warned me that the service was slow, VERY SLOW.  I took her word for it.  It was extremely slow. You get it? S. L.O.W. Slow.

However the food was okay.  I liked the grilled vegetables over garlic flavored noodles. I've never really seen that combination nor tried the fusion of those flavors. It was delightful to have something light to eat, but be forewarned about the garlic stench.

Next I had 2 desserts, and as usuall, i do not remember the names.  It was some yogurt fruit thing that was yummy, but what was most delicious was the mango wrapped in crepe. It reminded me of my last night in Hong Kong. The mango was sweet and soft, just right for my pallate.

I would recommend this place to anyone who has already EATEN and not starving.  It's a good place to hang out for a small group who's there to just talk and then maybe at the end of the 1 hour wait, have a snack.
author: A L.

description:
after dinner, my stomach crave for dessert!
 we drive all the way from daly city to sunset for some Mango Dessert. Short and simple: -Store is kinda small but the furniture is put in the right way sort of 
-dessert for around $5 
-interesting dessert menu
-long wait
-mixed up my order.... but still alright
author: Lily X.

description:
Yikes! I'm not sure how this place can get more than one star?! 

We went there for dinner...place was empty, cold and dark. Furniture looks like it was from a garage sale. The place is quite a mess, not an appealing place to have a sit down meal. 
Ordered our food...I can hear microwave door opening, closing, beeping numerous times...hmmm, ok. We get our food in 3-5 minutes. 

LOOKS NOTHING LIKE THE PICTURES ON THE MENU!!! The chicken was old, dry...rice was old, and dry...basically looks like leftovers...why me? I was soooo hungry too! Not sure if i want to come back. :(
author: Peter G.

description: I've lived in this neighborhood for years and never noticed this place. It has everything I like! It took me forever to figure out what to order on their extensive menu. Two appetizers for dinner and it was plenty for me. I have to go back for something sweet now. Extra love for being open late for the neighborhood.
author: Art L.

description: This is my first review EVER because this place is so ridiculous. I called and ordered for take out @ 7:30pm. Arrived to pickup at 8:45pm (1hr 15min) and was told my order was not ready. The short hair girl (looks like a boy) with attitude didn't even apologize and just told me that they were busy. What kind of business are you running here??? I just left without my order and went across the street for a burrito. Why would you come to a place that doesn't even care or want your business.
author: Jeffrey L.

description: I'm going to have to be fair. This place does have pretty decent food. The dessert is for the most part is pretty darn good. Their drinks are above average. They have a wide selection in their menu. Now with that being said... It seems the more popular they get the lower their service standards go. I understand... you gotta wait for something good... but really .. really? really? ... their wait is ridiculous. and I wouldn't even mind waiting for my delicious durian cream puffs.. but does the Attitude have to come as a side dish to the order? They are not a friendly bunch there.   There's a minimum mandatory order per person that sits at the table by the way. so you can't just order one dessert to share. I think it's at least $9.00 / person.  ..example:  How is it our fault that we didn't meet the required $ amount for our table if two out of the five things we ordered they ran out of? The lady wanted to charge us anyways... even though it's their fault that they ran out of mango? According to the cashier/owner/cook... we should have ordered another dish ..wtf? I understand you dont want a big group to just come and hang out there and take up space... but we went in.. we waited... and waited.. we ate and we left... Not coming back for sure.
author: Yennie N.

description: So I went here again recently with 2 of the same friends from when I went here the 1st time. I got the same thing from my previous visit while my friend decided to get the same thing as me. My other friend ordered from the happy hour menu and got some type of corn fried rice with with some type of ground meat (I think it was beef?) and some dish that looked like a satay dish with sausage, beef, bell peppers and some other stuff over steamed rice. The happy hour menu comes with a drink of your choosing so my friend got a milk tea (which is delicious btw) and some other tea I forget the name.  We were served by a different person this time and luckily this time, they served A LOT faster. E were done within an hour, unlike last times 2 hours, haha! This place is definitely for small groups only so don't go with such a big party.
author: Sean E.

description:
Okay, okay. The service is not so friendly but the food is soooooooooo
good. Even my vegan friend finds plenty to eat here. Just be prepared to a) serve yourself your own tea b)not expect a warm and fuzzy hello
from the owner c)a possibly long wait. 
BUT
did I say how great the food is?
Worth the wait, I have been here maybe 10 times now and the
dishes are consistently delicious. 
To the unhappy yelpers, try to give the owner a little slack, there are only TWO people working here, and trying to juggle everything so it has got to be stressful and ..........
did I say how great the food is? :)
author: Casey B.

description: The food here continues to be fantastic with a lot of variety and great prices. Now they've added a great dessert special. This place is a gem in this city!
author: Brian G.

description:
Service is horrendous here, easily the worst I've ever seen!  We seated ourselves since there was no greeting which is not a problem. Then the nightmare begins,  We waited 20 minutes before kindly asking if we can get our drinks.  The chinese short lady with the short hair that looks like a boy replies.  "I'm too busy I have so many ppl I'm waiting on and you just seated yourselves"  errrr what??? its my fault for seating ourselves when the place was open and no greeting??  Why bother being open for business if your going treat your customers this way.  

Happy Hour menu: prices are reasonable on the menu but here's the problem.  The short chinese boyish looking lady doesnt think that way mentally. She writes down on the menu roti: $4.95 but mentally she's saying my dish is worth $8.  Why is that? Well here's the catch...if your bill comes out to $13.  She will not come by to pick up the $20 bill you left because she doesnt want to give you the change back.   I had to go up to the register and ask for change and she would give you this  horrendous attitude that "what I have to give you change back?!"    Yes I want my change back! You expect me to give $7 in tips for this despicable attitude and took 50 minutes for the food to arrive at our table????  If you ever decide to come here make sure you carry $50 bills or $100 bills, that way you can "actually" justify getting your change back...pathethic isnt it?

I'm definitly going to be advertising about this place to many many friends to "NOT" come here ever!!!!  I'm sure that short boyish looking chinese waitress/owner is pissed off that I've exposed how this place really is!   Thank goodness for Yelp...you are exposed Mango Medley!!!!!!!!!
author: Ofy L.

description:
The last time I ate here, it was unbelievable. 
But.. now a second look I doubt it.
Let me give you the play by play ya?
So, we came in at 9:30? sat down at 9:31
9:40 she came and asked us for our order we didn't know so my bf said can you give us a few more minutes .. and she said yeah.
10.. tick tock tick tock.
10:10 where is the waitress?
10:30 FINALLY, Friday special please.
10: 35 wheres the tea?
10:40: wheres my salad?
1045 HERE'S THE SALAD?
10:50 no, now HERE. ... while she serves other people.
10:55 SALAD!
11: beasted the salad. 
11:10 now.. wheres the main meal and my tea?
11:20 theres my food...........& my tea, an hour for it.
11:30 desert? desert? desert?
11:40 wtf is this, drops everything to the side of me because I'm clumsy.. while she serving people. does she even come and ask if we're okay NO.
11:50 I'M TIRED OF THIS! THE TABLE NEXT TO US HAS THERE FOOD WHEN THEY CAME IN AFTER US, AN HOUR AFTER US!
 tofu does NOT take long to make, swear to GOD.
11:55 the impatient girlfriend waits.....
11:56 DKASLHDAKL! BABE LETS GO, I'M TIRED OF WAITING.
..you know what shes doing? shes on the floor organizing plates.. wtf is this? it doesn't like a whole 30 minutes to make a Tofu! 
but you know what else? we ordered it with MANGO.. and she said it would take longer to make, now I'm frustrated because Mango doesn't take that long to cut! & if your name is MANGO MEDLEY shouldn't you have some mango laying around? yaw? whatever.
She didn't even apologize yeah the place was sorta busy all the tables where full, but man I was straving, because after going to ikea I doubt anybody wants to be foodless. grrr. my madness came over to today.
author: Carolyn Y.

description:
best mango frappe and red bean frappe in the city. 
the green tea frappe is delicious too.
the hong kong style food is cheap and delicious. 
the only reason for 4 stars is because it's a tiny place and the wait for food can be a while sometimes.
author: Brian T.

description:
Do you know the feeling of being slapped in the face? Well, thats what happened to my girlfriends and I at Mango Medley. We came here on a Friday night. From reading the Yelp reviews, I already expected slow service so no suprise there. However, there were only about 4 other patrons there at the time. 2 uncleaned tables, 1 of which still had money and tips on it. We seated ourselves on one of the dirty tables, hoping that the server can come and take away the plates. We sat there for a good 15 minutes. No one walked out from the kitchen. No greeting. Zip. Zelch. Nada. 
Finally, a lady emerges from the kitchen and approached the bigger party to see what else they wanted. She then walked over to the dirty table and took the dishes. She walked by us without acknowledging us at all. My friend flagged her down and asked her, nicely, "Excuse me, can you take these dishes away?". She said to my friend, "Why do you guys have to sit here? Why can't you sit at the other table that I'm cleaning? If you guys are adamant about sitting at this table, then you'll have to wait until I clean the other table." With that said, she walked away. 
I'm not one to tolerate that type of service. First of all - we were sitting at a small 4-person table. She was cleaning a big 8-person table. All she had to do was pick up the dirty plates (and money!) on our table. Second of all - her attitude stinks like the towel she was holding in her hands. 
We got up and left, and we will never be returning.
author: Nancie T.

description: Food is good and prepared well. Restaurant is clean and tidy. Could use more comfortable seating and service can be a little slow.
author: Christopher B.

description: Dessert- order organic tofu ( a plus for having organic!) but it was way too pricey! Only 3-4 tablespoon of tofu and they priced it 5 bucks.  My friend ordered sesame paste- same problem, the portion was very small for 5 bucks. I mean, its nice that they serve you organic, but oh come on, only like 3 full tablespoon of the tofu and sesame paste? I would like you guys better if the price was more reasonable.
author: Tracy L.

description: Ok. So this place is very relaxing to come when you want to have a small chit chat session with a few good friends. I recommend coming here for dessert especially if you like mangoes. Their mangoes are fresh and they have tasty dessert choices. I also looked at their regular food menu but haven't tried it yet(looks interesting). If you come here, treat it like a home. You have to grab your own tea and water which I don't mind because its not like they charge you up the ass for food anyway, besides I don't expect much from chinese dessert houses because service is about the same. I like the idea of self serve tea, because I drink a lot, so I don't have to feel like I'm annoying the shit out of a server. Overall, I will be back, mainly for dessert. I'll probably try their regular menu sometime but I don't have high hopes for it.
author: A L.

description:
I've been coming here for the last 2 years - at one point, I was coming here about once a week because the food is so good! Sure, the wait sucks (I've waited more than an hour for my order on a couple of occasions) and Eugenie may not be the friendliest waitress (she's a busy lady - just know what you want to order so you don't keep her waiting), but just know and accept that going in - the food is totally worth it! EVERYTHING I've ordered here is tasty and amazing, and I've tried almost half the menu. Tons of vegetarian options! The only thing I didn't like was the eggplant sandwich - the bread was overtoasted and too hard. Here are my recommendations (sorry, I'm a pescetarian, so no meat suggestions):

Appetizers:
1) Vietnamese Shrimp Rolls - so fresh and delicious! Shrimp is tender and not chewy.
2) Seaweed Salad with Tobiko - so good! Wakame, lettuce, tobiko, miso dressing, and sesame seeds - pretty standard but done right.
2) Vietnamese Spring Rolls (Vegetarian) - yummy veggie alternative to the shrimp ones (tofu and shitake mushrooms instead of shrimp).

Entrees:
1) Ramen with Mixed Mushrooms in Soy Broth - the best I ever had! Even better than Japantown. Fresh, crisp veggies and a variety of mushrooms. Broth is tasty and noodles are perfectly done.
2) Spinach Noodles with Tofu and Mixed Mushrooms - my old standby. Flavorful and filling.
3) Rice Wine Tofu and Mushrooms over Rice - great light dish if you aren't that hungry. So very tasty!
4) Tamarind Tofu and Veggies over Rice - my bf's favorite! Lots of flavor and just the right amount of spiciness.
5) Garlic Basil Linguine with White Wine Sake Sauce - So yummy! If you need a garlic fix, this is for you!

Desserts:
1) Panne Cotta with Fruit Sauce - light, refreshing, and delish!
2) Mango Crepes (I think they are called mango pillows) - yummy! Pretty simple dish - ripe mangoes, whip cream, crepes - but oh so good!
3) Mango Bliss (buttermilk panna cotta and mango sorbet version) - tasty, refreshing, and fruity - a must if you love mangoes.

Drinks:
1) Hot Ginger Honey - my usual order, a definite must on a cold, foggy day/night. Fresh pressed ginger juice, water, and honey - oh so good for you!
2) Hot Milk Green Tea with Soy Milk - my go-to drink of choice if it weren't for the calories. Yummy milky goodness!
3) Hot Chai Latte - so tasty! Maybe not as authentic as the chai tea at Golden Gate Pizza and Indian Cuisine down the street, but still a tasty blend of spices and milk.

The parking sucks, as are the wait and service (hence the minus 1 star), but as I said before - THE FOOD IS WORTH IT!!!! Especially if you are vegetarian. Prices are reasonable and ambiance is cozy. They just expanded the seating so that should help with the late night rushes. Whenever I have family or friends visiting, I take them here and they love it too!
author: Kris F.

description:
As other reviewers have noted, the service is a bit slow here, but they have lots of magazines that you can browse through.  I assumed there would be more mango dishes in the food menu, but the only mango dish I could find was the mango fried rice.  All the mango dishes are in their dessert menu.  The menus were super cute, loved how they put it together with the little pictures of the food items so you have an idea of what you're ordering.  
I had the baked seafood with rice here and it was delicious!  Generous amounts of seafood including salmon, scallops, mussel, really large shrimp, white fish.  The best baked seafood I've had so far!  Didn't get a chance to try the mango dishes, maybe next time.
author: Honey X.

description:
went to this palace on New Years day , parking wasn't  a problem the restaurant is small and holds about 20-25 seat? . the food was average
but the sauce was good, price was a little more than many Asian restaurants and the service  good.
author: Howard J.

description:
how cute and refreshingly different!  hey, the server is slow but she's very cool!  there's not a lot of seating, but if you go with one other person and you get the cute window seats, it's great!  you melt in those super comfy chairs and gaze out the window listening to some uncategorized music.  i even enjoyed watching the N go by!
the drinks and desserts are great!  
one caveat (or you might like it) is the hong kong tea tastes like black licorice.  
whatever, i like the place!

UPDATE
from 4 to 5 stars!  it's my new favorite place to go (to eat on a date).  my girl and i went on valentines day.  the intimacy of this place is blissful.  dinner (with vegan options) is delicious, this asian fusion reminded me of home. 

you can find me here twice in one day.  the food is excellent!  usually i'll find a favorite dish at a place and always get it, but here, i need to try everything!  i've never been disappointed!
author: Monk R.

description: I give this place a 3 star because of the great and delicious food that ONE person cooks. I guess she is the cook, the cashier, the waitress, or whatever position she still holds. Yes, you have serve yourself hot tea and sometimes utensils. Customer is not the first to them, because they don't give a crap. I must say that waiting time would be 2.5 hours for waiting for the food to come and waiting for the check. For people who don't have patience, please don't go. =)
author: Elaine C.

description: On a late Saturday night, I ventured to the outer regions of the Sunset to find Mango Medley. Sadly, my experience was not so positive. The waitstaff was extremely slow - and by the time I received my food - over 30 minutes had passed with no apologies. Even with my hunger rage, the food did not taste good, nor bad either. My suggestion, get the dessert - mango sticky rice. I may have to give this place another try, but for now, I give it 3 stars.
author: Judy L.

description: Really great place.  The food here is really amazing.  Although it takes forever to get your food, you will find that it's well worth the wait.  There are so many options on the menu as well.  It's got a comfy feel to it and the best part is that it's open late.
author: Mike M.

description: I love this place! This is my favorite neighborhood spot. It's a very casual cafe,  not a formal restaurant sort of place so relax.  You can have dinner or just something to drink. They have a huge variety of noodle and rice dishes, salads and desserts, including a complete vegetarian menu with many vegan choices. Always tasty! They also have a huge drink menu. My favorite is the iced honey-citrus drink apparently its from the Phillipines.  You can also get white chocolate mochas and the like.  The staff, of two- one chef one server, is friendly, I've found, with a sense of humor.  It is always a nice experience and they are open late on weekends.
author: Jessica D.

description: Late lunch with a friend was had here just the other day and while we had originally made the attempt to go to the Real World Caf (sadly it was during their mid-day siesta) it was a likely and tempting alternative. The soup was delicious, the tofu and eggplant curry remarkably flavorful and the veggie spring rolls surprisingly good. The service itself was quick considering the fact there were only a few women working in the kitchen and one actually doing the hosting. I do enjoy the laid back atmosphere but I'm giving it four stars because the seating arrangments were a bit strange and akward but not entirely completely outrageous. The prices were pretty low as well, which is a plus, so I think I'll definitely be frequenting this place in the future.
author: Lydia H.

description: This dessert cafe is very cozy. Great place to hit if you just finished coming back from the beach. They have very comfy chairs. Recommended for people who just want to chit chat with someone else. They have good dessert too. Their little crepes are very tasty. Did I mention that their bathroom is GORGEOUS? You better use it if you go there.
author: Amy X.

description:
every time i eat here, or day dreaming eat foods from here.. i come across with the picture of Chinese god with depicted laughing and huge belly. 
somewhat i am always always in happy mood or at least trying to make myself happy, when i walk in to the front door of this restaurant. 
being Asian myself, i always have this feeling like i walk in to one of my aunt house and just be myself. no attitude adjustment needed.
the smell of some good stuff from the kitchen always bring a good aroma and comfort ~ just like walks in to your aunts house, i said.
the service always been impeccable. as i said, talk to her as you talk to your aunt. she will yell at you, when you naughty. 

5 stars ! no less no more. 
mango medley is deity of happiness indeed.

quote Megan W statement  "much like the outer sunset itself, this is a surreal, oddly lifeless place !" ~100 % agree !
author: sherly A.

description:
mango medley? the illiteration in the name should speak volumes for their creativity.

the service was a bit awkward; every time i wanted the waitress she was nowhere to be found, and evevry time i needed a minute, she was breathing down my neck. outside of the service, the food was quite interesting. fresh, healthy ingredients made for very inspiring cookery, and also a nice variation of hong kong style desserts. 

they even ventured to make healthy, organic, and even vegan dishes, including pastas; i myself tried the shrimp with basil tomato sauce over spinach vermicelli, which was quite good, if i am able to say. just a little bit of spiciness, perfectly cooked shrimp, and an interesting style of tomato sauce that combined arrabiata with marinara - a kind of happy medium. 

the decor seems a bit.. overthought. bright orange room, with a few actual tables with ikea-like seats on a tiny coffee table. 

however, this is definitely a nice place to eat and take your friends for a nice chat, or even an occasional snack. stop by if you're in the area.
author: Ben T.

description: The service here is SLOW and the waitress has an attitude that needs to be checked. I have never been to a restaurant with such poor service, had my menus rudely slapped on the table, ignored to be served and expected to wait over 1 hour for fried rice. After checking on my order of korean fried rice after an hour of waiting, the waitress just rolled her eyes at me. Finally when the Korean fried rice came out, it was missing the fried egg on top. The picture on the menu had an egg on top which was what I had expected. When I asked the waitress about this, she snapped and claimed I never told her to add the egg and that it was 'my fault' it wasn't added. Instead of calmly reacting, she scolded me in public like she had seriously bad PMS...waitress was unprofessional and lacked basic manners to say the least.
author: Peachie Y.

description: Note to reader: I am only rating their coffee not their restaurant. I have never eaten a meal hear but I do enjoy their coffee & espresso on a regular basis. The lady who owns it is always nice and talks to me about her dogs *the restaurant is named after them*. Their drinks are great, fresh, and fairly priced. A much better alternative to the crappy Java Beach. After reading the other reviews, I'm going to make a point to check out their menu.
author: Nikka B.

description: This place is so very fascinating. There are tons of retarded street signs on the wall, but the custard is yumme. The atmosphere was very, very relaxing and I enjoyed watching the twerpish, clumsy waitress trying to balance the plates, whilst stepping down the stairs in an awkward manner. A couple of weeks later i spotted her in her car, she is really a riot. There should be more twerps like her.
author: Roger W.

description: I really like this place.  I like the funky noodle dishes they have invented, and I love their hot ginger tea.  Very cool place.
author: Raphael R.

description:
This place is super cute, pretty affordable, and everything I've had is delicious. The only reason they don't get 5 stars is because the wait is usually quite long for your food (you can see the kitchen, it's tiny! And the girls serving also seem to be the ones cooking, so I can't really blame them for being slow).

Korean pancakes are delicious, great warm treat for a cold, foggy outer sunset evening. Free tea to drink! The seaweed salad is also very tasty. And the thai coconut milk soup is also delicious. I can't remember what else I've had, but I'm sure there were a few others, and all were great.
author: Brandi C.

description: Their baked spaghetti and pork chops dish is really good here.  They have a lot of cool dishes on their menu that you don't normally find at other restaurants, many containing none other than: MANGO! Duh. They serve a wide variety of desserts, but a bit expensive for the price they charge.  It's a great spot in the outer sunset to meet someone up for coffee or a drink because they have comfy seats near the window where you can just chat and lounge around. It's not loud like other dessert places, which is also good if you are taking one or two friends to catch up. Best of all, it's located a few blocks away from my boyfriend's house and closes fairly late!
author: Helen Z.

description: This is based on just the decor and the jasmine milk tea. The drink was cold and delicious and the decor is very cute. I like how its almost as if its two separate places (order at one and eat at the other). It has a cute little vibe to it, as if it wasn't in the US. I will be back after looking at those pictures on YELP.
author: Elaine H.

description: Mango Medley is an interesting place among SF restaurants - it is a coffeeshop and thai restaurant.  It is very simple, only 2 people running it at any one time - but the food is really good and cheap.
author: Nate K.

description: Service here is slooooooooooooooow...so only come here when you are feeling particularly patient, understanding and have time to lounge.  They have plenty of magazines for you to look though.  I must give them some credit for creativity- the place does look cute and the menu is somewhat original.  We scarfed everything down by the time that it arrived some 30 minutes later.  The portions are pretty small so you'll have plenty of room for dessert.  Must have been planned!
author: Judy K.

description: Been to this place a bunch of times.  Self-service on water and tea.  Takes them a while before they take your order and preparation time for those orders takes even longer.  I ordered a Coke and my friends ordered dessert, their dessert got to the table before my (can) Coke.  I could have walked down to 7/11 and bought one faster.  Why do we keep coming here?  Supporting the businesses of our neighborhood?  Just don't come here if you're in a hurry or really hungry.  You've got to have patience when entering this place.
author: D G.

description: This place isn't the best but it's ok, good place to go to if you want to waste some time if you got nothing better to do. I swear, you wait, eat and when you're acually done it's already 3 hours later then the time you've stepped into the place! I mean yah I like the food, the dessert, the drinks but it is so slow sometimes. There's this girl waitress with short short  hair, I don't like her. She rolls her eyes in front of you, cares less if you are satisfied with you food or whatever it is. yada yada simply said, I don't like her. I think there's only two workers there, they work even odd days; but I like the other girl waitress with the long hair. She's much more nicer and isn't as slow. I go back to this place once in a while but I only go if I don't have anything planned soon. Sometimes waiting for only a drink can take sooooo long.
author: Vivian H.

description:
prepare to wait 2-3 hrs for your food, not kidding!

tried everything on their happy hour menu & nothing stood out. Typical dessert place but with overpriced items compared to its portion size.

Japantown's crepes taste better than their "pillows"
author: cj d.

description: The deserts and salad are fantasic.  My all time favorites are Grapefruit Salad and Prawn Salad.  Don't expect good service here.  They only have one wait staff.   Basically, we do everything by ourselves.  We get our own table, clear up dirty dishes and grab menus and water for everyone.  If you are in a hurry, don't come here.  They only have one chef in the kitchen.  That's why I take out one star for their service. Parking is the pain in the Sunset District.
author: J L.

description:
Mango Medley.. I'm guessing their specialty is mango.  Unfortunately I just thought of that now, even after seeing several items on the menu with mango.  Not bright, I know. 

Just got back from this place, reviewing while it's fresh (first review after four months, woo hoo!).  The place isn't too big, the staff doesn't really talk to you much.  At about 9pm the place wasn't packed - only two other tables filled plus us.  Initially I thought it's just a cafe place, you know with drinks and all but of course I was wrong.  The menu is decent with a variety of options.  I ended up ordering the baked Portuguese spaghetti w/chicken.  It takes a longer wait, compared to like other Chinese restaurants.  The food was ok, it was definitely an interesting taste, not like the other baked Portuguese at Macau and Friends.  It wasn't too creamy, but not like watered down spaghetti sauce.  Oh and it's also not the type of restaurant where you get service, more like get your own tea, get your own chili sauce.  So I guess next time I should come here for dessert, because apparently by the time we left there were more people, and they all ordered only drinks and dessert.  Maybe after I try those I can give it a better rating.
author: Yosie G.

description: Fun, cozy little place that's great for tea drinks and dessert. Wait staff always seems frazzled, but in a way that's less a put-off than an endearing quirk. I've tried several entrees from the extensive dinner menu, but nothing I'd recommend unless you're in the mood for an after-bar snack; stick to drinks and desserts.
author: Nick R.

description: The entrees and desserts are great here but the wait seems like forever if you're totally famished. A good snack place in the afternoon after a walk on the beach. ^.~
author: Jason C. J.

description:
Well, I'm apparently in a minority--I've never had a problem with the service there or a ridiculous wait time for food. It's not five-star service, don't get me wrong--no one's fawning over you. But it's been friendly enough and serviceable.

Anyway, I'm a big fan of their drink menu here--their teas and refreshers  made with ginger and fresh fruits and citrus are something special.

The food is solid and can often be really tasty--sometimes it seems to have more zing than others, but I've never had a bad or really bland meal here. Fresh ingredients and some interesting little dishes. They've also got a really good array of vegan options, which is key for my veg wife. At any rate, I generally find it good and cheap--$7-$10 for entrees.

Decor's a little weird---it's more like a campus basement coffee-shop than an actual restaurant, but that doesn't bother me personally.

A really nice option in the Outer Sunset.
author: Joel R.

description: Wait is slow.  better to call and order to go.  open late.  My two dishes of choice are: curry noodles w/ tofu... and this chicken, mushroom, wine, rice dish... can't remember their exact names, but I've used my own made up nomenclature for my order and it's worked.  desserts are yummy! tokyo tea, as well as calamnsi juice w/ honey are good drinks.
author: rosalyn m.

description: The food is very good. However, need to wait about an hour to get the food. I order a wednesday special, choose one drink and one dessert. The sesame drink smell good, it is not like using powder to make the drink. The green tea pillow is specail too. I have not got this pillow skin long time. Bring me some good memory. The only thing i don't like is the service is VERY SLOW and we need to get the water by ourselves. Anyway, will go again when i have 3 hours for a meal.
author: Michelle Z.

description:
This place is awesome! Came here while visiting SF --- what a cute place. 
They have really good food and drinks. Prices are reasonable and everything we ordered was good and you can tell they use good/fresh ingredients. Just to warn you though.. it's a small place and they only have few people working there so depends on when you go you might have to wait for your food. They do have great magazines and great music playing so we didn't mind waiting and just hanging out. 
We went 2 times while visiting SF and here are what we ordered. 
-Seafood bake dish wok fried rice--- this is the best seafood bake HK style I have ever had!!! there were good amt of fresh shrimp, scallops, fish and veggie and the fried rice was sooooo good with the sake cream sauce. 
-kimchi fried rice- very good with good amt of kimchi and taste- trust me.. I have eaten lots of kimchi fried rice (I am korean! :)
-steak platter- my hubby loved the steak which was so tender and tasty
-ramen with grilled chicken thigh - oh it was sooooo good. i thought it was way better than ramen i paid $12 in japantown. Mango medley's was only $6.95 wtih a drink!!!  what a steal 
-seafood with spinach linguine!!!- very good tomato sauce and again lots of fresh seafood. 
- my favorite drink was the white chocolate whipped coffee
- green tea ice cream was delicious and mango pillow was to die for.... 

I wish seattle had a mango medley. Cute, comfortable place with good food and drinks... I can't wait to come back to SF and eat again at MM!!!
author: Shy z.

description: I don't understand all the hype over this place. Yeah, I've tried to eat there several times and everytime I've gone its like I'm invisible. I mean, what do you have to do to get someone to take your order besides reminding the waitress and staff numerous times? The last time I went (because I wanted to give them another shot) the place was messy and crowded. They had this one table that looked like someone's office, papers and junk everywhere. It was a definite turn-off. I say, "Don't believe the hype..."
author: Marilyn W.

description: a small cozy restaurant with tons of great selections. i like their sunday special. kimchi fried rice along with a drink and dessert for like 11$. nom nom nom!! their other dishes and desserts are great too! i had to knock off a star because i asked for a to-go cup and they wanted to charge me .50 cent! whaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaay?
author: Valerie N.

description:
I LOVE MANGO MEDLEY!

Yes their service is slow...
BUT, Their food is delicious and worth the wait. I love the waitress. It's always the same one, i think she might be the owner too. She pulls no punches. If she doesn't think you will like something you are ordering she will tell you, I like people like that. I aways go there alone and sit by the window and bring a nice book to read while i wait for my meal. The food is always worth the wait, especially their desserts. Their sticky rice with Mango is to die for.  Best thing yet, your wallet wont have to go hungry, at all.
author: Dios L.

description: both food and desserts are great! I would give it a 5 star rating, but slow service, i have to take a star away. my hubby ordered the chicken fettuccine with garlic and basil.....tasted very good, it's like a party in my mouth. the cream sauce is just right, the flavor has different layers..... worth coming if you are not in a rush!
author: L L.

description: My boyfriend and I were strolling down Judah street looking for something that was open late and to our delight we found Mango Medley. We ordered three small dishes a dessert and an iced Jasmine Tea drink.  The food was very flavorful and very different from most things we tasted. The dessert--banana puffs was very simple yet delicious. The Jasmine frappuccino exceeded my expectations, I can honestly say that it was the best green tea frappuccino I have ever had! Other than the mediocre service, it was a great experience.
author: Alina O.

description: They have a huge menu, everything looks great. The food was hot and delicious! Service was a bit slow (it was not busy) but worth the wait. Decent prices.
author: vanessa r.

description: Food is always good; sometimes slow, but understandably so. (I think there's only like two people in the kitchen). They make every dish individually and I like that, very home-cooked and thoughtful in taste, never flat. I love the linguine, and the spinach noodle. Never really had their desserts, but everything else is pretty good. Good and consistent, save bet; just don't go there if you are very very hungry and demand food NOW.
author: Lulu M.

description:
I just loved this place.  The food was wonderful and it captured a bit of the old spirit of the Sunset near the beach.  In fact, this little block of Judah is an awesome casual spot for a weekend brunch / lunch

Yes it is small and the idea is to hang out while you wait for the one waitress - who might be cooking as well.  No matter - fire up your laptop or read a magazine.  I had a curry noodle dish that was absolutely delicious and homemade.  The menu has all types of noodles including some italian dishes and tons of Asian fusion ones.
author: K O.

description: Outstanding cuisine! Their talented chef creates astonishingly delicious combinations of flavors. They have an excellent vegetarian menu and terrific teas too. Comfortable unpretentious atmosphere for dining (try a ginger soda while you wait!)--or you can order food to go.
author: Maria R.

description: this place is what i call a hole in the wall.  from reading the past reviews, i understand the frustrations of other yelpers however, i guess that's why they have plenty of magazines for customers while they wait.  the food was really good and i LOVED the desserts.....go at a leisure time or when u feel like reading a book......
author: sharon q.

description:
the first time i went there i took the server to be so rude i thought we might have to strap on boxing gloves to settle our communication break down over the diff between the small and large ramen bowl (she said "well, the large is larger than the small" and smirked at me). now, months later, i have developed an understanding of the Mango Way. 

mostly, it's cynical and damn slow. i asked the server/owner the other day "Hey, how's it going?" and she looked at me like i was too few mango's on the tree and said "what do you think?".   

i suggested to my man the other day that we do our taxes there. i have finished several books in their orange lounge chairs. it forces you to slow down. don't go in a rush, expect at least an hour. till you get brought menus. maybe. if you are lucky. 

the food is good and oddly diverse and pretty cheap, they have great spicey ginger tea with honey. they serve crepes with mangoes and cool wip. fucking cool wip. i love it. 

but that's the problem with the Mango Way. they have opted to give you too much menu choice and omitted the line on the menu that should say "if you are ordering the baked korean spagehtti with curry chicken and tofu then you will slow down the whole gig for everyone else including you". 

ah well. take it slow and welcome to the outer sunset.
author: Maggie Baggie H.

description: What a discovery! In this little charming restaurant you can experience the art of cooking in a direct, unpretentious, totally down to earth and honest way. Every dish is created by the two owners who are inspired by various Asian cuisines as well as a great love for culinary originality. If you are looking for freshly made, gourmet quality, low price dishes with the best ingredients that make your eyes, tongue and palate gow WOW, Mango Medley is the place to go!!!!! It's only a few blocks from Ocean Beach, right on the N-Line. And if you are craving a hot, delicious, totally chocolaty not too sweet Mocha, you will also find it here. You can sit at Mango Medley for hours chatting with friends, spending the afternoon. Yes, the service is not the fastest, due to the fact that two women run everything alone, which keeps the prices so affordable, but if you keep in mind that the food is actually being prepared from scratch while you wait, you just bring an interesting conversation topic or a good book.
author: Ursula S.

description: I have to say that Mango Medley is a kind of cute place that I go to eat at.  Yes I know their service somewhat slow, but the food is pretty good.  I think my favorite is the mango pockets...sounds like the wrong name but I'm sure you know what I'm talking about...it's the mangos in crepe skin with cream.  I didn't think the ice cream one was as good cuz I got mixed up and ordered it wrong once so i got to try it....but hey, if ice cream is your forte then go right on ahead and order this.  They've got a happy hour during lunch and late night I think and you can order cheaper items from the menu.  I took my vegetarian friend here and she was pretty content.  And yes...self serve for things like utensils and tea.   Atleast you don't have to wait for that.  Setting is pretty simple and cute with overpriced paintings and photos on the wall...(i really don't think anyone will pay 100 bucks for a chicken painting.)  Milk tea is good too...have yet to try other drinks...if you guys wanna came here faster, drive down sunset instead of 19th avenue.
author: LittleBird 8.

description: long wait, slow service, almost a self-service dessert place.  very casual joint with pretty good chinese-style dessert.  they try to make everything homemade but the menu could be seasonal to weekly to daily.  its a star above most chinese dessert joints.  a lil pricey tho.  have yet to try their dinners.
author: amee m.

description: The food is just okay. Nothing special. Somewhat boring. The only dish I can recommend is the Spicy Mango Salad with Prawns. That was pretty good. The other two dished we ordered were Thai Sauce Spaghetti with Chicken and Fresh Pineapple Baked Riced. The Pineapple was indeed fresh but besides that, the dished were kind of unimpressive.
author: Eleonore L.

description: you won't walk into this place expecting to be served food with fresh cilantro, ginger, lemongrass, garlic, basil, etc. looks more like a freshman lounge than a restaurant. had to ding it a star for presentation, but man once they put the food in front of you, prepare to be happy.
author: makaha f.

description: it's been a long time since my last visit. and tonight, i may have rediscovered an old time favorite for date night with my husband. we've been so caught up in the rush and bustle of a busy life, so the so-called "slower" service was to our benefit. i started out with the hot jasmine green milk tea. and it was perfect with the cool weather in the outer sunset. it was so nice have a night to ourselves without the loud and rushed feeling that you get at other restaurants. this place has a nice feel of a coffee house/cafe/restaurant all in one. i ordered the chicken wasabi with shitaki mushrooms with seaweed salad toppings. it is definitely something different....a very good different.  the flavors worked very well together.  my husband ordered the baked pork chopped over rice. he enjoyed it as well...perhaps not as much as my entree.  for dessert, we ended with the pureed mango with mango slices in tofu.  we were delight by the intense mango flavor.  they used quality ingredients, not like some dessert places where they use cheap and unripe fruit.
author: hello k.

description: this is definitely a gem!  small, comfy, great food.  but make sure you have time to wait for dinner.  because this is a homestyle restaurant, meaning one cook, one wait staff so each meal is personalized, you can say.  and takes a bit of time.  order everything right away and it will come out accordingly.  and it's worth the wait.  great food!  definitely go back. bring cash, no charge.
author: Silver C.

description: Nice selection on the menu (though the photos are kinda blurry), and I love that they have coffee drinks with Asian snacky snacks. The decor is Ikea cozy, but the bathroom is lit by a dim purple light, which sets a great mood....if it weren't in the bathroom. The roti was pretty good, and the Korean pancakes were yummy too (but my friend thought they were too potato-ey? hah). I had the shrimp and spinach noodles, and even though it looked like they were in plain ol' marinara sauce, it's a tomato sauce with basil and possibly fish sauce, which I suppose makes it "Asian fusion" to some extent. They had a lot of veggie (and even some vegan) options too. The one pitfall of this place is the service. I don't know if we caught the waitress on a bad day or what, but she didn't smile the entire time we were there. We brought in a dessert to eat afterward and almost weren't allowed to eat it (even though we had ordered appetizers, drinks, and a meal!). It's still worth checking out though.
author: Tami H.
